article_title: CRPF Pays Tributes To Jawan On His First Death Anniversary
event: SRINAGAR — Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) on Wednesday paid rich tributes to Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year.According to a statement, Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year had joined 23 Bn CRPF on 21/10/2004 and Served in various parts of Country.

article_title: CRPF Pays Tributes To Jawan On His First Death Anniversary
event: Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year joined 23 Bn CRPF at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar Srinagar on 07/02/2015.“He was deployed at Pampori Bhawan of Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year, when few militants started indiscriminate firing on Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year from the window of Pampori Bhawan of Karan Nagar,” a statement reads.Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year fought with bravery but at last died at the spot.

article_title: CRPF Pays Tributes To Jawan On His First Death Anniversary
event: Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year was a very brave soldier of 23 Bn CRPF and displayed conspicuous Courage and sacrificed Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year's supreme life in the interest of Country,” a statementfurther reads.While paying tributes to Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year, all Personnel of 23 Bn CRPF gathered at one place and wreath lying Ceremony was observed.According to a statement, Unit Commandant Udai Pratap Singh contacted to the family of Constable Shankar Lal Barala of 23 Bn CRPF, who was killed in a shootout at Karan Nagar, locality of Srinagar, last year and assured the family of Barala for all type of possible assistance in coming days.

article_title: Why Pakistan's Historical Heroes Are India's Villains And Vice-Versa
event: Pakistani nationalism was modelled around the 'valour' of Muslim kings who ruled the sub-continent for several centuries and India does the same with India's ruling party aggressively rephrasing history to promote Hindu nationalism.Partitioned along religious lines in 1947, India and Pakistan became Hindu and Muslim-dominant countries respectively, resulting in the exodus of a large Hindu population from Pakistan into India, and vice versa.

article_title: Why Pakistan's Historical Heroes Are India's Villains And Vice-Versa
event: In the years to come, as India and Pakistan constructed ‘national stories’, history with all history with all its characters's characters was also partitioned into Pakistani and Indian versions.The complexity, contradictions and the continuity of history was neatly compartmentalised into Muslim, Hindu and Sikh history.

article_title: Why Pakistan's Historical Heroes Are India's Villains And Vice-Versa
event: Muslim kings such as Mahmud Ghaznvi, Babur, and Aurangzeb, who had either raided India or ruled India directly as a result of these invasions, became heroes of India for Muslims.

article_title: Why Pakistan's Historical Heroes Are India's Villains And Vice-Versa

event: We felt We will die in jail,” says Latif Ahmed Baja with a deep sense of loss.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Latif Ahmed Baja stepped out of Jaipur jail along with two other Kashmiris—Ali Muhammad Bhatt (48) and Mirza Nisar (39— after being acquitted by the Rajasthan High Court on Monday, 23 years after We were arrested and lodged in different jails in connection with a bomb blast in a bus at Samleti in Rajasthan.the Rajasthan High Court acquitted six accused, three of six accused, three of them from Kashmir from Kashmir.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Sentences of two other convicts were upheld by the Rajasthan High Court.Latif Ahmed Baja had been incarcerated from 8 June 1997 while two others were imprisoned from 17 June 1996, and 27 July 1996.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: During this time, We were lodged in jails in Delhi, Jaipur, and Gujarat, but were never released on parole or bail.Latif Ahmed Bajatwo other Kashmiris—Ali Muhammad Bhatt (48) and Mirza Nisar (39—Mirza Nisar (39, were detained soon after a bomb blast on a bus on the Jaipur-Agra Highway on May 22, 1996.All the three were released as the prosecution failed to prove We's involvement after being held for over 23 years in different jails.

event: While acquitting We, the Rajasthan High Court said the prosecution had failed to provide evidence of the conspiracy.

event: around a dozen of cops bundled We in a vehicle and drove We towards Delhi,” Latif Ahmed Baja said.Latif Ahmed Baja says We were detained for a week in a local police station and were produced in Delhi court for remand.

event: human rights groups of Jaipur and members of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind played a crucial role in We's acquittal and mounted pressure on the jail authorities after We were attacked,” Latif Ahmed Baja claims.According to Latif Ahmed Baja, the jail superintended Mohan Chand Rakesh Sharma was so  “ruthless”  that even after our acquittal, the jail superintended Mohan Chand Rakesh Sharma wasn't happy to let We go and told We how were We acquitted.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Few places so mesmerising carry the pain of Kashmir.The Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand Pakistan, has been a hideout for Islamabad-backed militants; witnessed the forced expulsion of a Hindu community as authorities did nothing; and seen a Muslim-majority area become home to 500,000 Indian troops reportedly responsible for widespread abuses.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: The Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand Pakistan is place burdened both by history and the desire for something better.Into this mix now steps Donald Trump.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Meeting this week in the Oval Office with Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan, Donald Trump offered to act as a mediator between the two neighbours.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Donald Trump claimed was asked to perform such as role by India’s Narendra Modi.Donald Trump was with India’s Narendra Modi two weeks ago and India’s Narendra Modi actually said, ‘Would Donald Trump like to be a mediator, or an arbitrator?’ And Donald Trump said, 'Where?'

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: And India’s Narendra Modi said ‘Kashmir’,” said Donald Trump.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: “If Donald Trump can help, Donald Trump would love to be a mediator.”For those with any knowledge of India’s or Pakistan, it was a moment when jaws dropped.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Why would India’sthe two neighbours, have asked Donald Trump to become involved?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Within an hour, Delhi made clear Delhi had not requested Washington’s assistance after all.Immediately, scorn was heaped on Donald Trump.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: What did Donald Trump know about Kashmir, other than the fitted sweaters worn by the First Lady?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Why would Donald Trump risk antagonising a democratic Asian giant the US wants as a counterweight to China?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: And what in heaven’s name could Donald Trump actually do about Kashmir anyway?There’s another way to view this, and another way to view this starts with a record of failure.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: For 70 years, the two neighbours have mutually obsessed over The Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand PakistanThe Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand Pakistan's .

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Three times the two neighbours have gone to war.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: At the same time, the two neighbours have largely ignored the concerns of the people of Kashmir.On the Pakistan side, Islamabad has dismissed the requests of Azad Kashmir and Gilgit-Baltistan, which want to become full provinces and secure more rights.On India’s's part, in the late 1980s Delhi did nothing as countless thousands of Hindu Pandits were forced from the Kashmir Valley while an insurgency against Delhi by the Muslim community, furious over a fixed election, gathered force.Since then, half a million troops and paramilitaries have set up razor wire and bunkers across towns such as Srinagar, frequently killing stone-throwing youths.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: The military is protected by a shameful piece of legislation, the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA), which effectively gives The military a free hand.Attendant to protected, Delhi Islamabad have used Kashmir as a strategic pawn — Pakistan in Pakistan's appeals to the UN about alleged Indian human rights abuses; and India’s by choosing to ignore local demands for greater autonomy by writing local demands for greater autonomy off as Pakistan-produced propaganda.It’s not a great record.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Up to 75,000 soldiers, civilians and police officers have lost Up to 75,000 soldiers, civilians and police officers's lives, in attacks, explosions or cross-border bombing.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: All this in a land of houseboats and poetry, that until the mid-1980s was a tourist’s dream, as well as the location for numerous Bollywood movies.It is not as though large numbers in the two neighbours do not want peace.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: In 2001, Pakistan's Pervez Musharraf and India’s's Atal Bihari Vajpayee almost brokered a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border.As it was, a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border with not seized, and the two neighbours fell back into an angry standoff, with hundreds of thousands of troops amassed at the border.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: For several months in late 2001 and early 2002, foreign diplomats based in the two neighbours believed the two neighbours were about to engage in a catastrophic war.the two neighbours currently have a better chance at brokering a deal than ever before.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan has the support of Pakistan's powerful military, which would have to sign off on a deal.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Modi occupies an equally strong position, being as Modi is a Hindu nationalist leader who just won re-election by a landslide.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Because of occupies, any peace effort would have a better chance of not being undermined by hardliners, as happened to earlier efforts involving Rajiv Gandhi and Benazir Bhutto.It helps, too, that Khan, the former cricketer, is hugely admired by Pakistan's neighbours.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Khan, the former cricketer once said: “Khan, the former cricketer, for one, have received so much love in India’s.”The US’s role would be to act as guarantor of a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: It would demand Pakistan put an end to cross-border incursions, and call on the two neighbours to demilitarise.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: It would treat the two neighbours as equal partners in a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border, and display transparency.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Such a deal would provide stability not just to Kashmir, but to the broader region, including Pakistan.Does Donald Trump know anything about Kashmir?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: But the scenes of Donald Trump crossing into North Korea with Kim Jong-un were genuinely remarkable.the two neighbours, secured the two neighbours's independence amid the bloody and murderous experience of Partition.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice

article_title: Bill to Designate Individual as Terrorist Passed in LS
event: NEW DELHI — The Lok Sabha on Wednesday approved a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant with Home Minister Amit Shah asserting this is of "prime importance" to nip militancy in the bud.Stoutly defending the amendments to UAPA to make UAPA "strict", Home Minister Amit Shah also allayed fears of the opposition parties on UAPA's misuse, saying UAPA will keep the investigation agencies "four steps" ahead of the terrorists.Replying to a debate on a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant before a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant was passed by voice vote, Home Minister Amit Shah said though UAPA will not be misused against any individual, yet, those who engage in terrorist activities against the security and sovereignty of the government, including the 'urban maoists', would not be spared by the investigation agencies either.Reiterating the zero tolerance policy of the Modi government against terrorism, Home Minister Amit Shah said the objective of the amendments to the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act(UAPA) is to facilitate speedy investigation and prosecution of terror offences and designating an individual as terrorist in line with the international practices.An individual's psychology is the birth place of terrorism, rather than an institution.

article_title: Bill to Designate Individual as Terrorist Passed in LS

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: NEW DELHI — Lok Sabha on Thursday passes the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: Several amendments moved by the Opposition were defeated.The clause in the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq which criminalises the practice of instant triple talaq with a jail term of upto three years for the husband was passed by a division of 302 in favour and 78 against.the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq will now be tabled in Rajya Sabha, where the Opposition is numerically higher than the ruling side.Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said that the practice of instant triple talaq is practiced only in one community, therefore, a law banning the practice of instant triple talaq cannot be applied for any other community.Earlier during Thursday, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad defended the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq, saying  the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq was a must for gender equality and justice and despite the Supreme Court striking down the practice of instant triple talaq as illegal and unconstitutional, several hundred cases have been reported.Replying to the debate on the Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019 in Lok Sabha, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad questioned the Opposition to up to three-year jail term for the husband who gives the practice of instant triple talaq.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: "When Hindus and Muslims are jailed under dowry law or Domestic Violence Act, no one objects.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: What is the objection in penalising the practice of instant triple talaq," Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.Several opposition parties bitterly opposed the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq, but the government asserted that the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq is a step towards gender equality and justice.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: Parties like the Congress, the Trinamool Congress and the DMK demanded that the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq be sent to a parliamentary committee for scrutiny.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: Some of the BJP's allies, including the JD(U), also expressed Some of the BJP's allies, including the JD(U)'s reservation about the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq.Under the Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019, divorcing through the practice of instant triple talaq will be illegal, void and would attract a jail term of three years for the husband.Earlier, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said to allay fears that the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq could be misused, the government has included certain safeguards in the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq such as adding a provision of bail for the accused before trial.While the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq makes the practice of instant triple talaq a "non-bailable" offence, an accused can approach a magistrate even before trial to seek bail.In a non-bailable offence, bail cannot be granted by police at the police station the police station itself.A provision has been added to allow the magistrate to grant bail "after hearing the wife", Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq was passed by the Lok Sabha in December last year but lapsed in Rajya Sabha, where the opposition is numerically higher than the ruling side after the dissolution of the Lower House.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: The current bill seeks to replace an ordinance for the practice of instant triple talaq which was issued by the cabinet last February.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: SRINAGAR — Jammu and Kashmir will be part of a joint working group announced on Thursday  by the chief ministers of northern states to share experiences and best practices to tackle the menace of drug abuse.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: In a joint statement, the chief ministers of Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand, as well as top officials from Delhi, Jammu and Kashmir, and Chandigarh, agreed on a series of powerful measures to eradicate the drugs problem in the region, Press Trust of India reported.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: The event was also attended by officials of the Intelligence Bureau, Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) and other central agencies.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: a series of powerful measures to eradicate the drugs problem in the region included joint operations at the interstate borders, information sharing and implementation of the best practices of the participating states, a joint statement said.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: There was consensus among the participating states on the importance of strengthening the information-sharing mechanism on drugs, drug dealers and smugglers for an effective crackdown.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states agreed to launch major awareness programmes to make the eradication of drugs a peoples' movement, a joint statement said.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: The event proposed to jointly press the Centre to come out with a national drugs policy in order to effectively tackle the menace of drug abuse.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states also agreed to urge the Centre to establish a regional drug dependence treatment centre in Chandigarh on the lines of the National Drug Dependence Treatment Centre (NDDTC), AIIMS, New Delhi.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states agreed to consider opening a regional training centre in Chandigarh for training of investigators for proper investigation of the cases under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: "We believe that these efforts will go a long way in eradicating the menace of drug abuse from the region, thus protecting our youth and our future generations, and ensuring a safe, secure and healthy society," according to a joint statement.

event: Do people really understand climate change and global warming?

event: A few days of unseasonal chill brings back the sceptic in everyone – if the earth is getting hotter then why are we experiencing low temperatures, is a common question.That the earth is getting hotter is no longer a moot question.

event: It is.

event: But will the heat kill you?

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: But a changing climate is moving that comfort zone for many animals, including disease-carrying mosquitoes.Mosquitoes are the deadliest animals in the earth.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: Mosquitoes's ability to carry and spread disease to humans causes millions of deaths every year.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: The worldwide incidence of dengue has risen 30-fold in the past 30 years, now infecting as many as 400 million people a year, with a quarter of as many as 400 million people a year sick enough to be hospitalized, and more countries are reporting more countries's first outbreaks of dengue.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: Zika, dengue, chikungunya, and yellow fever are all transmitted to humans by the Aedes aegypti  and Aedes albopictus mosquitoes, to name just two species.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: prediction models  of the likely spread of two key disease-spreading mosquitoes -- Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus forecast that by 2050, 49 percent of the earth's population will live in places where the Aedes aegypti  and Aedes albopictus mosquitoes, to name just two species are established, if greenhouse gas emissions continue at current rates.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!

event: Aedes albopictus spread most quickly between 1990 and 1995.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: WASHINGTON —  The US government will resume The US government's use of capital punishment after a 16-year hiatus and has set execution dates for five convicted murderers, Attorney General Bill Barr announced on Thursday.Acting on President Donald Trump’s call for tougher penalties on violent crimes, Attorney General Bill Barr directed the Federal Bureau of Prisons to adopt a new lethal injection protocol to clear the way to carry out death sentences.“The Justice Department upholds the rule of law — and “The Justice Department owe it to the victims and the victims's families to carry forward the sentence imposed by The US government's justice system,” Attorney General Bill Barr said in a statement.There were 25 executions in The US government last year, all carried out by state authorities on people convicted on state charges.But debate about the methods of execution and controversy over the drugs used, as well as reticence from President Donald Trump’s's predecessor Barack Obama, means that no federal prisoner has been put to death since Attorney General Bill Barr ordered the Federal Bureau of Prisons to carry out executions using a single lethal injection of the barbiturate pentobarbital, replacing the previous, three-drug cocktails using thiopental.“Since 2010, 14 states have used the barbiturate pentobarbital in over 200 executions, and federal courts, including the Supreme Court, have repeatedly upheld the use of pentobarbital in executions as consistent with the Eighth Amendment” of the constitution, which bars cruel and unusual punishment, “The Justice Department said.There are 62 federal death row prisoners in The US government, according to the Death Penalty Information Center, including Islamist Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was convicted of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing that left three people dead.62 federal death row prisoners in the US also includes white supremacist Dylann Roof, who murdered nine African Americans in a Charleston, South Carolina church in 2015.On Attorney General Bill Barr's order, the Federal Bureau of Prisons has scheduled executions for five convicted murderers.Executions in The US government are nearly all carried out by states.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: Twenty-five of the 50 US states maintain an active death penalty, while 21 do not allow an active death penalty and four have suspended an active death penalty's use.Federal executions were on hold for nearly four decades until 2001, when Oklahoma City bomber Timothy McVeigh was executed.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: Two more people were put to death in federal prisons over the subsequent two years, and then Federal executions were halted again.Obama, president from 2009 to 2017, was not fundamentally opposed to an active death penalty but questioned an active death penalty's application.“The Justice Department has pressed to toughen “The Justice Department's stance on death penalty cases since President Donald Trump’s came to office, but Attorney General Bill Barr move also comes as President Donald Trump’s seeks to bolster President Donald Trump’s's law-and-order credentials ahead of next year’s election.Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who is running for president, condemned Barr’s move.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: “Let Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who is running for president be clear: capital punishment is immoral and deeply flawed.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: Too many innocent people have been put to death,” Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who is running for president tweeted.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: “We need a national moratorium on an active death penalty, not a resurrection.”

article_title: What Trump’s Mediation On Kashmir Means
event: US President Donald Trump’s bombshell that US President Donald Trump’s would like to mediate the vexed Kashmir conflict has set the stage for a high profile diplomatic tug-of-war between India and Pakistan involving India.

event: While US President Donald Trump’s's keenness to play the mediator in the vexed Kashmir conflict India and Pakistan has enthused many, India appears less keen.

article_title: What Trump’s Mediation On Kashmir Means
event: There are historical reasons for India's reluctance to third-party intervention on Kashmir, which we will dwell upon later.On Monday during a much publicised joint press conference with Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan at the Oval Office, US President Donald Trump’s set the proverbial cat among pigeons by offering to broker peace talks over the Kashmir region that remains a sore point in India-Pakistan relations.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: SRINAGAR — Deputy Commissioner SRINAGAR Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary Thursday convened a meeting to discuss the issue of harassment of women in public transport.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: a meeting to discuss the issue of harassment of women in public transport discussed the measures that need to be taken to prevent the issue of harassment of women in public transport — like creating awareness about what constitutes harassment and taking prompt and strict action against instances harassment.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Members of a non-profit trust Kashmir Women's Collective who attended a meeting to discuss the issue of harassment of women in public transport shared Members of a non-profit trust Kashmir Women's Collective who attended the meeting's understanding of the depth of the issue of harassment of women in public transport and ideas about how the issue of harassment of women in public transport could be tackled.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Members of a non-profit trust Kashmir Women's Collective who attended the meeting stressed the need for a mechanism that encourages women to speak out against and report instances of sexual harassment on public transport and the importance of the administration taking strict actions which will act as deterrence and help prevent the issue of harassment of women in public transport.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: The need for spreading awareness about what harassment means and an effective response mechanism was also stressed with Members of a non-profit trust Kashmir Women's Collective who attended the meeting a non-profit trust Kashmir Women's Collective calling for a widespread campaign about harassment.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Need for training of police personnel and drivers and conductors and having a helpline in place that will help at all times and in all circumstances was also emphasised.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Speaking on the occasion Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said it was important that the issue of harassment of women in public transport was acknowledged adding that there was indeed a need for an effective response mechanism in place to deal with the issue of harassment of women in public transport.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary agreed that awareness about the issue of harassment of women in public transport was a prerequisite and assured that the administration will do all that is required to do in that direction.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary urged a non-profit trust Kashmir Women's Collective to join hands with the administration assuring of serious and time-bound efforts to put in place a mechanism aimed at stopping the issue of harassment of women in public transport.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: SSP Traffic Tahir Gilani and SP Srinagar Majid Malik who were also present in a meeting to discuss the issue of harassment of women in public transport while speaking on the occasion said the issue of harassment of women in public transport indeed demands attention and expressed the eagerness of SSP Traffic Tahir Gilani and SP Srinagar Majid Malik who were also present in the meeting while speaking on the occasion's concerned departments to help and tackle the issue of harassment of women in public transport.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Others including RTO Kashmir Ikramullah Tak and ADC Srinagar K K Sidha also spoke on the occasion.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: ADC Srinagar K K Sidha said the issue of harassment of women in public transport is a part of the larger problem of violence against women and stressed the need to resist and deal with all forms of violence.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: ADC Srinagar K K Sidha said an initiative of the administration which will be launched soon will do just that.

article_title: Measures Discussed To Prevent Harassment Of Women In Public Transport
event: Senior officers from all concerned departments of the administration were present in a meeting to discuss the issue of harassment of women in public transport.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: SRINAGAR — Most areas here were Thursday inundated due to rainfall with officials blaming missed deadlines to fix SRINAGAR's faulty drainage system owing to paucity of funds for the mess.rainfall caused severe waterlogging in the most parts of SRINAGAR resulting in inconvenience to the public.rainfall started early Thursday morning, bringing much needed relief from the sweltering heat wave from last few days.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: However, as rainfall continued for several hours, rainfall brought about chaos and made the commute to work a nightmare.Report said rainwater pools of different sizes were formed on the roads in different places as drainage system is mostly clogged.Pedestrians complained about waterlogging in Lal Chowk, the commercial hub of SRINAGAR as many vehicles splashed Pedestrians with muddy water.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: At several places, Pedestrians had to wade through ankle-height water, reports added.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: At some busy and important junctions including Regal Chowk, the pedestrians preferred to hire auto-rickshaw to cross the roads.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: Most of the public transport went off the roads due to waterlogging which hampered the smooth movement of traffic.The problem was compounded by the defunct drainage system in various areas.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: the defunct drainage system in various areas, according to locals led to the waterlogging.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: According to reports, the Srinagar Municipal Corporation has missed the deadlines of completing various drainage projects, despite Rs 50 crore funding.The scheme covers drainage projects of various area like Shalteng (19430 mtr) at a cost of 14.77 Crore, Lal Chowk, the commercial hub of the Valley (5786 mtr) at cost of Rs 9.96, Indra Nagar (6820 mtr) at a cost of Rs 9.83 crore, Gangroh (5680 mtr) at Rs 8.80 crore, and Mallabagh (37,656 mtr).

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: The deadline for most projects was Oct 2018.Executive Engineer, SMC Drainage wing, Aazad Ahmad Beigh said that SMC Drainage wing couldn’t complete the drainage project in SRINAGAR due to lack of funds.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: “We require 1335 kilometers of drainage in SRINAGAR but SMC Drainage wing could complete only 623 and 712 is yet to be completed and for that SMC Drainage wing need at least Rs 1100 crores,” 2018.Executive Engineer, SMC Drainage wing, Aazad Ahmad Beigh said.Due to court stay, 2018.Executive Engineer, SMC Drainage wing, Aazad Ahmad Beigh said, SMC Drainage wing couldn’t complete the Lal Chowk, the commercial hub of the Valley de-watering project on time which results in massive water-logging in the area.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: “Now SMC Drainage wing have started working on the Lal Chowk de-watering project and it will take SMC Drainage wing just a month to complete the Lal Chowk de-watering project.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: Then there would be no waterlogging,” 2018.Executive Engineer, SMC Drainage wing, Aazad Ahmad Beigh said.2018.Executive Engineer, SMC Drainage wing, Aazad Ahmad Beigh further said that the water-logging happens in metropolitan cities too.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: “When the water goes beyond drainage capacity, the water-logging will happen,” 2018.Executive Engineer, SMC Drainage wing, Aazad Ahmad Beigh said.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: SMC Drainage wing has already missed a deadline for completion of the de-watering station in Lal Chowk, the commercial hub of the Valley in June 2017.The drainage system in SRINAGAR, especially in SRINAGAR, was badly hit during the 2014 floods.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: The Housing and Urban Development Department (HUDD) has not been able to restore 2017.The drainage system in the valley, especially in Srinagar city permanently.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: However, the World Bank had agreed to provide funds for the restoration of 2017.The drainage system in the valley, especially in Srinagar city.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: “the World Bank had agreed to provide funds for 42 dewatering stations of SRINAGAR,” an official of The Housing and Urban Development Department (HUDD) said.Junaid Mattoo, Mayor of SRINAGAR, in a series of tweets blamed paucity of funds for 2017.The drainage system in the valley, especially in Srinagar city.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: “Waterlogging in SRINAGAR is a consequence of decades of neglect and we can’t possibly expect Waterlogging in the city to resolve within two hours while it’s raining.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: The SMC Drainage wing mobilization is optimal and we's Dewatering Units are fire fighting to the best of our Dewatering Units's capacity.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: we need MAJOR drainage funding!” Junaid Mattoo, Mayor of Srinagar tweetedIn the second tweet Junaid Mattoo, Mayor of Srinagar blamed people for the flood like situation.

article_title: Water,Water Everywhere…Missed Deadlines,Paucity Of Funds Clogging City Roads
event: “Introspection!” Junaid Mattoo, Mayor of Srinagar said.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: DRASS — As India commemorated 20 years of the Kargil war, Army Chief General Bipin Rawat on Thursday warned Pakistan to never attempt a repeat of the "misadventure".Speaking at a ceremony for commemoration of 20 years of the Kargil war Kargil Vijay Diwas, Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "Army Chief General Bipin Rawat's warning to Pakistan is do not ever attempt such a misadventure any time, in the future.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Anywhere, anytime do not think of such a misadventure.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: ""It was a big misadventure undertaken by the Pakistan army in 1999.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Pakistan did not appreciate the will and the intent of the Indian political establishment and the Indian armed forces that we will never allow Pakistan to succeed," Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said.Referring to the advantageous position Pakistani infiltrators occupied during the Kargil war, Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "No matter what heights Pakistani infiltrators capture we will always get back to Pakistani infiltrators and recapture those heights.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: This was evident during the Kargil war in 1999.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: "Commenting on the question of Pakistan's denial about Pakistan's involvement in Pulwama attack, Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "we are aware of the truth.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: So we are not carried away by any statement.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: the truth is known to we.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Our intelligence agencies have given ample proof about what had happened in Pulwama.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: "When asked about manufacture of arms in India, Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "Make in India has already commenced.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Guns, helicopters are being manufactured in India.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: we are also looking for ammunitions manufacturing in India.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Now AK 203 with a joint venture with Russia will be manufactured in Amethi...we will be happy if anyone willing to share technologies with we.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Army Chief General Bipin Rawat would say technologies will be gainer as we have a huge market here.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: Once a weapon is tested here by we, a weapon gets world famous.

article_title: Army Chief Warns Pak Against Repeat Of Kargil
event: "On being asked about infiltration after Balakot air strike, Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "Infiltration has come down because of two reasons one is because we's troops are sitting alert and we have also inducted additional forces to strengthen the counter-infiltration grid."

article_title: Govt Open To Talks Within Constitution: MHA
event: SRINAGAR — Government is always open to talks within the framework of the Constitution of India, Ministry of Home Affairs headed by Amit Shah said on Wednesday.Responding to a question by Rajya Sabha member Amar Singh whether Government has chalked out any plan for the peaceful resolution of Kashmir issue which is pending for the last several decades, minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy the security situation in SRINAGAR has witnessed an improvement in the first half of this year over the corresponding period of 2018.“Government has taken various measures, such as strengthening of security apparatus, strict enforcement of law against anti-national elements, intensified cordon and search operations to effectively deal with the challenges posed by the (militant) organizations,” minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy said in written reply in Upper House of Parliament.“Net infiltration has reduced by 43% and local recruitment has declined by 40%.

article_title: Govt Open To Talks Within Constitution: MHA
event: (Militant) initiated incidents have declined by 28%.

article_title: Govt Open To Talks Within Constitution: MHA
event: Actions initiated by the security forces witnessed an increase of 59% and have resulted in 22% increase in neutralization of (militants),” minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy said.Government, minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy added, is always open to talks within the framework of the Constitution of IndiaIndia.minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy said pursuant to Government's policy of “zero tolerance against militancy”, the security forces are taking proactive action against militants.“Due to concerted and synergized efforts of security forces, 126 militants have been neutralized in SRINAGAR since January, 2019 till 14 July, 2019.” However, minister of state Home G Kishan Reddy said, during concerted and synergized efforts of security forces, 75 security forces personnel have been killed that includes 40 CRPF personnel slain in Pulwama attack.

article_title: Govt Open To Talks Within Constitution: MHA
event: Pulwama attack was carried by a youth belonging to Pulwama and Pulwama attack brought India and Pakistan to the brink of war.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: In our quasi normalcy time, it was just three hours journey from Srinagar to Banihal.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Though, cumbersome due to many checkpoints, identifications and quizzing by security forces has now become part of our destiny.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: We have been tamed for such humiliations and We hardly react to such humiliations now.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: We realise our limited rights, divine rule of AFSPA and hedonistic exhibition of Jeep tying incidents of civilians.Every time we leave home, we always bear in mind that we have to face fatal challenges and we do often recite Ayat-ul-kursi for not getting trapped into any such mishap which has been consuming our lives, I remember since I's college days.This day on I's journey to Banihal, either I's prayers did not reach to Almighty or I hurried without knowing the fact that everything has changed in Jammu and Kashmir since recent elections.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Not only Kashmir, but India is changing in every aspect of life.I had to reach higher secondary school in Khari Banihal where students from remote and inaccessible hilly areas were eager to quiz I about I's career and take tips for students from remote and inaccessible hilly areas's life, safety and future.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I was dreading about the fact what I should tell students from remote and inaccessible hilly areas if students from remote and inaccessible hilly areas raise questions on safety concerns of girls.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: This day on my journey to Banihal turned out to be the most horrible day in I's life.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: At crossing near Sangam on the highway, one of the security officials directed I's driver to park the car on the other side of the highway where dozens of vehicles with frustrated people crammed inside were already being put under "halt surveillance".

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: the highway was dusty, Sun was red hot and rage was brewing.J&K police official coming from the opposite side in a vehicle expressed helplessness.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: "the highway is controlled and managed directly by CRPF.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: J&K police official coming from the opposite side in a vehicle have no role but to eat dust all day.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Thanks to Mehbooba Mufti and Mehbooba Mufti's alliance”.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: J&K police official coming from the opposite side in a vehicle said with fake smile on J&K police official coming from the opposite side in a vehicle's face.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I just kept staring at J&K police official coming from the opposite side in a vehicle.Waiting for half an hour, another officer of JK police came to I's rescue and permitted the car to take internal route via Dialagam, Dooru and on to Verinag and Banihal Tunnel.Few miles drive was all we could do when another wait of forty minutes was imposed on we near Anantnag chowk.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: It seemed war like situation... we were being x rayed by eagle eyed security officials from every angle.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Behind we's was a couple with two kids on motorbike which made I's heartbeat halt.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I felt angrier over man who had three human beings behind without helmet and the kid was holding mama's back in a very precarious situation.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Security officials with ‘divine’ powers were halting every one with big stick in hand and mocking face.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: we decided to mock back but then the official made a sign to move forward.Somehow we reached at Verinag crossing and thankfully it was few minutes drive from here to Banihal Tunnel.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: A local traffic cop stopped we and yelled, "A local traffic cop will only let we through if we have order from Centre.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: A local traffic cop will not accept police permission".

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I found it very funny and started to laugh.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I's Kashmiri friend from we accompanying I was so frustrated that My Kashmiri friend from US accompanying me started heated argument with A local traffic cop.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Security personnel at the other side of Verinag crossing were laughing.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Security personnel at the other side of the crossing perhaps felt it very entertaining.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Perhaps, it was more than that.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Another police officer when approached by I on phone advised we proceed on link road which connects to highway later end.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Another police officer said Another police officer will meet we at zig (honestly, I don't know what zig is).

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: A local traffic cop was smirking while watched we succumb and leaving.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: A local traffic cop felt victorious, felt was obvious by A local traffic cop's expression.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Meeting police officer amid huge traffic halt at zig was something beyond we's reach.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: The road was nowhere to be seen due to long queue of  hundreds of vehicles.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: So, I gave up and asked my driver if my driver can manage to reverse.we saw Yatra vehicles coming from Jammu chanting "Jai Sri Ram" and many more slogans.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: My Kashmiri friend from US accompanying me was suggesting a visit to Verinag instead of Banihal.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I was seething with anger and frustration.we were about to turn back when I got a call from police officer asking I to move now towards Banihal.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I was indecisive but My Kashmiri friend from US accompanying me became adamant to move towards Banihal despite so much wait, dust and humiliation.the car somehow crossed Banihal Tunnel after seven hours of journey where security on duty stopped we again as many yatra buses coming from Jammu were about to cross the other side of Banihal Tunnel.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: When I objected, I was silenced by the argument that the road is too narrow to accommodate two vehicles at a time until I called another police official who rubbished the argument that the road is too narrow to accommodate two vehicles at a time and permitted we to move.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: The scene in Banihal was more pathetic and heartbreaking.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Here normal tourists from other states of India were advised to wait until 3 pm to cross Banihal Tunnel.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Many families with kids and babies were frantically looking for food, shelter and help.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Only locals were giving Many families with kids and babies smile and hope and something to eat.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: All of a sudden, the rain started pouring in and everybody rushed for a shelter.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: It was very painful to see tourist kids and babies crying and mothers hiding tourist kids and babies under mothers's bosom.I was lost in I's childhood memories of Amarnath Yatra in the middle of Banihal when Yatris and Sadhus would come for pilgrimage to Banihal Tunnel.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: We would wait for Yatris and Sadhus to come to We's house.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: I's father would feed Yatris and Sadhus, cloth Yatris and Sadhus and let Yatris and Sadhus rest.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: In return Yatris and Sadhus would promise We to pray at Banihal Tunnel for the peace and prosperity of Kashmir.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: This bonding would get rekindle every year and continued until this new era began.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Now, "managed yatra" seems to have reduced us to dead souls.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: us and Yatris have become pawns for politicians.And, only those seem to have chance to survive in this precarious situation who have guts to raise emotions of hate, anger and animosity among humans and religions.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: Our religion teaches us love for every human being irrespective of religion, status or region.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: We cannot change our DNA because of somebody's divisive politics.

article_title: My Yatra to Banihal
event: We would always open our hearts for Yatris.————-

article_title: Man Dies After Falling Off Train In Jammu
event: JAMMU —  A man died after allegedly falling off a train here on Thursday, officials said.The body of A man was recovered from a railway track here and sent to Government Medical College (GMC) hospital, officials said.The identity of A man is being ascertained, officials said.

article_title: Modi 2.0 Govt Passes First RS Test, RTI Bill Passed
event: NEW DELHI — Parliament approved the amendment to the RTI Act, with Rajya Sabha on Thursday passing the amendment to the RTI Act after negating an Opposition sponsored motion to send the amendment to the RTI Act to a House committee for greater scrutiny.an Opposition sponsored motion to send it to a House committee for greater scrutiny was negated by 117 members voting against an Opposition sponsored motion to send it to a House committee for greater scrutiny and 75 members voting in favour.negated after high drama in Rajya Sabha over what opposition charged was "intimidation" by the treasury benches to get an Opposition sponsored motion to send it to a House committee for greater scrutinythe RTI Act a House committee .C M Ramesh, who recently quit TDP to join BJP, was seen getting vote slips signed by members and was confronted by an angry opposition parties led by Congress.Deputy Chairman Harivansh asked C M Ramesh, who recently quit TDP to join BJP to go back to C M Ramesh, who recently quit TDP to join BJP's seat as Congress members Viplov Thakur and others tried to snatch vote slips signed by members from hands of C M Ramesh, who recently quit TDP to join BJP.Rajya Sabha then plunged into a turmoil as Opposition members rushed into the Well shouting slogans against such strong arm tactics.Leader of the Opposition Ghulam Nabi Azad said Rajya Sabha has witnessed how "303 seats are won", an apparent reference to BJP winning absolute majority in the recent Lok Sabha elections.an Opposition sponsored motion to send it to a House committee for greater scrutiny a House committee was put to vote after a division was sought when the pandemonium  broke out.The ensuing vote on passing, was carried by voice vote.Replying to the debate on the amendment to the RTI Act, DoPT Minister Jitendra Singh said the amendment to the RTI Act was not brought without any motivation and was in good faith.This, DoPT Minister Jitendra Singh said, will lead to institutionalisation of chief information commission and strengthen the provision of the RTI Act.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: Executive Engineer, Public Health Engineering Water Works Division Srinagar has appealed the general public to use water judiciously.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: "The consumers using direct online boosters are appealed to stop this practice immediately for equal distribution of water supply in the area.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: this practice is an offence under Jammu & Kashmir State Water Resources Regulation and Management Act 2010 and the Department shall be forced to take action against all such offenders," he said.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: he also urged the people to contact the Control Room in case the people find any violation of the water resources.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: A day before, one more report on the shortage of water in south Kashmir’s Kokernag area laid bare the grim reality.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: As one roiled resident put it, one roiled resident have spent half of one roiled resident's life fetching the water from the nearest source – some two kilometers away.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: Now there are two issues that are associated with the crisis.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: One, that there is shortage of water in valley this summer or generally in summer months due to drying up of sources.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: Two, that there isn’t shortage of water in valley but there are no means to transport or carry the water from source to the homes.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: As an editorial on water crisis in Kashmir pointed out (a number of media reports as well), the vexed residents often complain about the absence of pipelines in the vexed residents's vicinity than taps running dry.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: The advisory from the Department only suits the first scenario – if there is scarcity of water at the source.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: People in Kashmir as well as throughout Kashmir must realize People in the city as well as throughout the state's responsibility.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: Unlike electricity where the consumer is charged for units consumption (except in non-metered areas where there is hardly any check on the units consumed), the Department doesn’t charge for particular supply amount but for a valid connection.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: Unfortunately, one connection may serve a small household or serve a large hotel.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: So rationalization of water is a difficult task.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: At the same time the Department knows that consumers, and even majority, use boosters and motor pumps besides the large storage tanks.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: It is probably due to these reasons that the Department's best effort is in the form of public advisory, which in real sense is nothing more than urging people to share the responsibility.

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: The question however remains – what about the responsibility that the Department has to shoulder, is paid by Kashmir to shoulder?

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: Shall the discussion end at merely urging the public or will the government first and the Department later pull up the socks and try to find out where supply lines are needed?

article_title: Judicious use of water
event: the government make tall claims about electrifying the over 90 percent of Kashmir, yet there is no water in the homes.

article_title: Trump Vetoes Congressional Effort To Block Saudi, UAE Arms Sales
event: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump on Wednesday vetoed a trio of congressional resolutions aimed at blocking President Donald Trump's administration from selling billions of dollars of weapons to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.Secretary of State Mike Pompeo last month cited threats from Iran as a reason to approve sellingSaudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.Saudi Arabia is an enemy of Iran and tension has mounted between the UAE and Tehran over several issues, including the UAE's coordination with US efforts to curb what the UAE calls Iran's malign activities in the Persian Gulf.But President Donald Trump's decision in May to selling billions of dollars of weapons in a way that would have bypassed congressional review infuriated lawmakers.

article_title: Trump Vetoes Congressional Effort To Block Saudi, UAE Arms Sales
event: In a partisan pushback to President Donald Trump's foreign policy, Democrats and Republicans banded together to pass resolutions to block selling.

article_title: Trump Vetoes Congressional Effort To Block Saudi, UAE Arms Sales
event: The White House had argued that stopping selling would send a signal that the United States doesn't stand by the United States's partners and allies, particularly at a time when threats from Iran its partners and allies are increasing.The arms package included thousands of precision-guided munitions, other bombs and ammunition and aircraft maintenance support.Anger has been mounting in Congress over his administration's close ties to Saudi Arabia, fuelled by the high civilian casualties in the Saudi-led war in Yemen a military campaign the United States is assisting and the killing of US-based columnist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents.President Donald Trump's decision in May to selling billions of dollars of weapons further inflamed the tensions.vetoed tramples over the will of Congress and perpetuates his administration's involvement in the horrific conflict in Yemen, which is a stain on the conscience of the world,” House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said in a statement.It didn't appear that lawmakers opposed to selling had enough votes to override vetoed.Sen.

article_title: Trump Vetoes Congressional Effort To Block Saudi, UAE Arms Sales
event: Bob Menendez of New Jersey, the top Democrat on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, led the effort, but Sen. Bob Menendez of New Jersey, the top Democrat on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, had support from two of President Donald Trump's GOP allies in Congress: Sens.

article_title: Trump Vetoes Congressional Effort To Block Saudi, UAE Arms Sales
event: Lindsey Graham of South Carolina and Rand Paul of Kentucky.last month, members of the House Foreign Affairs Committee grilled State officials about selling.

article_title: Trump Vetoes Congressional Effort To Block Saudi, UAE Arms Sales
event: Chairman Eliot Engel, D-N.Y., said vetoed was a “slap in the face” to Congress and accused his administration of using threats from Iran as a “convenient excuse” to push through selling.In a statement released Wednesday night, Chairman Eliot Engel, D-N.Y., said, "vetoed sends a grim message that the United States's foreign policy is no longer rooted in the United States's core values namely a respect for human rights and that President Donald Trump views Congress not as a coequal branch of government, but an irritant to be avoided or ignored."

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: The scenes in the capital city Srinagar after the downpour on Thursday is something that the government in general and some departments in particular would not like to recollect.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: As the commercial hub of the capital city Srinagar got inundated, the commercial hub of the city served as a grim reminder of those deplorable days when commuters had to take off commuters's shoes and wade across the flooded streets.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: the downpour on Thursday Thursday was unlike what people usually witness in the capital city Srinagar, there is no doubt about it.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: But the capital city Srinagar was supposed to be “smarter” that the capital city Srinagar looked when pools formed everywhere.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: The confusion now among the residents is whether the residents should blame the district administration, the Master Plan, the municipal corporation, UEED, PHE, the champions of the ‘Smart City’ etc.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: Not to make it too serious, there were some takeaways from yesterday’s raining like cats and dogs – people got a respite from the hot and humid weather, the capital city Srinagar got washed and the dust finally settled for some days and the official response-time, as was observed, got reduced with the mobilization of pumps n the most affected areas.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: But the mobilization of pumps n the most affected areas is not a solution, and perhaps may be a part of the problem – the capital city Srinagar primarily doesn’t need to rely on mobile dewatering pumps.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: In engineering it is not even a feat to get rid of the excess rain water using an efficient drainage system.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: the excess rain water should go down the drains and not be carried in a transportation vessel.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: Relying on mobile water pumps is not smart thinking, particularly when the response is evoked only in the hour of the crisis.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: As per a report, not even a single project under the ‘Smart City’ has been completed since 2017.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: In terms of funds that is required to transform a city like the capital city Srinagar into a better one where streets do not become pools, only Rs 27 crore have been utilized out of the Rs 116 crore released by the Centre in 2017-18 financial year (for the twin cities of the capital city Srinagar, Jammu).

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: Here is the biggest problem – there is no lack of funds, there is work to be done but the work remains undone.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: the district administration must reckon that it is not about the response time but fixing a problem permanently, the basic civic problem – defunct drainage system.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: It is difficult to get the capital city Srinagar out of the bog – there is traffic problem, there is pollution problem, there is environment problem, there is heritage problem, there is natural disasters problem, and so on.

article_title: Smart city subterfuge
event: A better vision probably about what the capital city Srinagar should have and shouldn’t have is needed.

article_title: A Policy Shift?
event: Once again, Hafiz Saeed, chief of Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD), is behind the bars.

article_title: A Policy Shift?
event: However, this time Hafiz Saeed, chief of Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD) has not been detained as an accused in the Mumbai attacks or jailed under Maintenance of Public Order (MPO) law but as chief of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), a militant group alleged of cross-border infiltration into the Indian-controlled Kashmir.In the FIRs of 23 cases lodged against the key leaders of Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD), Hafiz Saeed, chief of Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD) Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), a militant group alleged of cross-border infiltration into the Indian-controlled Kashmirand Hafiz Saeed, chief of Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD)'s aides are accused of terror financing and misusing of space donated by locals in different cities to spread terror and collect money used for terrorism purposes.

article_title: A Policy Shift?

article_title: Abbas Declares End to 'All Agreements' with Israel
event: JERUSALEM — Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas has declared an end to "all agreements, including security coordination" with Tel Aviv amid Israeli violations against the Palestinians.

article_title: Abbas Declares End to 'All Agreements' with Israel
event: "After all the violations committed against our people, our announce the cessation of all agreements signed with Tel Aviv,'' tweeted Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on Thursday.Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas stressed that an end to "all agreements, including security coordination" with Tel Aviv would also include "security coordination" between the Palestinian Authority (PA) and the Tel Aviv regime.Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas made announce following an emergency meeting held at the presidential headquarters in the West Bank city ofthe West Bank city of Ramallah on Thursday.Palestine's official WAFA news agency had reported earlier that an emergency meeting held at the presidential headquarters in the West Bank city of Ramallah on Thursday had been adjourned to discuss Tel Aviv's blocking of the Palestinian Authority (PA) tax revenues, continued settlement construction and Palestinian displacement.During an emergency meeting held at the presidential headquarters in the West Bank city of Ramallah on Thursday, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said that the the Palestinian Authority (PA) leadership had decided to lay out "mechanisms" to establish a committee implementing the decision amid continued "Israeli violations".

article_title: Abbas Declares End to 'All Agreements' with Israel
event: "The Israeli occupation authority has decided to ignore all Tel Aviv's obligations in accordance with the agreements signed with Tel Aviv.

article_title: Abbas Declares End to 'All Agreements' with Israel
event: Tel Aviv continues to kill Palestinian citizens, arrest Palestinian citizens, demolish Palestinian citizens's houses and confiscate Palestinian citizens's lands," said Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in an emergency meeting held at the presidential headquarters in the West Bank city of Ramallah on Thursday.Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas further denounced the US-designated "deal of the century" as a further flagrant violation of Palestinian rights.

article_title: Abbas Declares End to 'All Agreements' with Israel
event: "We will not coexist with Tel Aviv and "We will not deal with the deal of deal of the century, or the slap of the century or the deal of shame - all names for one title.

event: Palestine's and JERUSALEM are not for sale and bargain.

event: Palestine and Jerusalem are not a real estate deal in a real estate company," Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said.the US-designated "deal of the century" is yet to be officially released.

article_title: Abbas Declares End to 'All Agreements' with Israel

Palestinian Hamas resistance movement.the Palestinian Hamas resistance movement and Fatah have been at odds since Fatah won the Palestinian parliamentary elections Gaza in January 2006, splitting control over the Palestinian territories between the West Bank Fatah party and the Palestinian Hamas resistance movement.Later on Thursday, the Palestinian Hamas resistance movement issued a statement expressing support for the decision as “a step taken in right direction”, adding that people were waiting for the decision's “immediate realization”.the Palestinian Hamas resistance movement also presidential headquarters in the West Bank city of Ramallah on Thursday came specifically in response to the record demolition of 10 Palestinian apartment buildings in the Sur Baher village situated in West Bank earlier this week.Tel Aviv claims 10 Palestinian apartment buildings in the Sur Baher village situated in the occupied West Bank earlier this week had been constructed illegally and built too close to Tel Aviv's apartheid wall in West Bank.Palestinian sources, however, say that the restrictions, imposed in 2011, had never been seriously enforced and that Tel Aviv was using the restrictions, imposed in 2011 as a pretext to displace Palestinians as part of long-term settlement expansion efforts.the record demolition of 10 Palestinian apartment buildings in the Sur Baher village situated in the occupied West Bank earlier this week has prompted international condemnation.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: SRINAGAR — Jammu and Kashmir Government Wednesday rolled out an ambitious plan to transform the Anganwadi Centres into state-of-the-art Model Community Facilities for children and mothers in the State.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: As a part of this program, unveiled by Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal at a review meeting of the ICDS here today, 50 existing Anganwadi Centres in each district would be, in the first phase, transformed through convergence with MGNREGA into Model Anganwadi Centres with upgraded infrastructure and improved amenities like toilets, drinking water and hygiene.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: Model Anganwadi Centres with upgraded infrastructure and improved amenities like toilets, drinking water and hygiene will be then replicated at other Anganwadi Centres in the State to change the face of the Government's 44-year-old children and women-oriented program for efficient delivery of Integrated Child Development Scheme.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: Under Integrated Child Development Scheme, supplementary nutrition is provided to children in the age group of 0-6 years and to pregnant/lactating mothers with main objective to fight the problem of malnutrition.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: a review meeting of the ICDS here today was informed that at present, 141 projects are running under Integrated Child Development Scheme in the State covering 29599 Anganwadi Centres.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: “Upto June 2019, 779682 beneficiaries have been covered under Supplementary Nutrition Program in the State,” a review meeting of the ICDS here today was told.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: Speaking at a review meeting of the ICDS here today, Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal stressed on expeditious implementation of ‘Decentralized Policy for Procurement of Supplementary Nutrition’ under Integrated Child Development Scheme to bring transparency, accountability and greater involvement of community in the implementation of Integrated Child Development Scheme.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: Under ‘Decentralized Policy for Procurement of Supplementary Nutrition’, supplementary nutrition shall be procured at Halqa Panchayat/Municipal Ward level through Panchayats and Municipal Committees.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: “The procurement of nutrition items will have to be strictly as per the menu displayed in the Anganwadi Centres and to be procured from Super Bazaar/Cooperative Stores/Fixed Price Shops/Registered Local Shopkeepers on the rates not exceeding the rates notified by FCS&CA,” Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal maintained adding that ‘Decentralized Policy for Procurement of Supplementary Nutrition’ has been framed as per the delegation of powers to the Panchayati Raj Institutions under the amended Panchayati Raj Act.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: To expedite implementation of ‘Decentralized Policy for Procurement of Supplementary Nutrition’, Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal directed that the Procurement Committees should be in place in all the 4483 Panchayats in the State by the end of this month followed by opening of dedicated bank accounts in each Panchayat for the purpose.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: As per the New Procurement Policy, the funds for the purchase of the nutrition items are required to be transferred directly into the Joint Bank Accounts of Chairperson and Member Secretary of the Procurement Committee consisting of Sarpanch/Urban Ward Councillor and Integrated Child Development Scheme Supervisor of the concerned Panchayat Halqa/Urban Ward.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: a review meeting of the ICDS here today was informed that 3176 accounts have already been opened and the rest of the accounts would be opened within the set timeframe.

article_title: Plan Announced To Upgrage Anganwadi Centres
event: Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal asked the Integrated Child Development Scheme Mission Directorate to organize training/orientation camps for Panchayat Representatives to acquaint Panchayat Representatives with the policy guidelines to be followed for the procurement of nutrition and nutrition's distribution in Anganwadi Centres.Regarding decentralisation of disbursement of honorarium to Anganwadi Workers and Helpers under Integrated Child Development Scheme, Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal called upon the District Project Officers and CDPOs to forward the details of all pending dues to the ICDS Mission Directorate by 7th August 2019 so that honorarium is released before 15th August Principal Secretary, Social Welfare Department, Rohit Kansal called for expediting convening of DPCs to address the issues of career progression in ICDS.Earlier, Mission Director, Integrated Child Development Scheme, Shabnam Kamili gave a detailed presentation about the progress of various schemes being implemented by Integrated Child Development Scheme.
