article_title: MMU Panel On Women’s Rights Meets At Mirwaiz Manzil
event: SRINAGAR — The members of the panel formed by Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) to create awareness about women’s rights and issues across Kashmir held a meeting on Thursday at Mirwaiz Manzil under the chairmanship of Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) patron Mirwaiz Umar Farooq.The members from various NGOs, including women organizations which are part of the panel formed by Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) to create awareness about women’s rights and issues across Kashmir, also participated in a meeting, putting forth The members from various NGOs, including women organizations which are part of the panel's suggestions.a meeting was convened as a follow-up to the earlier meeting held on July 9, 2019 , wherein issues regarding women’s property rights, domestic violence and issues related to divorce and divorce's consequences on women were discussed in detail.The members of the panel formed by Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) to create awareness about women’s rights and issues across Kashmir put forth The members of the panel formed by Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) to create awareness about women’s rights and issues across Kashmir's point of view and valuable suggestions with regard to issues regarding women’s property rights, domestic violence and issues related to divorce and its consequences on women, a statement issued by Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) said.A decision was taken at a meeting that to create mass awareness and mobilize people, Friday sermons and other religious gatherings for the coming month will be dedicated to highlighting issues regarding women’s property rights, domestic violence and issues related to divorce and its consequences on women in the light of Islamic teachings.It was also decided that a model Nikahnama will be framed to educate both men and women about both men and women's rights and duties in a marriage and also clearly state others terms of marriage.Those who participated in a meeting include Mufti Nazir Ahmed Qasmi, Moulana Showkat Hussain Keng, Moulana Fayaz Ahmed Zaroo (Humsafar Marriage Council), Moulana Muhammad Mukarim, Mehran Khan, Mudasir Iqbal Mir, Syed-ur-Rehman Shams,  Mantasha Bashir, Safeena Nabi, Rifat Andrabi and Farah Zaidi besides others.Meanwhile, another panel formed by Mutahida Majlisi-e-Ulema (MMU) on the issue of drug abuse, a very serious issue confronting the society, will be meeting early next week to follow up and look into ways and means in this regard, a statement issued by MMU said.

article_title: Top Official Blames ‘Deficient Drainage’ For Water-Logging
event: SRINAGAR — Deputy Commissioner SRINAGAR Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary Thursday visited various areas across SRINAGAR to assess the water-logging situation and inspect dewatering efforts following heavy morning rainfall in SRINAGAR.“Dr Shahid said water-logging as a result of rains throws a major challenge because of deficient drainage in the district adding that the district administration is fast-tracking efforts to bridge shortfalls through a comprehensive drainage project that will address deficient drainage in the district,” an official spokesperson said.Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said response mechanism to deal with the water-logging situation was fully activated soon after heavy morning rainfall in Srinagar had started adding that all concerned line departments were on the ground in efforts towards quickest possible dewatering of affected areas.Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said concerned departments had been instructed to ensure swift dewatering of all roads and lanes especially those leading to important installations like hospitals and receiving stations.

article_title: Top Official Blames ‘Deficient Drainage’ For Water-Logging
event: Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said concerted efforts ensured earliest possible dewatering of roads across SRINAGAR.Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said that in addition to 80 dewatering stations and 115 mobile pumping stations of the SMC over a dozen fire tenders and pumps of the F&ES were pressed into service for dewatering efforts across SRINAGAR adding that this was in addition to 10 pumping stations of the UEED covering areas surrounding the Dal lake.Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said all line departments including PWD, PHE, the SMC, PDD, the UEED and Traffic had deployed adequate men and machinery on the ground to deal with the water-logging situation.

article_title: Top Official Blames ‘Deficient Drainage’ For Water-Logging
event: Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary said officers were designated as nodal officers for different zones to monitor the situation within officers's areas of jurisdiction.Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary also visited various Old City areas on the occasion and tock stock of water-logging situation and dewatering efforts underway there.Senior officers from all concerned departments including SSP Traffic, ADC Srinagar, JD PMDD ExEns and field officers accompanied Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal Choudhary on the occasion.

article_title: Salary of Animal Husbandry Top Brass Put on Hold
event: SRINAGAR — The salaries of the Commissioner Secretary and the Director Animal Husbandry Department Kashmir shall stand stopped if wages to a daily wager were not released within a week, the state high court said on Thursday.

article_title: Salary of Animal Husbandry Top Brass Put on Hold
event: The orders were passed by a bench of Justice Ali Mohammad Magrey after hearing a petition filed by one Shahbaz Shafi Ganai who alleged violation of final order passed on 13 February 2015, in terms whereof, the Court had directed the government to take a decision regarding his absorption in the Government service with further direction that till the decision in the matter is taken, the present position of the petitioner shall not be disturbed and be paid wages regularly.The status report filed by the Director Animal Husbandry Department Kashmir Kashmir revealed that the case of the petitioner along with other casual labourers of Animal Husbandry Department stands already uploaded on the website devised by the Finance Department for the purpose of regularization.It is further stated in The status report filed by the Director, Department of Animal Husbandry, Kashmir that the present position of the petitioner stands maintained.

article_title: Salary of Animal Husbandry Top Brass Put on Hold
event: However, earned wages of the petitioner have been partly released and for the remaining part requisition has been made with the Administrative Department for release of funds.On 7 June last year after considering the fresh status report, the Commissioner Secretary was asked to ensure payment of outstanding wages to the petitioner within a period of three weeks.On  10 April this year, when the matter was again taken up for consideration, the state high court had extracted The orders and granted some more time to the respondents to ensure release of outstanding payment of wages with further direction that in the event balance  payment of wages are not released before the next date of hearing, the Director Animal Husbandry Department Kashmir Kashmir shall remain personally present in the state high court along with details of the account head of Animal Husbandry Department.

article_title: Salary of Animal Husbandry Top Brass Put on Hold
event: the Director Animal Husbandry Department Kashmir Kashmir appeared and when  asked, stated that the case for release of outstanding amount of wages is not in respect of the petitioner only, but there are number of casual labourers, whose past wages have also not been released as yet, as the requisition is made for release of funds to the Administrative Department, Government of Jammu and Kashmir.“Admittedly, the petitioner is working as casual labourer in Animal Husbandry Department and has earned the wages.

article_title: Salary of Animal Husbandry Top Brass Put on Hold

article_title: Kashmir in Fix
event: The Kashmir imbroglio is the bone of contention between India & Pakistan.Kashmir problem is posing grave threat to peace & stability in South-Asia.Kashmir problem has consumed thousands of lives across the border.Various bilateral engagements have miserably failed to break the ice.Shimla agreement & Lahore declaration have not been able to diffuse the tensions.Any misadventure can lead to a terrible catastrophe.The Trumps claim about mediation need to be seen in due course of time.India & Pakistan have fought three conventional wars without any breakthrough.Thousands of crores have been wasted on ongoing arms race.ongoing arms race has consumed thousands of innocent lives.India & Pakistan are increasing India & Pakistan's defense budgets at the cost of tax payers money.Pakistan was cut down into two pieces due to Bangladesh episode.The Kargil conflict shaked economic foundations of India & Pakistan.Both these economies have misplaced priorities of death & destruction.The world powers are using India & Pakistan as sacrificial lambs for furthuring The world powers's geo-political interests.Negotiations & bilateral engagements have taken a back seat in contemporary times.While Pakistan is willing to demonstrate flexibility Delhi is very rigid.

article_title: Kashmir in Fix
event: Indian narrative has got further cemented after surgical & Balakote strikes.The Modi led NDA regime doesn't want to talk outside the ambit of Indian constitution.At the same time, the separatist spectrum has been cornered from all sides.The NIA raides on separatists are accelrating with each passing day.Although the militancy has been neutralized to a great extent, but the young recruitment remains a cause of concern.The fear of death is no detternce for young of Kashmir from disrupting military's operations.The Trumps claim about mediation needs to be taken in right perspective.India & Pakistan need to take bold decisions in this regard.The US mediation can prove a stimulating factor in initiating bilateral engagements.The dialogue process needs to be immediately initiated in the larger interest of peace & stability.At the same time, the track 2nd dialogue should be encouraged by India & Pakistan.Civil society & cultural exchanges can prove vital ingrediants in this regard.India & Pakistan need to understand the gravity of the situation & resolve Kashmir problem once & for all.Better late than never.Syed Mohsin Attiqmohsinattiq2015@gmail.comDaharmunah Budgam

article_title: Gujarat Police Arrests Anantnag Resident in 2002 Case
event: GANDHINAGAR — Mohammad Yasin Bhat, alleged prime conspirator of the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here, was arrested by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad from Anantnag in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday, an official said.Thirty-three persons, including a National Security Guard (NSG) commando, died when two gunmen the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here fire inside the Akshardham temple complex here on September 24, 2002.The two militants were gunned down by NSG commandos.Bhat, an alleged operative of Lashkar-e- Taiba, had fled to Pakistan-controlled Kashmir (PcK) after the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here, according to officials.Mohammad Yasin Bhat, alleged prime conspirator of the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here was nabbed following a tip-off that Mohammad Yasin Bhat, alleged prime conspirator of the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here had returned to Jammu and Kashmir Kashmir and was working at a timber warehouse in Anantnag in Jammu and Kashmir, the Gujarat Home Department said in a release.arrested was made with the help of local police, the Gujarat Home Department added.After obtaining Mohammad Yasin Bhat, alleged prime conspirator of the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here's transit remand from a court there, the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad arrived with Mohammad Yasin Bhat, alleged prime conspirator of the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here at the Ahmedabad airport on Friday evening, a release added.As per the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad, Mohammad Yasin Bhat, alleged prime conspirator of the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here played a key role in hatching the conspiracy to the 2002 Akshardham Temple attack here Akshardham Temple, and also supplied arms and ammunition, including AK-47 assault rifles, to other accused who had come to Ahmedabad by train from Uttar Pradesh.The Supreme Court, in May 2014, acquitted six persons arrested earlier in the case, including three who were facing death sentence.

article_title: Iran Frees Nine Indian Crew From Seized Tanker
event: NEW DELHI — Iran has freed nine of 12 Indian crew from a Panama-flagged tanker seized on July 14, Iran's foreign ministry said on Friday.Iran had accused a Panama-flagged tanker seized on July 14 of smuggling contraband fuel when a Panama-flagged tanker seized on July 14 was detained, amid mounting tensions between Iran and both Britain and the US over shipping in the Strait of Hormuz.a Panama-flagged tanker seized on July 14 crossed into Iranian waters around July 14 and stopped transmitting signals shortly afterwards, the TankerTrackers online oil shipment website reported at the time.“Nine crew members have been released and nine of 12 Indian crew will be on nine of 12 Indian crew's way to Iran soon,” said Indian foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar.“Our mission in Iran has requested the concerned Iranian authorities for the release of remaining crew members.” released left 21 other Indians in Iranian detention however, including three from a Panama-flagged tanker seized on July 14 and 18 from the British-flagged Stena Impero tanker which was also captured by Iranian forces on July 19.The Stena Impero and the British-flagged Stena Impero tanker which was also captured by Iranian forces on July 19.The Stena Impero's 23 crew have been impounded at the southern port of Bandar Abbas for allegedly breaking “international maritime rules”.

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests
event: MANAMA — Bahrain has executed three pro-democracy activists on two separate cases, defying widespread calls to commute the death sentences handed to three pro-democracy activists in an "unfair" mass trial.three pro-democracy activists were executed at Jaw prison, south of MANAMA, on Friday after private meetings with three pro-democracy activists's families.three pro-democracy activists Ali Hakim al-Arab, 25, were sentenced to death last year in a mass trial along with another 56 men who were convicted and given jail terms on "terrorism crimes".The Public prosecutor's office announced three pro-democracy activists were put to death on charges of possessing firearms and killing a police officer.

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests
event: The opposition al-Wefaq society condemned executed as extrajudicial.The regime in Bahrain carried out the death sentences handed to the prisoners in an "unfair" mass trial despite fierce protests by the United Nations and several human rights groups andThe Bahrain Centre for Human Rights said that the families of three pro-democracy activists had received phone calls from Jaw prison, south of the Bahraini capital Manama, for private visits - a procedure that usually precedes execution.Reports had also been emerged of an increased security presence around Jaw prison, south of the Bahraini capital Manama,.Bahraini law requires death row inmates to receive a family visit on the same day that death row inmates are killed.Ahmad al-Malali, 24, Ali Hakim al-Arab, 25, were arrested separately in February 2017.They were convicted of "terrorism offenses" and sentenced three pro-democracy activists to death in January 2018 during a mass trial marred by allegations of torture and serious due process violations.The Bahraini Court of Cassation upheld the death penalties against three pro-democracy activists in May 2019.Reports said that King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifah ratified upheld.A London-based Bahraini activist rights group, the Bahrain Institute for Rights and Democracy (BIRD), said “executed mark one of Bahrain's darkest days”.

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests
event: "It appears that The regime in the tiny Persian Gulf kingdom planned executed meticulously, timing executed to coincide with US, EU and UK legislative recesses in order to avoid international scrutiny," A London-based Bahraini activist rights group, the Bahrain Institute for Rights and Democracy (BIRD)'s Director Sayed Ahmed Alwadaei said in a statement.Human Rights Watch (HRW) had called on King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifah to immediately revoke executed and spare three pro-democracy activists from "such a cruel death.”“If executed are indeed imminent, then King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifah has committed a grave injustice by ratifying the death sentences handed to the prisoners in an "unfair" mass trial despite the allegations of torture and other serious due process concerns,” said Lama Fakih, acting Middle East director at Human Rights Watch (HRW).

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests

article_title: Bahrain Executes Three Activists Despite Intl. Protests

event: SRINAGAR — The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has directed Principal District Judge Srinagar to ensure compliance of The Jammu and Kashmir High Court's order regarding details of pending acquisition cases which hamper widening of important rout stretch in SRINAGAR.“A direction shall go to Principal District Judge Srinagar to ensure compliance of its order regarding details of pending acquisition cases which hamper widening of important rout stretch in Srinagar and place a report before The Jammu and Kashmir High Court,” a division bench of Chief Justice Gita Mittal and Justice Rashid Ali Dar said while hearing a Public Interest Litigation.

article_title: City Roads: HC Seeks Pending Acquisition Case Details
event: “The Registry shall send copies of the orders dated 23rd April, 2019, 21st May, 2019 and a copy of its order regarding details of pending acquisition cases which hamper widening of important rout stretch in Srinagar to Principal District Judge Srinagar,” The Jammu and Kashmir High Court added.On last hearing, The Jammu and Kashmir High Court directed authorities to seek expeditious disposal of the cases related to land acquisition coming in way of road widening of Dalgate to Hazratbal Srinagar.a division bench of Chief Justice Gita Mittal and Justice Rashid Ali Dar had passed the orders dated 23th April, 2019, 21st May, 2019 after a Deputy Commissioner Srinagar submitted that there are several cases pending before the courts, a majority of several cases pending before the courts relate to the amount o compensation.

article_title: City Roads: HC Seeks Pending Acquisition Case Details
event: In few cases, a Deputy Commissioner Srinagar said, there are disputes which inter-se the owners, family disputes, partnership disputes pending before the courts.

article_title: City Roads: HC Seeks Pending Acquisition Case Details

article_title: Yediyurappa Sworn In As Karnataka CM For 4th Time
event: BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was sworn in as Chief Minister of Karnataka for the fourth time on Friday.Governor Vajubhai Vala administered the oath of office and secrecy to BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa at a ceremony at the Raj Bhavan.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was sworn-in.Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry is assuming office three days after the collapse of the Congress-JD(S) government with the defeat of the motion of confidence moved by chief minister H D Kumaraswamy in the assembly by 99-105 votes.In a sudden development on Friday morning, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa met Governor Vajubhai Vala to stake the claim and requested Governor Vajubhai Vala to administer the oath of office and secrecy, following which Governor Vajubhai Vala invited BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa to form Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry.Before sworn, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa said BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa would decide on members to be inducted into Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry after consulting party president Amit Shah.This is the fourth stint for BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa as the Chief Minister-- the last one was after the May 2018 Assembly polls, when BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa barely lasted three days after being sworn in.Yediyurappa:Comeback man who has surmounted the oddsFrom the humdrum existence as a government clerk and a hardware storeowner to becoming the chief minister for a fourth time, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa has navigated the choppy waters of politics with the consummate ease of a seasoned oarsman.The rare smile is back on BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's face as BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa took over as the chief minister, 14 months after BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa demitted the chief minister, unable to prove the majority in the assembly.In a repeat of sorts, it has not been an easy ascent to power for BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa this time too as a murky legal battle and weeks of political drama preceded BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's takeover.Losing power after having come so close, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was determined to regain the reins of power from H D Kumaraswamy, whose party JD(S) cobbled up a post poll alliance with Congress and managed to overthrow BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's three-day-old BJP government on May 19, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa had to resign as CM as BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa could not muster a majority after staking claim to form Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry on the ground that BJP had emerged as the single largest one.Another interesting element in BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's struggle to power this time is, this time is being seen as BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's last chance, considering BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's age and BJP's policy of retirement from electoral politics to BJP's's leaders who have crossed 75.A hardboiled RSS swayamsevak, 76-year-old Bookanakere Siddalingappa Yediyurappa joined the Hindu right organisation when BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was barely 15, and cut BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's political teeth in the Jana Sangh, BJP's's forerunner, in BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's hometown Shikaripura in Shivamogga district.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa became the Jana Sangh, the BJP's forerunner's his hometown Shikaripura in Shivamogga district taluk chief in the early 1970s.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S YediyurappaBENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's his hometown Shikaripura in Shivamogga district,was first elected to the assembly from his hometown Shikaripura in Shivamogga district in 1983 and went on to win eight times from there.Along with being BJP's state unit president, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa has also served as opposition Leader in the assembly, member of Legislative Council, as also member of parliament.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa is known to have espoused the cause of farmers.A Bachelor of Arts, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa, worked as a clerk in the social welfare department before taking up a similar job at a rice mill in his hometown Shikaripura in Shivamogga district before BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa set up BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's hardware shop in Shivamogga district.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa married Maitradevi, daughter of the rice mill owner, where BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa worked, on March 5, 1967 and has two sons and three daughters.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa may have landed in the hot seat in 2004 when BJP's emerged as the single largest party, but Congress and JD(S) of former prime minister H D Deve Gowda formed an alliance, and a government was formed under Dharam Singh.Known for BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's political acumen, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa joined hands with Kumaraswamy, former prime minister H D Deve Gowda's son, in 2006 and brought down a government Dharam Singh after Dharam Singh was indicted by Lokayukta in an alleged mining scam.Under a rotational chief ministership arrangement, Kumaraswamy, Deve Gowda's son became the CM and BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa Kumaraswamy, Deve Gowda's son's deputy.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa became CM for the first time in November 2007 but BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's term lasted just seven days as chief minister H D Kumaraswamy reneged on a power sharing pact and walked out of an alliance.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was made the chief minister once again after BJP's came to power in May 2018 but had to step down in July 2011 following BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's indictment by the then Lokayukta N Santosh Hegde in an illegal mining case.In the 2008 polls, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa led BJP to victory, and the first BJP's government in the south was formed under BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa.Soon controversies swirled around BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa over alleged abuse of office to favour BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's sons in allotment of land in Bengaluru and BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was forced to resign on July 31, 2011 following indictment by Lokayukta in an illegal mining scam.On October 15 2011, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa surrendered before the Lokayukta court after the Lokayukta court issued a warrant against BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa in connection with alleged land scams,and was in jail for a week.Sulking after having been made to quit, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa broke BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's decades-long association with the saffron party and formed the Karnataka Janata Paksha.However, ploughing a lonely furrow, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa failed to make the Karnataka Janata Paksha a force to reckon with in state politics but wrecked BJP's's chances of retaining power in the 2013 polls, winning six seats and polling about 10 per cent votes.As BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa faced an uncertain future and BJP's looked for a leader with a formidable reputation to lend BJP's's campaign the required heft ahead of the May 2018 Assembly polls, the two cosied up to each other, leading to the Karnataka Janata Paksha's merger with BJP's on January 9, 2014.In the May 2018 Assembly pollsLok Sabha , BJP's won 19 of Karnataka's 28 seats, won.Notwithstanding the corruption taint, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's status and clout grew in BJP's October 26, 2016, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa got a huge relief when a special CBI court acquitted BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's two sons and son-in-law in a Rs 40 crore illegal mining case, which had cost BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa the chief ministership in 2011.In January 2016, the Karnataka High Court quashed all 15 FIRs against BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa lodged by Lokayukta police under the Prevention of Corruption Act.In April 2016, BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa was appointed the state BJP chief for the fourth time.BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa, however, continued to be dogged by controversies, with the anti-corruption bureau launching proceedings against BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa in an alleged illegal land denotification case, which was stayed by the high court following BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa's plea.BJP's declared BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa BJP's's chief ministerial candidate in the 2018 assembly polls, ignoring the taunts by Congress.As the 2018 assembly polls threw up a hung verdict, with no party getting a clear majority in the 225-member House (including Speaker), the Governor invited BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa to form Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry and gave BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa 15 days to prove the majority.However,the Supreme Court asked BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa to prove the majority the 225-member House (including Speaker) following a plea by Congress challenging invited.Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry BJP's collapsed on May 19, minutes before the scheduled trust vote, with BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa resigning in a tame anti-climax and hours later Kumaraswamy, Deve Gowda's son, was invited to form Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry.In the last over one year, BJP under BENGALURU — Karnataka BJP president B S Yediyurappa managed to keep Yediyurappa-led BJP ministry on tenterhooks as BJP's constantly feared poaching of MLAs by the saffron party.The resignation of 15 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs came as a blow to the newly formed JD(S)-Congress alliance and the newly formed JD(S)-Congress alliance collapsed losing the trust vote on July 23, paving the way for MLAs's return.

article_title: ‘Pak’ Imports Over $36 Mn Of Anti-Rabies,Anti-Venom Vaccines From India’
event: ISLAMABAD — Over $36 million of anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines have been imported by Pakistan from India due to lack of manufacturing capacity in Pakistan, according to a media report.The Nation newspaper on Thursday reported that in the last 16 months, Pakistan imported anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines from India.The Ministry of National Health Services (NHS) submitted the statistics in the Senate Standing Committee after Senator Rehman Malik asked about the quantity and value of medicines being imported from India.Senator Rehman Malik also sought a reply on the capacity of government departments for manufacturing anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines.In The Ministry of National Health Services (NHS)'s reply, The Ministry of National Health Services (NHS) said that both anti-rabies and anti-venom serum were manufactured in Pakistan by the National Institute of Health, while a private company also manufactured anti-venom serum locally, a media report said.However, the capacity of both manufacturers was not enough to fulfil the demand due to which anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines are imported by duly-approved registration holders of anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines from India.Pakistan was buying anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines despite the chill in bilateral ties, especially after the Pulwama terror attack by a suicide bomber belonging to Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist.

article_title: ‘Pak’ Imports Over $36 Mn Of Anti-Rabies,Anti-Venom Vaccines From India’
event: a media report also revealed that there was a gap in demand and supply of vaccines in different regions of Pakistan.Senator Rehman Malik suggested that it must be made mandatory for local manufacturers to produce anti-rabies and anti-venom vaccines as Pakistan is self-sufficient in medical raw material and that vaccines manufactured here will be much more affordable.

article_title: Govt To Promote JK As Ideal, Safe Tourist Destination: Navin
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary today chaired an interactive session with representatives of various tourism associations and other stakeholders of tourism industry here.Director Tourism Kashmir, Nisar Ahmad Wani, Director Tourism Jammu, Deepika Kumari Sharma, Additional Secretary Tourism Prasanna Ramaswamy, officials from JKTDC, Tourism Department, representatives of various tourism associations including Nigeen Club Association, JK Tourism Alliance, House Boat Owners Association, Kashmir Hoteliers Club, Kashmir Chamber of Commerce and Industries and others concerned attended an interactive session with representatives of various tourism associations and other stakeholders of tourism industry here.Speaking on the occasion, SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary called for practicing modern marketing strategies to portray tourism potential of the State in the international market besides using social media effectively as a promotional tool to attract more tourist footfall to the State.SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary also stressed on cooperation among the associations related to tourism sector in order to promote Jammu and Kashmir as an ideal and safe tourist destination.

article_title: Govt To Promote JK As Ideal, Safe Tourist Destination: Navin
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary also said Tourism Department has finalized promotional programme for next six months, which will be primarily done through outdoor marketing campaigns including promotions through billboards at major cities of the State, inside airports, transit ads on metros and railway and advertisement in airline magazines.SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary said Tourism Department will organize several Familiarisation (FAM) trips of leading travel agents, tour operators, media houses from different parts of the State to Kashmir besides embarking on outdoor advertising campaign at many major citiesHe further said Tourism Department will also organize a meet with ambassadors at New Delhi in an effort to remove the travel advisories from different countries.

article_title: Govt To Promote JK As Ideal, Safe Tourist Destination: Navin
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary said that the State has abundant potential in varied forms of tourism and attracts a large number of adventure seekers given the topography and virgin slopes in the State.

article_title: Govt To Promote JK As Ideal, Safe Tourist Destination: Navin
event: In this regard, SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary called for identification and documentation of trekking routes and proper promotion of trekking routes.SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary directed Tourism Department that a proper mechanism should be put in place for registration and booking of tourists.

article_title: Govt To Promote JK As Ideal, Safe Tourist Destination: Navin
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary advised Tourism Department that a robust website should be made functional and all sectors related to tourism should be interlinked with a robust website for the ease of tourists.Speaking during an interactive session with representatives of various tourism associations and other stakeholders of tourism industry here, representatives of various tourism associations raised various issues related to the tourism sector like regulation of airfares, permission for renovation of houseboats, reimbursement of GST, restoration of Dal Lake and Nigeen Club Association etc.SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary, Tourism, Navin Kumar Choudhary assured representatives of various tourism associations that all of representatives of various tourism associations's genuine issues will be redressed in a time-bound manner.

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq
event: Muslim Canon Law evolved over many centuries across various territories due to the work of scholars and jurists who would rely on the Holy Quran, the Traditions of the Holy Prophet (Peace be Upon the Holy Prophet), Ijma or the consensus of the Ulema (scholars) and Ijtihad or analogical reasoning.

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq
event: While the Shia school of thought in particular the majority Ithna Asharia School still considers Ijtihad as a continuous process, the Sunnis by and large have come to the conclusion that Ijtihad no longer exists as a source of Muslim law after the sixteenth century AD.

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq
event: Although it was recognised that Muslim marriage requires the consent of the partners, the modus of divorce was implied in various forms like the Talaq-e Ahsan and Talaq-e Bidah (Triple Talaq pronounced in one sitting or one go).

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq
event: It was only in the 19th and the 20th century that some jurists opined that Muslim marriage is purely a civil contract between two consenting adults on terms and conditions negotiable and that would include the circumstances, authority, and the mode of divorce.

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq
event: With the democratic system of governance being relatively new in the Muslim world it is still the scholars, Ulema, and the Muftis whose views prevail and the traditional Muslim Canon Law holds ground.There are numerous verses of the Holy Quran that lay special emphasis on the equality of men and women.

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq

article_title: A Civil Contract and Triple Talaq
event: Talaq- Tafweedh wherein the authority to divorce has been delegated to the wife at the time of contracting the marriage has been a practice among Muslims, though generally unheard of these days, and sanctioned by the following verse of the Holy Quran:[33:28] the Holy Prophet, say to your wives, "If your wives should desire the worldly life and the worldly life's adornment, then come, the Holy Prophet will provide for your wives and give your wives a gracious release.”In our society the practice is simply to go through the rituals.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: SRINAGAR — The countdown for the removal of the controversial Article 35A in Jammu and Kashmir has started, according to top sources in the government.Two days after National Security Adviser Ajit Doval returned from a visit to the Valley, the Centre has decided to move 10,000 additional paramilitary troops there to address the likely fallout of move on the ground, sources said.During a visit to the Valley, National Security Adviser Ajit Doval had held detailed discussions with senior officers of the state administration, police, paramilitary forces, army, state and Central intelligence agencies, sources said.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: "An elaborate contingency plan has been worked out to take care of even the minutest details.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: How the law and order situation would behave, the response of the overground and underground separatist cadres and also the response of the mainstream political leadership.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: "It is clear that nothing is being left to chance.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: The orders seem to be clear, violence and attempts to disrupt peace by anti-national elements, in the garb of a public outcry to oppose the removal of the controversial Article 35A in Jammu and Kashmirthe controversial Article 35A, has to be contained and controlled so that the common man is put to least inconvenience.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: "The entire operation to deal with the law and order fallout in the aftermath of the removal of the controversial Article 35A in Jammu and Kashmir the controversial Article 35A has even been code-named," sources said.The arrival of additional companies of Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) has started in the Valley over the past three days.Special flights carrying CAPFs have landed at the SRINAGAR airport during the past three days, while convoys carrying additional companies of Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) are reaching the Valley through the Jammu-Srinagar national highway.reaching is reportedly intended to augment an already overwhelming component of Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) in Kashmir.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: Over 450 companies of CAPFs (40,000 troops) are already deployed for the security of the ongoing Amarnath Yatra and other security related duties in the Valley at present.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: "This number does not include the strength of the counter insurgency Rashtriya Rifles, which carries out anti-militancy operations in the hinterland, and also provides peripheral assistance to the state police and Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) in difficult situations.While the Union Home Ministry has issued an order saying that 10,000 additional paramilitary troops will be for strengthening the "counter insurgent grid" and for maintaining law and order in the Valley, J&K Police said 10,000 additional paramilitary troops will be deployed in north Kashmir where the security situation is still seen as a challenge.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: "All sensitive installations, including the airport, radio station, Doordarshan Kendra, essential services like hydro-power generation projects, power grid stations, water supplies, hospitals, paramilitary camps and the state police offices down to the level of police stations and police posts are getting additional paramilitary deployments for extraordinary security cover.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report
event: "The Army would stand by for any assistance the civil administration might require to maintain law and order," sources said.

article_title: Even Operation to Deal with Fallout Code-Named: Report

event: JAMMU / SRINAGAR —  The mercury in JAMMU and Kashmir marked a sharp dip on Saturday as intermittent rains lashed wide parts of the state for Saturday, disrupting traffic on the JAMMU-Srinagar national highway and claiming the life of an elderly woman, officials said.The weatherman has issued an alert, predicting adverse weather to continue for the next 24 hours.The maxiumum temperature in JAMMU settled at 28.6 degrees Celsius, five notches below the season's average, a MeT office spokesman said.

article_title: Amarnath Yatra Suspended From Jammu Due To Bad Weather Conditions
event: JAMMU — The Amarnath yatra from JAMMU to Kashmir was suspended on Friday due to bad weather conditions along the highway to the Valley, officials said.As many as 7,021 pilgrims have paid obeisance at the cave shrine of Amarnath in the south Kashmir Himalayas till Thursday evening, taking the total those having performed the darshan to 3,08,839, officials said.Over 3.30 lakh pilgrims from across the country have so far registered Over 3.30 lakh pilgrims from across the country for the 46-day pilgrimage, which takes place on the 36-km Pahalgam track in JAMMU and Kashmir's Anantnag district and the 14-km Baltal route in Ganderbal district.

article_title: Amarnath Yatra Suspended From Jammu Due To Bad Weather Conditions
event: "The Amarnath yatra has been suspended from JAMMU to Kashmir due to bad weather conditions along the highway to the Valley Friday," a police official told PTI.There was heavy rainfall in JAMMU and along the highway to the Valley on Thursday and heavy rainfall in Jammu and along the route to Kashmir on Thursday continued through the night, a police official said.suspended is the third time The Amarnath yatra from Jammu city to Kashmir had to be suspended from JAMMU.On July 8, The Amarnath yatra from Jammu city to Kashmir was suspended as a precautionary measure following a strike called by JRL in the Valley to mark the third death anniversary of former Hizbul Mujahideen commander Burhan Wani.On July 13, The Amarnath yatra from Jammu city to Kashmir was again suspended in view of strike in the the Valley on Martyrs' Day.

article_title: Amarnath Yatra Suspended From Jammu Due To Bad Weather Conditions
event: Four Amarnath pilgrims have died on Tuesday and Wednesday en route to the cave shrine of Amarnath in the south Kashmir Himalayas, taking the death toll in this year's pilgrimage to 30, officials said.As many as 2.85 lakh pilgrims had paid obeisance at the cave shrine of Amarnath in the south Kashmir Himalayas last year, while the number was 3.52 lakh in 2015, 3.20 lakh in 2016 and 2.60 lakh in 2017.

article_title: England Dismiss Ireland For 38 To Complete Dramatic Test Win
event: LONDON — England gave England a huge pre-Ashes boost by skittling Ireland for just 38 to win England's one-off Test by 143 runs on Friday, emphatically crushing Ireland's hopes of a stunning upset.Ireland, playing only their third Test, were chasing just 182 runs at Lord's to complete what would have been one of the biggest upsets in cricket history.But Ireland did not get close, lasting just 94 balls as Chris Woakes took a career-best six wickets for 17 runs and Stuart Broad returned figures of 4-Ireland's pitiful second-innings score was the seventh-lowest total of all time and the lowest since England ultimately prevailed on Lord's but there are major concerns over England's batting as England turn England's thoughts towards the five-match Ashes series starting next week.

article_title: Proposed Amendments Will Weaken RTI Act: Faesal
event: SRINAGAR —  JKPM President Shah Faesal has expressed concern at the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019, arguing that the proposed amendments would weaken RTI.In a statement issued on Saturday, JKPM President Shah Faesal said that through the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019 , the Centre seeks to control the salaries and tenures of the Information Commissioners in both the central and state information commissions.

article_title: Proposed Amendments Will Weaken RTI Act: Faesal
event: JKPM President Shah Faesal alleged that the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019 was an attempt to undermine the autonomy and authority of the information commissions adding that the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019 will kill the original RTI law.JKPM President Shah Faesal said that the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019, will dilute RTI by downgrading the information commissions's status, salary and autonomy, besides impacting the federal structure since the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019 curtails the information commissions's powers to decide on the degree of Independence for Information commissioners in Information commissioners's own jurisdiction.JKPM President Shah Faesal while lauding the efforts of various chief information commissioners like Wajahat Habibullah and Shailesh Gandhi, for strengthening RTI alleged that instead of strengthening the information commissions the Centre looks hell bent upon undermining the information commissions's status and powers.

article_title: Proposed Amendments Will Weaken RTI Act: Faesal
event: "The argument that status of information commissioners at par with supreme court judges is bad in law because appeals against information commissioners's judgments go to High Courts does not hold ground because never in past has the status of CIC hindered the appeals against CIC's decisions being heard by the Courts of Law", JKPM President Shah Faesal argued.JKPM President Shah Faesal suggested that the RTI Amendment Bill, 2019 should have been examined by a select committee of the Parliament and there should be public debate over the proposed amendments.

event: DODA —  An 82-year-old woman was killed and An 82-year-old woman's son seriously injured on Saturday when a rain-triggered landslide hit their mud house in DODA, police said.Over two dozen sheep were also killed in the incident which took place at Baggar area of DODA, SP (Operations), DODA, Ravinder Pal Singh said.Ravinder Pal Singh said their mud house in Doda district of Jammu and Kashmir her son came under a rain-triggered landslide around 6 am, trapping her son and her son's besides 25 sheep.A rescued operation was launched with the help of local villagers and police personnel.

article_title: Workshop Held On ‘Cyber Laws, Cyber Crime’
event: SRINAGAR — A two-day workshop for Judicial Officers, Investigators, Prosecutors, Law Officers and Officers from Anti Corruption Bureau on ‘Cyber-Laws including Cyber-Crimes, Cyber-Forensics and Cyber-Security’ commenced today at Jammu and Kashmir State Judicial Academy (JKSJA), Mominabad.The workshop is being jointly organized by J&K e-Governance Agency (J&KeGA) and J&K Information Technology Department in collaboration with J&K State Judicial Academy.On the occasion, the organizers informed that The workshop intends to build capabilities of judicial and other stakeholders in justice dispensation regarding the Cyber-Laws, Cyber-Security and Cyber-Forensics, thereby generating adequate trust and confidence in IT systems.

article_title: Workshop Held On ‘Cyber Laws, Cyber Crime’
event: The workshop will also create an assured framework for the design of security policies and for promotion and enabling actions for compliance with global security standards.Speaking during the inaugural function, Advisor to Governor, K Skandan said that Cyberspace is a complex environment consisting of interactions between people software and services supported by worldwide distribution of information and communication technology devices and networks.

article_title: Workshop Held On ‘Cyber Laws, Cyber Crime’
event: Advisor to Governor, K Skandan said that cyberspace is expected to be more complex in the foreseeable future, with many fold increase in networks and devices connected to cyberspace.Advisor to Governor, K Skandan said that owing to the numerous benefits brought by technological advancements, the cyberspace today is a common tool used by citizens, businesses, critical information infrastructures, and governments in a manner that makes it difficult to draw clear boundaries among citizens, businesses, critical information infrastructures, and governments.While dealing with the cyber space, Advisor to Governor, K Skandan said that there is a need to understand Cyber-Laws and the security aspect of the cyber space.

article_title: Workshop Held On ‘Cyber Laws, Cyber Crime’
event: Advisor to Governor, K Skandan said that The workshop will help the participants to understand different aspects of Cyber-Laws.the inaugural function was attended by Judge High Court of J&K, Justice Tashi Rabstan, Commissioner Secretary IT Rigzian Samphel, Advocate General J&K, DC Raina, Director J&K State Judicial Academy, Rajeev Gupta, Manager J&KeGA Mohsin Wani and Vice President, National Institute for Smart Government Srinath Chakravarthy.Speaking on the occasion, Judge High Court of J&K, Justice Tashi Rabstan highlighted the need to build synergy between all the stakeholders in justice delivery system, so as to take the challenges head on.

article_title: Workshop Held On ‘Cyber Laws, Cyber Crime’
event: Judge High Court of J&K, Justice Tashi Rabstan said that dissemination of knowledge of cyber law and cyber security regime is essential to create a safe cyber environment.

article_title: Workshop Held On ‘Cyber Laws, Cyber Crime’
event: Judge High Court of J&K, Justice Tashi Rabstan further added that a constant research is needed by the law enforcing agencies to keep ahead of the unscrupulous elements on cyber law.National-level security expert Amit Dubey was the resource person who holds technical sessions.The first day witnessed five technical sessions, which included introduction to computer hardware and other electronic devices and computer hardware and other electronic devices's terminologies, introduction to latest cyber-crimes and investigation methods, introduction to crimes related to social media like Facebook and Whatsapp, Crime associated with online banking and cashless transactions like credit and debit cards, e-banking app, e-wallet etc, case study and security guidelines.

article_title: GST Council Trims Rate On Electric Vehicles, Chargers To 5 Pc
event: NEW DELHI —  The high-powered GST Council on Saturday decided to reduce the tax rate on electric vehicles (EVs) to 5 per cent from the existing 12 per cent, decided.The new Goods and Services Tax (GST) rate on EVs will be effective from August 1, the finance ministry said in a statement after the 36th meeting of The high-powered GST Council.the tax rate on electric vehicles (EVs) GST has been reduce from the existing 12 per cent to 5 per cent.

article_title: GST Council Trims Rate On Electric Vehicles, Chargers To 5 Pc
event: Additionally, the tax rate on chargers or charging stations for EVs has been slashed from 18 per cent to 5 per cent.The high-powered GST Council also approved GST exemption for hiring of electric buses (of carrying capacity of more than 12 passengers) by local authorities from August 1, said said.the 36th meeting of the GST Council was held via video conferencing.The GST Council, headed by the union finance minister, has state finance ministers as members.The high-powered GST Council also took certain decisions regarding changes in GST law.The last date for filing of intimation, in Form GST CMP-02, for availing the option of payment of tax (by exclusive supplier of services) has been extended from July 31 to September 30, said added.Further, the last date for furnishing statement containing the details of the self-assessed tax in Form GST CMP-08 for the June quarter (by taxpayers under composition scheme) has been extended to July 31.

article_title: GST Council Trims Rate On Electric Vehicles, Chargers To 5 Pc
event: The earlier deadline was July 31.The central government has been taking initiative to popularise environment friendly electric vehicles.In the Union Buget 2019-20, the government provided additional income tax deduction of Rs 1.5 lakh on the interest paid on loans taken to purchase EVs.Besides, customs duty has been exempted on certain parts of EVs to further incentivise e-mobility in the country.The Centre has also approved Rs 10,000 crore to encourage faster adoption of EVs in the country under the FAME II scheme, which aims to encourage faster adoption of such vehicles by right incentives and charging infrastructure.Meanwhile, the Society of Manufacturers of Electric Vehicles (SMEV) on Saturday welcomed reduce, saying reduce is in line with the government's steps to promote eco-friendly mobility, even as the government sought a similar cut in spare batteries.the Society of Manufacturers of Electric Vehicles (SMEV) Director General Sohinder Gill said with reduce, the gap between prices of EVs and internal combustion engine vehicles will also be reduced and will thus play a part in faster adoption of electric mobility.

article_title: GST Council Trims Rate On Electric Vehicles, Chargers To 5 Pc
event: "The government is lately showing very clear intentions of promoting EVs and GST is one such measure in line with the series of actions taken by the government in the last few months," SMEV Director General Sohinder Gill said in a statement.

article_title: GST Council Trims Rate On Electric Vehicles, Chargers To 5 Pc
event: "We welcome reduce GST as reduce will reduce the gap between the EVs and the IC Engine vehicles," SMEV Director General Sohinder Gill added.SMEV Director General Sohinder Gill said if FAME-II was a dampener, reduce GST is certainly a bright spot in the national EV policy.

article_title: GST Council Trims Rate On Electric Vehicles, Chargers To 5 Pc
event: "The EV industry now awaits the corresponding reduction of the 18% GST in the spares batteries as the corresponding reduction of the 18% GST in the spares batteries will help maintain the low running cost of EVs over EVs's lifetime," SMEV Director General Sohinder Gill said.

article_title: Kashmir On Edge As Speculations on 35A Run Riot
event: SRINAGAR — The Union Home Ministry’s order of rushing 10,000 additional paramilitary personnel to Kashmir followed by a police missive on riot control equipment have amplified apprehensions on the ground about the removal of the Article 35A and Article 370.Though the Jammu and Kashmir police on Saturday clarified The Union Home Ministry’s's decision to deploy 10,000 additional paramilitary personnel in Kashmir was a routine exercise, speculations were rife that 10,000 additional paramilitary personnel were inducted and trained to prepare for a big event after the conclusion of the Amarnath Yatra on 15 August.New Delhi based news agency IANS quoting top sources in the governmenteven reported on Saturday that the countdown for the removal of the Article 35A Jammu and Kashmir has started.One of the major poll planks for the BJP was the scrapping of Articles 35A and 370 in Jammu and Kashmir.Earlier Kashmiri unionist politicians as well as activists had started hinting that The Union Home Ministry’s was about to abrogate the Article 35Apermanent residents .

article_title: Kashmir On Edge As Speculations on 35A Run Riot

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: SRINAGAR — The Amarnath yatra from the three main base camps was suspended Sunday due to widespread intermittent rains in Jammu and Kashmir for the fourth successive day, with the weather department predicting snowfall in the cave area later in Sunday, officials said.officials said that any decision on resumption will be taken later in Sunday based on the weather condition.However, nearly 1,000 pilgrims who had reached the cave shrine situated at an altitude of 3,880 metre in south Kashmir Himalayas were allowed to offer prayers in the morning, officials said.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: "To avoid any untoward incident, no pilgrim was allowed from the three main base camps Jammu-- Sunday morning," a yatra official said.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: a yatra official said The Amarnath yatra from the three main base camps was suspended in view of the intermittent rains in wide parts of the state for the fourth successive day which rendered the tracks unsafe.The helicopter service was also suspended for Sunday due to bad weather, a yatra official said.All the pilgrims who had reached various halting stations enroute to the cave shrine situated at an altitude of 3,880 metre in south Kashmir Himalayas are safe, a yatra official said.On Sunday, 990 pilgrims paid 990 pilgrims's obeisance till 10 am at the cave shrine situated at an altitude of 3,880 metre in south Kashmir Himalayas, raising the footfall so far this year to 3,18,816.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: The Amarnath yatra from the three main base camps commenced from the twin routes -- 36-km traditional Pahalgam in Anantnag district and a shorter 14-km Baltal in Ganderbal district track in Ganderbal district -- on July 1 and is scheduled to end on August 15, coinciding with the festival of Raksha Bandhan.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: the weather department Director Sonam Lotus said there was no forecast of any major change in the prevailing weather conditions.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: "the weather department expect significant fall in temperature at Baltal in Ganderbal district, the cave shrine situated at an altitude of 3,880 metre in south Kashmir Himalayas and Sheshnag areas during next couple of days.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: the cave area may even get snowfall this (Sunday) evening," State Meteorological Department Director Sonam Lotus said, urging the pilgrims to take necessary precautionary measures and wear woolen clothes and raincoats to stay warm.State Meteorological Department Director Sonam Lotus State Meteorological Department Director Sonam Lotus said significant improvement is most likely from July 1 onwards.

article_title: Inclement Weather Forces Amarnath Yatra Suspension
event: A total of 33 people including 29 pilgrims, two 'sevadaars' (volunteers) and two security personnel have died, mostly due to natural causes, since the commencement of The Amarnath yatra from the three main base camps this year.Deaths due to cardiac arrest triggered by lack of oxygen in the area around the cave shrine situated at an altitude of 3,880 metre in south Kashmir Himalayas have been common over the years, prompting the Shri Amarnath Shrine Board to issue regular health advisories to pilgrims.As many as 40 pilgrims have taken ill or sustained injuries due to shooting stones and other causes since the commencement of the yatra this year, officials said.

article_title: Let us introspect
event: Social networking sites including Face book and Twitter serve as another example of this phenomenon.

article_title: Let us introspect
event: The ideas of fun, frivolity, redundancy, and sheer narcissism promoted by Social networking sites including Face book and Twitter completely redefine our attitudes towards our lives In a society which trains a society which trains its citizens in the art and philosophy of achieving instant self-gratification's citizens in the art and philosophy of achieving instant self-gratification, of becoming thoroughly submerged in one’s own bubble of pleasure, it becomes dangerously difficult for one to develop a world consciousness and concern for others.

article_title: Let us introspect
event: The intensity of this struggle is signified by the fact that one has to cultivate one's concern for society without the help of society, and consequently, many will often be left aside to froth around in the artificial sands of many's own world.

article_title: Let us introspect
event: Yet, for the most part, their own world too is not even many's own, and is rather the mass amalgamation of what the rest of the world (as many know the world) is – from idolizing celebrities that many wished many were, to chasing after the will-o’-the-wisp of appearing important and popular in the eyes of other people (assisted through mediums such as Face book), to engaging in intense debates on the most frivolous of issues that have no actual connection to many's own life (including sports), many's mind and efforts become wholly tied in a struggle and existence that is not many.

article_title: US Intel Chief To Leave Trump Administration
event: WASHINGTON — US intelligence chief Dan Coats will leave office next month, Donald Trump announced on Sunday, after a tenure in which US intelligence chief Dan Coats was regularly at odds with Donald Trump.leave is the latest high-profile exit from Donald Trump's turnover-plagued administration.Donald Trump tweeted that US intelligence chief Dan Coats will leave on August 15, saying Donald Trump plans to nominate Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, to replace US intelligence chief Dan Coats.

article_title: US Intel Chief To Leave Trump Administration
event: "A former US Attorney, Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, will lead and inspire greatness for the Country Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, loves," Donald Trump wrote, also thanking US intelligence chief Dan Coats "for US intelligence chief Dan Coats's great service to our Country".If nominate is approved, Donald Trump will get an intelligence chief who is more in synch with Donald Trump's views.In Congress, Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, has been a staunch defender of Donald Trump and has criticised two of Donald Trump's nemeses, former FBI chief James Comey and special counsel Robert Mueller.Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, has also said Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, has "seen no evidence" that Russian election meddling helped bring Donald Trump to office, has backed Donald Trump's assertion that court-approved surveillance of Donald Trump's campaign amounted to spying, and has supported Donald Trump's hawkish policy on Iran.nominate was hailed by various Republicans — including House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy, who tweeted that Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees, "will bring strength and accountability in Representative John Ratcliffe of Texas, who serves on the House intelligence, judiciary and homeland security committees,'s new role" — but drew criticism from other quarters.

article_title: US Intel Chief To Leave Trump Administration

Korea, ISHe backed the US intelligence community's conclusion that Russia interfered in the 2016 election that brought Donald Trump to office — something Donald Trump was long loath to acknowledge.US intelligence chief Dan Coats also disagreed with Donald Trump's decision to hold two hours of closed-door talks with Russian President Vladmir Putin in Helsinki in July 2018 with no one else present but interpreters.

article_title: US Intel Chief To Leave Trump Administration

Korea to give up N. Korea's nuclear arsenal via talks with Pyongyang's leader Kim Jong Un was another point of disagreement.

article_title: US Intel Chief To Leave Trump Administration

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Unemployment continues to balk growth prospects of J&K state.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: There are too many figures that point the grave situation J&K state is heading towards.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: The administration is already cognizant of too many figures that point the grave situation the state is heading towards and what too many figures that point the grave situation the state is heading towards entail; therefore any effort to make The administration realize the seriousness is wastage of time.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Leaving the stats aside, attention needs to be drawn upon the treatment than diagnosis of the malady called unemployment.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: All government policies in the last ten-year period implemented to reduce joblessness in J&K state are either tainted exposing the myopic vision of the policy makers or are no-hopers due to wrong implementation.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Failure to bring any significant change over a decade has led to extreme cynicism as most of the people in J&K state doubt whether any government will be capable of delivering on it.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: With no alternative provided yet to completely replace the lucrative government job, the oversized public sector goes on expanding.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Policymakers seem at crossroads when it comes to establishing a balance between public and private sector employment.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: the oversized public sector is not a healthy sign for the state economy, which has been proven and established.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Governments come and go leaving behind only long queues of jobless youth before recruitment agencies.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Better recruitment process with fast track recruitments does not change anything.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: The saturation in public sector has been reached a long time ago, and it is only failure to create vacancies and ventures in private sector that governments still make government job a palatable idea to the starving jobless youth of J&K state.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Instead of saying a clear “No” and prevent further damage to state economy, politics over unemployment has been the way.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Governments have failed to induct entrepreneurship, earlier believed to be an anodyne to ease public sector constraints.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: In private sector wealth and dividends are not based on equity as wealth and dividends often accumulate in few hands.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Exploitation is high, work conditions are inimical, incentives are less.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: There is no agency to monitor and check any of these impediments.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Many initiatives to help the small industries and private players are almost forgotten.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Benefits to industrial units are lost due to corruption and favoritism.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Retirement age in government services is increased, officers to retire are re-employed.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: Successive governments have tried to play around with the job or recruitment policy.

article_title: Recruitments and unemployment
event: But the fact remains, that many appointments in the public sector have followed a known script with the blue-eyed and backdoor appointments taking the sheen off the recruitment drives.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: The Jammu and Kashmir state since The Jammu and Kashmir state's accession to India has turned into a flashpoint threating to engulf whole of South Asia into a nuclear holocaust.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: While the issue should have been resolved long back so that the existential threat to nearly 2 billion people could be evaded but it appears political leadership is deliberately dragging the issue towards precarious state of affairs.Continuing political leadership anti-Kashmir policies, political leadership is reportedly preparing a  roadmap by which political leadership is willing to abrogate the special status given to residents of Jammu Kashmir under article 35A of Indian constitution.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: article 35A of Indian constitution Indian constitution is an article that allows The Jammu and Kashmir state's Jammu legislature to define “permanent resident” of The Jammu and Kashmir state.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: article 35A of Indian constitution was added to Indian constitution through a situationary Presidential Order on 14 May 1954.In July 2015, a think-tank called the Jammu & Kashmir Study Centre first came up with the idea to challenge article 35A of Indian constitution in the Supreme Court.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: A petition was filed in the Delhi High Court against article 35A of Indian constitution.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: Later, article 35A of Indian constitution was also challenged in the Supreme Court.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: Since then the BJP government also criticizes this law and considers this law as a descrimnatory which violates the Article 14 of Indian constitution i,e Right To Equality.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: The people of The Jammu and Kashmir state don't want this law to go as The people of the state think that the nullification of this law could change the demography of The Jammu and Kashmir state and degrade the status of Kashmir issue.The end of article 35A of Indian constitution can lead to serious chain reaction in the strife torm Kashmir.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: The end of Article 35A would create law and order problems in the state that has yet to recover from the earlier bouts of upheavals of 2008, 2010 and 2016 besides floods and other manmade disasters.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: Economic losses and loss of academic years of students are certain as speculation of potential unrest following any tampering with the special status given to residents of Jammu and Kashmir under article 35A of Indian constitution loom large.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: Separitists and unionist politicians in the Valley have already warned political leadership mass agitatons and uprisings in case article 35A of Indian constitution is tinkered with.

article_title: Scraping Article 35A
event: political leadership needs to be serious and avoid the vote bank polity so that the state already in deep stress can take some respite.Ahmad Yasir yasirahmad01206@gmail.com

article_title: Interpol Refuses Red Notice Against Zakir Naik
event: LONDON — The Interpol has again refused to issue Red Corner Notice against Dr. Zakir Naik, instructing all The Interpol's offices to dispose of all the files and information about Dr. Zakir Naik.The Interpol has communicated India that Red Corner Notice against Dr. Zakir Naik could not be issued for a lack of evidence about any wrongdoing, said a spokesman for Dr. Zakir Naik in LONDON sharing with him the official correspondence.The Interpol's Commission took the decision in The Interpol’s Commission's 109th session held on 01 to 05.Subsequently, the Interpol General Secretariat deleted all data on Dr. Zakir Naik on 15th July as per a letter from The Interpol’s Commission for Control of Files.refused comes as a setback to the Indian government that has been persistently trying to get a Red Corner Notice against Naik, who has been accused of radical preaching — a claim Dr. Zakir Naik rejects.This is the third attempt of India to convince The Interpol to issue the notice.

article_title: Interpol Refuses Red Notice Against Zakir Naik
event: The first attempt was made in mid-2017.The Indian government had multiple meetings and presentations with an The Interpol team in New Delhi in the last one year, the source claimed.a letter from Interpol’s Commission for Control of Files the Interpol General Secretariat said, “After a thorough examination of the elements before The Interpol’s Commission, The Interpol’s Commission found that the data (read “charges”) challenged raised questions as to compliance with applicable rules”.

article_title: Interpol Refuses Red Notice Against Zakir Naik
event: a letter from Interpol’s Commission for Control of Files implies that the charges and allegations against Dr. Zakir Naik were unsubstantiated and vague, and the Indian authorities had failed to follow the due process of The Interpol's rules of charges and proof submission.its 109th session held on 01 to 05.Subsequently was listening to the charges made by India through the NCB of India against Dr. Zakir Naik of “promoting enmity between two different religious groups on grounds of religion and doing acts prejudicial to the maintenance of harmony, being a member of unlawful Association etc.

article_title: Interpol Refuses Red Notice Against Zakir Naik
event: "The Indian government had banned Dr. Zakir Naik and Dr. Zakir Naik's organization — Islamic Research Foundation (IRF) — in November 2016.Following banned, all the operations of his organization — Islamic Research Foundation (IRF) were stopped, and all the staff [relieved of all the staff's duties].Since banned, India has charged Dr. Zakir Naik with terrorism and money laundering.

article_title: Interpol Refuses Red Notice Against Zakir Naik
event: Dr. Zakir Naik denies both the charges, terming terrorism and money laundering politically-motivated.
