article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: WASHINGTON — In a recent study it has been found that Vitamin D supplementation may slow type 2 diabetes progression rate in newly diagnosed and pre-diabetes patients.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: a recent study was published in the journal, 'European Journal of Endocrinology.type 2 diabetes is an increasingly prevalent disease, which puts a huge burden on patients and society and can also lead to serious health problems including nerve damage, blindness and kidney failure.People suffering from a high risk of developing type 2 diabetes (prediabetes) can be identified by several risk factors including obesity or a family history of type 2 diabetes.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: Although low vitamin D levels have previously been associated with an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes, some studies have reported no improvement in metabolic function.However, some studies often had a low number of participants or included individuals with normal vitamin D levels at the start who were metabolically healthy, or who had long-standing type 2 diabetes.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: Whether vitamin D supplementation has any beneficial effect in patients with prediabetes or with newly diagnosed diabetes, especially in those who have low vitamin D levels, remains uncertain.In a recent study, lead researcher Dr. Claudia Gagnon along with lead researcher Dr. Claudia Gagnon's fellow researchers examined the effect of vitamin D supplementation on glucose metabolism in patients who are newly diagnosed with type 2 diabetes or identified as at high risk of developing type 2 diabetes.Markers of insulin function and glucose metabolism were measured before and after six months of high-dose vitamin D supplementation (approximately 5-10 times the recommended dose).Although only 46 per cent of study participants were determined to have low vitamin D levels at the start of a recent study, supplementation with vitamin D significantly improved the action of insulin in muscle tissue of study participants after six months.lead researcher Dr. Claudia Gagnon said, "The reason lead researcher Dr. Claudia Gagnon along with her fellow researchers saw improvements in glucose metabolism following vitamin D supplementation in those at high risk of diabetes, or with newly diagnosed diabetes, while other studies failed to demonstrate an effect in people with long-standing type 2 diabetes is unclear.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: failed could be due to the fact that improvements in metabolic function are harder to detect in those with a longer-term disease or that longer treatment time is needed to see the benefits.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: "The lead researchers suggested that future studies should evaluate whether there are individual clinical or genetic factors that affect how different people respond to vitamin D supplementation and if the positive effect on metabolism is maintained in the longer term.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: "Type 2 diabetes and prediabetes are a growing public health concern and although lead researcher Dr. Claudia Gagnon along with her fellow researchers's results are promising, further studies are required to confirm lead researcher Dr. Claudia Gagnon along with her fellow researchers's findings, to identify whether some people may benefit more from this intervention, and to evaluate the safety of high-dose vitamin D supplementation in the long term.

article_title: Take Vitamin D Supplements To Slow Progression Of Type 2 Diabetes
event: Until then I would suggest that current vitamin D supplementation recommendations be followed," I added.

article_title: Netanyahu Puts Up Election Ads Featuring Modi
event: TEL AVIV — Ahead of an unprecedented snap polls on September 17, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud Party has put banners featuring Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's pictures with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin to lure support by presenting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's in a "different league".The Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud Party headquarters on Metzudat Ze'ev 38, King George Street, in TEL AVIV was seen with election advertisement banners depicting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's closeness with his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin with Hebrew text on top saying, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's (in a) "different league".Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's campaign has focused on bringing out Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's close chemistry with his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin and trying to project Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's as a leader of unmatched stature in Israeli politics which is crucial for the country's security.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's will be travelling to India on a day-long visit on September 9 to meet his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, just eight days before the repeat polls in India, in what some political analysts feel is a photo-op to project Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's acceptance worldwide and prop up Netanyahu's campaign just before the repeat polls in the Jewish state.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu'sthe country's's , is facing a tough political challenge as opinion polls show flagging fortunes for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud Party.Ha'aretz columnist Yossi Verter, in an opinion piece, 'Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's Out of Luck, but Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's Hoping a Photo-op With India's Will Help', recently argued that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu'sIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's , must find a way to bounce back.He wrote that that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's Office in Jerusalem is said to have reached out to their counterparts in New Delhi and requested for an invitation.He also pointed out how Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's used Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's closeness with US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin to "win favours" to boost Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's campaign before the polls on April 9.Israeli lawmakers in May voted 74-45 in favour of dissolving the 21st Knesset (Parliament) and hold an unprecedented re-elections on September 17 after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's failed to form a coalition government after the September 9 polls.Trump and Putin had announced major concessions for the country's to support Netanyahu's campaign which some analysts saw as an attempt to intervene in Israeli elections.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's had in fact tried to also meet his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi before the April 9 polls but meet did not work out due to scheduling issues.Informed sources told PTI that the first request for an invitation for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's to visit New Delhi was made in January during the visit of Israeli National Security Adviser Meir Ben-Sabbath to India.

article_title: Netanyahu Puts Up Election Ads Featuring Modi
event: The two leaders were scheduled to meet on February 11 before Israeli elections but Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's called off Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's's trip to New Delhi due to other engagements.The efforts regarding visit were renewed after the Israeli parliament was dissolved and fresh elections announced.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visited India in January 2018, while his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi travelled to TEL AVIV in 2017, becoming the first Indian prime minister to tour India.A picture of two of The two leaders strolling barefoot at the Olga beach in northern Israel during his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi's visit to India in 2017 created waves with talks of bromance' in the country's.The close chemistry between The two leaders has been often discussed in the Israeli press.

event: ISLAMABAD — Pakistan on Monday summoned India's Deputy High Commissioner and condemned the alleged "unprovoked ceasefire violations" by Indian troops across the Line of Control which resulted in the death a woman.Director General (South Asia and SAARC) Mohammad Faisal, who is also the foreign ministry spokesman, summoned India's Deputy High Commissioner and "condemned the alleged "unprovoked ceasefire violations" by Indian troops across the Line of Control which resulted in the death a womanthe Line of Control," the Foreign Office (FO) said in a statement.On Sunday, firing in the Nezapir Sector, killed a woman in Mandhar village and injured three others.

event: On Sunday, another civilian was injured due to firing in the Kailer Sector along the LoC, a statement said.Director General (South Asia and SAARC) said that the Indian forces along the LoC and the Working boundary are "continuously targeting civilian populated areas with heavy weapons."

article_title: Pak Summons Senior Indian Diplomat Over 'Ceasefire Violations'

article_title: Pak Summons Senior Indian Diplomat Over 'Ceasefire Violations'

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: Rushing of ten thousand more troops to Valley a day after the National Security Advisor Ajit Doval's three day visit to Kashmir has created panic in the state.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: People suspect the worst.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: The general opinion is that the further militarization of Valley  is being done as part of a preparation to remove the Article 35A of the Indian constitution which forbids people from the rest of the country to buy land in the state In Kashmir, the people see the further militarization of the Valley as a prelude to change of the demographic character of the state, something that some sections of the ruling party in New Delhi see as essential to resolve Kashmir.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: the ruling party in New Delhi also sees the Articles 370 - which grants special constitutional status to the state within Indian Union - and the Article 35A of the Indian constitution which forbids people from the rest of the country to buy land in J&K.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: as hurdles to the state's integration and assimilation with the rest of the countrythe country.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: There is thus no support to these measures among  the predominant majority of the state.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: the predominant majority of the state see these measures as inherently geared to not only to snatch the special rights of the state guaranteed by the Indian constitution.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: There is thus understandable paranoia at the prospect of the ruling party in New Delhi going ahead with the ruling party in New Delhi's ideologically rooted commitment of doing away with the the state's constitutional safeguards.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: What has further lent credence to the fears in Kashmir is the decision of the central leadership of the ruling party in New Delhi to hold an "urgent meeting" of the members of the ruling party in New Delhi core group in the state  in Delhi on Tuesday.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: The major political parties and the civil society actors in the state have voiced The major political parties and the civil society actors in the state's opposition to what are still the anticipated moves by the centre against the Articles 370 - which grants special constitutional status to J&K within Indian Union - and 35A The PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti has strongly opposed any move by against the Articles 370 - which grants special constitutional status to J&K within Indian Union - and 35A.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: "PDP want to tell the centre that tinkering with the Article 35A of the Indian constitution which forbids people from the rest of the country to buy land in J&K.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: will be akin to setting a powder keg on fire," The PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti said at a function to celebrate The PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti's twentieth raising.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: Similarly NC leader Omar Abdullah has cautioned New Delhi  against pre-empting the cases against constitutional protections in Supreme Court in New Delhi's rush to do away with constitutional protections.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: So have Sajad Gani Lone, Engineer Rashid and Shah Faesal.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: What, however, hasn't happened so far is a joint strategy by these parties to stop the presumed assault on the state's special status.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: More than issuing statements, these parties should close ranks and these parties's top leaders should in right earnest visit New Delhi to meet the Prime Minister Narendra Modi and apprise the Prime Minister Narendra Modi about the long term detrimental fallout of any tinkering with the state's special constitutional provisions.

article_title: Panic In Valley
event: the ruling party in New Delhi needs leadership in these anxious and the ruling party in New Delhi should step up and provide leadership in these anxious.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: RIYADH — Saudi Arabia plans to restrict certain hospitality jobs to Saudi Arabia's own citizens by the end of the year, banning the recruitment of foreign workers for certain hospitality jobs.The decision, announced in a Labor Ministry statement on Friday, will apply to resorts, hotels rated three stars or higher, and hotel apartments rated four stars or higher.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: certain hospitality jobs range from front-desk jobs to management.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: Among the exceptions are drivers, doormen and porters, Labor Ministry said in a Labor Ministry statement.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: Other jobs that will be restricted to nationals include restaurant host and health club supervisor.As Saudi Arabia tries to develop Saudi Arabia's fledgling tourism industry, Saudi Arabia’s also tackling citizen unemployment, which hit a high of nearly 13% last year.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: Hospitality is the latest sector to face stricter “Saudization” policies, which call for replacing the foreigners who dominate many parts of the private sector -- particularly blue collar and service jobs.Officials say such policies are necessary to create jobs for Saudis in Saudi Arabia.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: However, some businesses complain that Saudization increases the cost of hiring and lowers productivity.plans will be enforced from an Islamic calendar date likely to correspond with Dec. 29.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: Many hotels had already begun hiring Saudis to fill front-desk jobs in recent years, part of a gradual cultural shift as Saudis begin to take up jobs that once would have been considered undesirable.

article_title: Saudi Arabia To Ban Foreigners From Hospitality Jobs
event: ( Bloomberg)

article_title: India Davis Cup Team Set To Tour Pakistan
event: MUMBAI — An Indian team will travel to Pakistan for a Davis Cup tie in September, the All India Tennis Association (AITA) has said, despite strained relations between the nations.the nations have gone to war three times since independence in the mid-20th century and another conflict nearly erupted earlier this year, giving an even spicier-than-usual geopolitical backdrop to sporting rivalries.India’s cricket team has not toured Pakistan since 2007 and bilateral cricketing ties between the nations have remained suspended since 2008.Relations further soured in February this year after a suicide car bombing killed at least 40 Indian paramilitary police in Indian-controlled Kashmir putting question marks on a Davis Cup tie.“It’s not a bilateral series, “It’s the World Cup of tennis.

article_title: India Davis Cup Team Set To Tour Pakistan
event: So no government clearance was required,” the All India Tennis Association (AITA) Secretary General Hironmoy Chatterjee told Reuters.“We needed an invitation from Pakistan for the visa process which An Indian team have received.

article_title: India Davis Cup Team Set To Tour Pakistan
event: An Indian team are applying for the visas soon as the visa process which we have received’s a lengthy process.”An Indian tennis team last toured Pakistan in 1964 for Davis Cup when they defeated Pakistan 4-0 while Pakistan lost 3-2 in Pakistan's last visit in 2006 in MUMBAI.Until a few years back Pakistan was forced to host Pakistan's home Davis Cup ties at neutral venues as teams refused to travel due to security concerns.AITA Secretary General Hironmoy Chatterjee said the International Tennis Federation has put in place stringent security requirements to host Davis Cup ties and India’s's players are looking forward to winning a Davis Cup tie and progress to the World Group qualifier.“The security arrangements are ensured by the International Tennis Federation.

article_title: India Davis Cup Team Set To Tour Pakistan
event: the International Tennis Federation's officials will be present during a Davis Cup tie,” AITA Secretary General Hironmoy Chatterjee added.“We have not made any special security demands.”

article_title: Cross LoC Firing Kills Baby, Woman
event: SRINAGAR — A 10-day-old baby from Poonch and a woman from Kashmir controlled by Pakistan were killed as New Delhi and Islamabad troops exchanged fire along the Line of Control, officials and reports said on Monday.

article_title: Cross LoC Firing Kills Baby, Woman
event: PTI reported that A 10-day-old baby from Poonchthe Line of Control, died at a hospital on Monday in Poonch, police said.A 10-day-old baby from Poonch, A 10-day-old baby from Poonch's mother Fatima Jan (35) and another civilian Mohammad Arif (40) were injured when mortar shells fired by Pakistan hit The infant, his mother Fatima Jan (35) and another civilian Mohammad Arif (40)'s village in Shahpur sector late Sunday.The infant, his mother Fatima Jan (35) and another civilian Mohammad Arif (40) were rushed to district hospital Poonch, where A 10-day-old baby from Poonch succumbed to injuries in the early hours of Monday, a police official said.a police official said a woman from Kashmir controlled by Pakistan were referred to Government Medical College Hospital Jammu for specialised treatment, though a woman from Kashmir controlled by Pakistan's condition was stated to be "stable".Pakistani troops lobbed mortars and used small arms to target forward posts and villages in Shahpur sector, Saujiyan and Mendhar sectors between 5 pm and 10 pm on Sunday.Several houses were also damaged in exchanged, a police official said.However, there was no fresh report of ceasefire violation by Pakistan from anywhere in Poonch so far.The Indian Army retaliated to silence the Pakistani guns but the casualties on Pakistani side was not known immediately, an Army officer said.On July 22, an Indian soldier was killed in Pakistani firing in Sunderbani sector of Rajouri district, while a civilian was also injured in another incident of ceasefire violation by Pakistan in Poonch on July 20.Meanwhile, according to a report in dawn.com, at least one woman was killed while other civilians were injured in a village in "unprovoked" ceasefire violation across LoC.According to Muhammad Zaheer, a disaster management officer in Haveli, “Indian forces began shelling and firing in the Nezapir sector at about 3:45pm and in Khurshidabad sector at around 6pm on Sunday without any provocation".

article_title: Cross LoC Firing Kills Baby, Woman
event: "They used both small and big arms and targeted civilian populations, restricting people indoors till late night," Muhammad Zaheer, a disaster management officer in Haveli said, according the report.Rehmat Jan, a 45-year-old woman who lived in Mendhar, died after being hit by the splinters of a mortar shell, Muhammad Zaheer, a disaster management officer in Haveli said.

article_title: Cross LoC Firing Kills Baby, Woman
event: Another resident of Mendhar, Begum Jan (48) was injured due to Indian shelling, Muhammad Zaheer, a disaster management officer in Haveli said.Three civilians — Zainab Jan (60), Muhammad Naeem Dar (24) and Ulfat Rashid (17) — were injured in Kairni village while Munir Hussain (20), Kausar Parveen (26) and Nosheen (18) were wounded in Kachar Ban.

article_title: Cross LoC Firing Kills Baby, Woman
event: The casualties occurred in Khurshidabad and Nezapir sectors of Haveli district — which lies near the Line of Control — on Sunday night but the authorities shared the information with media on Monday, the report added.

article_title: Garbage Collection, Treatment: HC Seeks SMC Report Within A Week
event: SRINAGAR — The Jammu and High Court on Monday granted a week’s time to the Srinagar Municipal Corporation to reveal details regarding stepwise method of garbage collection, garbage's segregation, dumping and ultimate treatment accorded to garbage.

event: SRINAGAR — Seeking to put to rest speculations about a possible "major development" in Jammu and Kashmir, Governor Satya Pal Malik said on Tuesday that "everything is fine, everything is normal" and rejected as "invalid" government orders that had generated panic in recent days.A series of government orders, including the one which spoke of prolonged law and order situation, had generated widespread speculation that the Centre was planning to abrogate Article 35-A of the Constitution, which provides exclusive rights to immoveable property and government jobs only to Jammu and KashmirJammu Kashmir.Political parties in Kashmir had reacted strongly to such a possibility, warning of dire consequences.Dismissing the speculation, Governor Satya Pal Malik said, "Koi valid order nahi hai jo dikhayi diya gaya hai (There are no valid orders that are in circulation on social media)".Governor Satya Pal Malik was replying to questions about the orders floating on social media regarding storage of ration due to a possible law and order situation in the wake of alteration in the special status of Kashmir.The replies from Governor Satya Pal Malik seek to put to rest a week's uncertainty that had been dogging Kashmir especially after the Centre had rushed 100 companies (10,000 security personnel) to Kashmir.Kashmir is a place where if someone sneezes in Lal Chowk, the same incident is projected as a bomb blast at Raj Bhavan," Governor Satya Pal Malik said.

article_title: Triple Talaq Bill Passed By Parliament
event: NEW DELHI  — Parliament on Tuesday approved the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence, after the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence was passed by Rajya Sabha following non-aligned BJD extending support and NDA constituents JD-U and AIADMK walking out.Lok Sabha had passed the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence last week and with Rajya Sabha now approving the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence, the practice of instant divorce by Muslim men will be punishable by jail term of up to three years.The Upper House passed the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence by 99 votes in favour and 84 against the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence.The Upper House earlier rejected an opposition sponsored motion to send the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence to a Rajya Sabha Select Committee with 100 votes against an opposition sponsored motion to send the bill to a Rajya Sabha Select Committee as compared to 84 in favour.While non-aligned BJD supported the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence, NDA constituents JD-U and AIADMK AIADMK walked out, lowering the majority mark which normally stands at 121.

article_title: Triple Talaq Bill Passed By Parliament
event: NDA has 107 members in Rajya Sabha.NDA was also helped by the absence of some members of SP and BSP as well as those of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and YSR-Congress.The same strategy had helped the government push through the contentious amendment to the Right To Information (RTI) Act last week despite lacking numbers in The Upper House.Once granted assent by the President, the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence will replace an ordinance promulgated last on February 21 to the same effect as the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence.Replying to a four-and-half-hour debate on the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad cited jail provisions in the legislations that ban dowry and multiple marriages by Hindu men to justify the three-year jail term for Muslim men practices triple talaq.To Leader of the Opposition Ghulam Nabi Azad, who termed the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence as a politically motivated move to destroy Muslim households with domestic fights, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said Leader of the Opposition Ghulam Nabi Azad, who termed the bill as a politically motivated move to destroy Muslim households with domestic fights should think of why the Opposition could never win majority following the peak of 400-plus seats the Opposition won in 1984.He saw the 1986 Shah Bano case, where the Opposition did not stick the Opposition's neck out to support women rights, as the main reason for the downfall of the Opposition.the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said, was not being brought due to the Supreme Court ruling of 2017 declaring talaq-e-biddat, commonly referred to as instant triple talaq, unconstitutional.

article_title: Triple Talaq Bill Passed By Parliament
event: "I am a minister of Narendra Modi government and not Rajiv Gandhi government," Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said citing the Shah Bano case of 1986.He said Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad cannot leave in lurch women who have been divorced by triple talaq via WhatsApp or other such means.When Muslim world is trying to reform, why can't a democracy do the same, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.Trying to shed anti-Muslim image, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the Opposition gave the nation a President from the same community.On opposition charge of targeting Muslims, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the Opposition may be getting a little less votes from the same community but the Opposition considers the same community very much a part of the nation and works on the principle of 'sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas'.Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence should not be seen through a political prism as it is a matter of humanity, woman empowerment and gender equality.

article_title: Triple Talaq Bill Passed By Parliament
event: "More than 20 Islamic nations have regulated triple talaq," Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.Azad said the Opposition has been forced to vote against the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence after the government did not accept the Opposition's demand to send the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence to a select committee and make triple talaq a civil offence.the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence triple talaq could not make it through The Upper House earlier this year during the first term of Narendra Modi government, although the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence was passed by Lok Sabha.the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence was again passed by Lok Sabha last week amid a walkout by several opposition parties including the Opposition and the Trinamool Congress.several opposition parties including the Congress and the Trinamool Congress say in the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence's current form, the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence could be misused to harass Muslims and wanted the bill that makes instant triple talaq a criminal offence to be reviewed by a parliamentary committee.

article_title: Parliament Passes Bill To Curb Ponzi Schemes; Protect Poor
event: NEW DELHI — Parliament on Monday unanimously passed the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back poor depositors's hard earned money.The Rajya Sabha passed with voice vote the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back their hard earned money.

article_title: Parliament Passes Bill To Curb Ponzi Schemes; Protect Poor
event: The Lok Sabha had passed the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back their hard earned money on July 24, 2019. the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back their hard earned money replaced the Ordinance on the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back their hard earned money.Replying to a debate on the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back their hard earned money, Minister of State for Finance Anurag Singh Thakur said the Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Bill, 2019, which seeks to put in place a mechanism by which poor depositors will get back their hard earned money would protect the hard earned money of the poor people.

article_title: Parliament Passes Bill To Curb Ponzi Schemes; Protect Poor

article_title: Parliament Passes Bill To Curb Ponzi Schemes; Protect Poor

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: BEIJING — Amid allegations of abuse and involuntary detention, officials from China's northwestern Xinjiang region have said most of the people who were in China's northwestern Xinjiang region's controversial re-education centres had left the area's controversial re-education centres and signed "work contracts" with local companies.At a press briefing in BEIJING on Tuesday, Shohrat Zakir, China's northwestern Xinjiang region's Uighur governor, declined to say how many people were being held in the area's controversial re-education centres, but defended the area's controversial re-education centres as an effective and "pioneering" approach to counter "terrorism".

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: "Most of the graduates from the area's controversial re-education centres have been reintegrated into society," Shohrat Zakir, Xinjiang's Uighur governor, said.

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: "More than 90 percent of the graduates from the vocational training centres have found satisfactory jobs with good incomes.

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: "The United States, human rights groups and independent analysts estimate that around one million Muslims have been arbitrarily detained in the area's controversial re-education centresChina's .China's northwestern Xinjiang region is home to Uighurs, Kazakhs and other predominantly Muslim ethnic minority groups.China's northwestern Xinjiang region Vice Chairman Alken Tuniaz said accounts of mistreatment in the area's controversial re-education centres had been concocted by a few countries and media outlets.People were allowed to "request time off" and "regularly go home", and while People were not permitted to practise People's religion during People's "period of study," People were able to do so once People were at home, Xinjiang Vice Chairman Alken Tuniaz said.The officials did not address whether the area's controversial re-education centres was voluntary or how often people were allowed to go home.

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: 'Prison in the mountains'Testimony from people who have escaped the area's controversial re-education centres provides a much darker picture, however.In July 2018, a former teacher at one of the area's controversial re-education centres told a court in Kazakhstan that "in China's, they call one of the centres a political camp but really one of the centres was a prison in the mountains".The Human Rights Watch has accused China's of conducting a "mass systematic campaign of human rights violations" against the Turkic-speaking Muslim minority group.China's is also accused of prohibiting the use of the headscarf and observance of fasting during the month of Ramadan.Meanwhile, Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said on Tuesday that Ankara was sending an observation team to China's northwestern Xinjiang region.

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: said came after Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu discussed the situation of the Turkic-speaking Muslim minority group with Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu's Chinese counterpart.Turkey's has regularly expressed concerned about the plight of the Turkic-speaking Muslim minority group.Separately, China's's anti-corruption watchdog said on Tuesday that a senior official in China's northwestern Xinjiang region was under investigation.Enwaer Tursun, an ethnic Uighur who as the mayor of the ancient Silk Road city of Kashgar, backed the crackdown in China's northwestern Xinjiang region, became deputy secretary-general of China's northwestern Xinjiang region's People's Congress in 2017.The local branch of China's anti-corruption watchdog said a senior official in the special administrative region was being investigated for "serious violations of discipline and law", which usually means corruption.a senior official in the special administrative region "is currently under disciplinary review and supervision investigation" by China's northwestern Xinjiang region's discipline inspection commission, AFP news agency reported, citing a statement from China's anti-corruption watchdog.a senior official in the special administrative region is the latest official to have come under suspicion as part of President Xi Jinping's campaign against corruption in the Communist Party, which critics have compared with a political purge.

article_title: China Defends Controversial-Education Centres For Uighur
event: Another top Uighur official, Nur Bekri, a former chairman of China's northwestern Xinjiang region who has also headed the national energy administration, pleaded guilty at a trial last week to accepting $11.5m in bribes.

article_title: RTO Asked To Issue Circular On Safety Of School Buses
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary Transport Department Dr Asghar Hassan Samoon on Monday chaired a meeting to take a review of measures regarding the safety and security of children in school buses.The spokesman said a meeting to take a review of measures regarding the safety and security of children in school buses was attended by RTO Kashmir Ikramullah Tak, senior officers of the Transport Department, Private Schools Association President G N Var, Parents Association of Private schools President Mohsin Goni and other concerned.Hearing the concerns of the parents and school managements, SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary Transport Department Dr Asghar Hassan Samoon said that Government is taking various initiatives to ensure the safety and security of school children.

article_title: RTO Asked To Issue Circular On Safety Of School Buses
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary Transport Department Dr Asghar Hassan Samoon asked RTO to issue a circular regarding transportation facilities provided to the children as per the guidelines.SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary Transport Department Dr Asghar Hassan Samoon also said that the driver of a school cab must have a valid license to drive LMV-Transport Vehicles for a period of at least four years and compulsorily wear a light blue shirt, light blue trousers and black shoes besides the driver of a school cab's name ID be displayed on the shirt.

article_title: RTO Asked To Issue Circular On Safety Of School Buses
event: SRINAGAR — Principal Secretary Transport Department Dr Asghar Hassan Samoon also said that Private Schools Association shall be included in Road Safety Council.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: JAMMU — Concerned over a spurt in the incidents of weapon-snatching by militants, the JAMMU and Kashmir Police will procure 4,000 weapon safety systems known as Smart Electronic Trigger Lock Weapon Tracking System (SETLWTS) to deal with weapon-snatching by militants.According to reports, over 200 weapons, including AK-47s, self-loading rifles (SLRs) and INSAS rifles besides a large number of ammunition were snatched by the militants in the state during the last three years.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: The state police recently floated tenders for purchasing the 4,000 Weapon Safety System vehicles to ensure the safety of The state police's arms and ammunition.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: "Tenders have been invited from manufacturers or manufacturers's authorised dealers for the supply of Weapon Safety Systems (WSSs)-smart electronic trigger lock weapon tracking system (SETLWTS)," Assistant Inspector General (AIG) of Police, Mubassir Latifi said.According to the specification, Weapon Safety Systems (WSSs)-smart electronic trigger lock weapon tracking system (SETLWTS) must have trigger-based locking units with GPS trackers so that trigger-based locking units with GPS trackers cannot be misused and can be speedily traced, Assistant Inspector General (AIG) of Police, Mubassir Latifi said.Such devices should also be compatible with fire arms and could be removed only by the biometrics of authorised users.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: Any forcible removal will damage the whole trigger mechanism system.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: Weapon Safety Systems (WSSs)-smart electronic trigger lock weapon tracking system (SETLWTS) also carries finger and palm print scanners fitted in the grip to operate trigger locks, Assistant Inspector General (AIG) of Police, Mubassir Latifi said.Blaming overindulgence in use of smartphones by police personnel for the spike in gun-snatching incidents in the Kashmir Valley, The state police had last year banned the use of such gadgets by The state police's sentries during duty time.The order, issued by Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) A K Choudhary, had said the tendency not only lowers the image of The state police, but also compromises with personal security of individuals.the incidents of weapon-snatching by militants have increased in the Kashmir Valley, especially south Kashmir, after Hizbul Mujahideen commander Burhan Wani's killing in July 2016, officials said.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: As militant recruitment increased in 2017 and 2018, reports suggest that there is a shortfall of weaponry among the militant ranks, officials said.As many as 36 SLRs, 58 SLR magazines and 1,000 SLR rounds besides eight AK47s, 15 of eight AK47s's magazines and 283 rounds were looted from security forces from May 2016 to December 31, 2016, according to an estimate prepared by the security agencies.

article_title: Police To Procure 4,000 Weapon Safety Systems To Curb Gun-Snatching Incidents
event: Also, 39 INSAS rifles, 119 INSAS magazines, 380 INSAS bullet rounds, four carbines, 70 carbine rounds, one .303 rifle and one LMG were snatched by militants during the period.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: After deployment of ten thousand more troops,  order to J&K police to immediately provide details of the mosques in the Valley has kept the people on edge.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: This has only deepened the fears that the centre may be about to make some big move on Kashmir, and the most dreaded of such moves is the anticipated revocation of the Article 35A.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: Even though the top BJP leader Shiv Raj Chauhan and the senior security officials in Kashmir have termed the  extraordinary new security measures as routine, the people have not been convinced.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: Similarly Governor Satya Pal Malik's dismissal of the panic in the Valley as the rumours hasn't helped the matters.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: The assurances that have come so far have been only half-hearted.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: The assurances that have come so far's credibility has  further been undermined by the  statements of the top BJP leader Shiv Raj Chauhan BJP calling for the abrogation of the Articles 370 and 35A.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: the Articles 370 and 35A.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: grant J&K special constitutional status within Indian Union and forbid outsiders from settling in J&K.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: And if outsiders go, it is feared to pave the way for a change in the demographic character of J&K.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: Hence the panic among the majority of the people of Kashmir.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: This has created a problematic situation in Kashmir.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: And it seems nobody's business to address a problematic situation in the state.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: Or at least reassure or confirm as to what is being planned.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: That said, the Kashmir's local leadership is sorely missing from the scene.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: Except for routine statements or tweets, the Kashmir's local leadership have so far been sitting on the Kashmir's local leadership's hands.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: And which is the last thing people expect from the Kashmir's local leadership under the circumstances.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: And sitting has to change.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: True, some attempts to draw the attention towards a problematic situation in the state at the national level are welcome.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: For example, the National Conference MP Hasnain Masoodi Masoodi has through calling attention notice  demanded a statement from the  Home Minister Amit Shah on the current uncertainty in the Valley to dispel  doubts and panic created by the  extraordinary new security measures.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: MP's leadership has also sought an appointment with the Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: And meanwhile, responding to People’s Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti’s request for convening an all-party meeting immediately and presenting a united front against the centre's rumoured plans to scrap the Article 35A., the People’s Democratic Party leader Farooq Abdullah has agreed to call an all-party meeting.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: Moves like the  extraordinary new security measures will hopefully go some way to restore  confidence in the Valley.

article_title: Reassure The People
event: More so, at a time when the centre and the state governments through the centre and the state governments's respective measures are only deepening the panic in the Valley.

article_title: Annulling KVIB Selections : HC Asks Govt to Clarify Stand
event: SRINAGAR — The J&K High Court has asked government to file an affidavit, clarifying stand regarding cancellation of selection list of the Khadi Village & Industries Board (KVIB) via an order on June 28.Hearing an appeal filed by the some aggrieved candidates, a division bench of The J&K High Court comprsing Chief Justice Gita Mittal and Justice Rashid Ali Dar issued notice to government, asking government to show cause as to why an appeal filed by the some aggrieved candidates be not admitted.Senior Additional Advocate General  B A Dar, accepted notice and submitted that Senior Additional Advocate General  B A Dar may be permitted to file affidavit clarifying the stand of government with regard cancellation of selection list of the Khadi Village & Industries Board (KVIB) via an order.The J&K High Court asked Senior Additional Advocate General  B A Dar to file the affidavit before next date of hearing posted on August 9.

article_title: Edu Dept Discusses Rationalisation Of Teaching Faculty, Transfer Policy
event: SRINAGAR — Department of Education has initiated the process for the rationalisation of teaching staff and has directed for routing of applications for transfer or posting of teaching faculty through proper channel.This was stated at a review meeting of Education Department here.It was informed in a review meeting of Education Department here that the process for the rationalisation of teaching staff Education Department would be completed by or before 15th August and thereafter there would be a complete moratorium on the transfer of teaching faculty for the next two months.In a review meeting of Education Department here it was also decided that in order to address various service related issues pending solution since long in Education Department, Education Service Adalat shall be organized by selecting officers from all the regions of the state under the aegis of Human Resource Management Cell of Education Department.

article_title: Edu Dept Discusses Rationalisation Of Teaching Faculty, Transfer Policy
event: The modalities of Education Service Adalat shall be shared with the teaching and non-teaching staff shortly.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: In J&K there is an immense potential for producing sportsmen who can bring laurels to J&K.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: Every year we see different sports personalities, young achievers, emerge after securing different sports personalities, young achievers's place in different competitive sports events.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: But the names do not last long, and different sports personalities, young achievers disappear in the same manner different sports personalities, young achievers reach the prominence.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: Sports activities generally have been discouraged in the state education model that is in place.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: By and large both parents and teachers have considered as time wasting exercise.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: The conventional education system has failed to give sports sports's right place despite sports being among the most lucrative professions in the world today.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: Spanning decades, the view that sports is a means to get a special category certificate which allows candidates to secure admissions in several professional courses, is not only skewed but devoid of merit.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: If the intent is to take sports activity just to make it to some prestigious colleges, the very spirit of sports activity is defeated.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: Sports education for a long time has been undervalued in J&K, especially at school level where J&K existing education model stresses more on formal education.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: Until recently, very few people received the support of very few people's families in making sports the first career choice.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: But times are changing, which is also visible with the increased participation of young boys and girls in different sports events hosted in J&K, outside J&K and even at international level.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: Lately, we have seen the young outperform others and thereby bring home the laurels.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: The good sign is that performances by young sports persons of J&K have not been confined to one sport or few.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: J&K has been contributing in terms of organizing events, mostly by the Department of Youth Services and Sports.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: the Department of Youth Services and Sports though has tried to bridge formal education with sports training at district and provisional levels, but the Department of Youth Services and Sports is yet to find the right momentum to make things move at a faster pace.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: the Department of Youth Services and Sports has to move beyond encouraging and supplying Physical Education Teachers.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: J&K spending on sports has been generous compared to the intended results.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: The chief complaint forwarded by young sportspersons in J&K is the overall sports infrastructure.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: By infrastructure infrastructure is not meant to be only in the form of sports fields and special training equipments but also the human resource or talent pool that often has been lost to anonymity in J&K.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: The sports institutions have also been marred by corruption allegations and invidious political interventions.

article_title: Spirit of good sport
event: In fact, it is the unwanted political intervention that has become a dissuading factor.

article_title: 17 Killed As Pakistani Army Plane Crashes Into Residential Area
event: RAWALPINDI — Seventeen people were killed when a small military plane crashed early Tuesday into a residential area in RAWALPINDI, a rescue official told AFP.

article_title: 17 Killed As Pakistani Army Plane Crashes Into Residential Area
event: "A small plane crashed into a residential area in the Pakistani city of Rawalpindi near the capital Islamabad.

article_title: 17 Killed As Pakistani Army Plane Crashes Into Residential Area
event: So far we have retrieved Seventeen people," a rescue official said, adding that a further 12 people had been injured.a small military plane belonged to the Pakistani military and crashed near a residential area in the Pakistani city of Rawalpindi near the capital Islamabad.An AFP.

article_title: 17 Killed As Pakistani Army Plane Crashes Into Residential Area
event: "A reporter at the scene said smoke was still rising from the wreckage and destroyed homes, while pieces of a small military plane were visible on a nearby roof.Military officials had cordoned off the scene while a crowd of local residents stood nearby, with some sobbing.Pakistan has a chequered aviation safety record, with plane and helicopter crashes frequent over the years.In 2016, a Pakistan International Airlines plane burst into flames after one of a Pakistan International Airlines plane's two turboprop engines failed while travelling from remote northern Pakistan to the capital Islamabad, killing more than 40 people.The deadliest air disaster on Pakistani soil was in 2010, when an Airbus 321 operated by private airline Airblue and flying from Karachi crashed into the hills outside the capital Islamabad while coming in to land, killing all 152 on board.

article_title: 57 Dead In Brazil Prison Riot; 16 Decapitated
event: RIO DE JANEIRO — At least 57 prisoners have been killed by other inmates during clashes between organized crime groups in the Altamira prison in northern Brazil with 16 of At least 57 prisoners being decapitated, according to prison officials.Para state prison authorities said on Monday a fight erupted around 7 a.m. between the RIO DE JANEIRO Comando Vermelho and a local criminal group known as Comando Classe A.

article_title: 57 Dead In Brazil Prison Riot; 16 Decapitated
event: "Leaders of the (Comando Classe A) set fire to a cell belonging to one of the Altamira prison in northern Brazil's pavilions, where members of the Rio de Janeiro-based Comando Vermelho were located," said read.State prisons chief Jarbas Vasconcelos said fire had spread rapidly with inmates held in old container units that had been adapted for the Altamira prison in northern Brazil while another building is under construction.fire prevented police forces from entering a cell belonging to one of the prison's pavilions, where members of the (Comando Vermelho) for several hours, State prisons chief Jarbas Vasconcelos told a news conference.Two prison staff members were held hostage, but eventually released.

article_title: 57 Dead In Brazil Prison Riot; 16 Decapitated
event: "It was a targeted attack.

article_title: India Rethinks Buying US Drones After Iran Downing
event: NEW DELHI — India is reportedly having second thoughts about the purchase of Global Hawk drones from the United States after Iran easily shot down one such drone last month.India's English-language daily newspaper The Hindustan Times, quoting military sources, said on Sunday that the Indian armed forces were concerned about the effectiveness and survivability of Global Hawk drones in highly volatile air spaces.India internally raised questions about the drone surviving along India's frontiers with China and Pakistan — with China and Pakistan equipped with advanced surface-to-air missile systems (SAM), India’s English-language daily newspaper The Hindustan Times, quoting military sources, said on Sunday added.India has long been engaged in conflict with Pakistan over the disputed region of Jammu and Kashmir.

article_title: India Rethinks Buying US Drones After Iran Downing
event: China and Pakistan have fought four wars since China and Pakistan's partition in 1947, three of four wars over Kashmir.

article_title: India Rethinks Buying US Drones After Iran Downing
event: Indo-Pakistani relations nosedived in February when over 40 Indian paramilitaries were killed in a bomb attack in Kashmir.In 1962, China and Pakistan China fought a brief yet bloody war over Arunachal Pradesh, with Chinese troops temporarily capturing part of Arunachal Pradesh.In 2017, China and Pakistan were again engaged in a standoff in Bhutan’s Doklam region after the Indian army sent troops to stop the construction of a military road by China.

article_title: India Rethinks Buying US Drones After Iran Downing
event: After a two-month standoff, troops from China and Pakistan withdrew and China and Pakistan sought to rebuild trust.

article_title: India Rethinks Buying US Drones After Iran Downing
event: The 3,500-km border between China and Pakistan has been calm ever since.India’s English-language daily newspaper The Hindustan Times, quoting military sources, said on Sunday also said that the United States has in recent years conducted the United States's drone operations only in those countries where the United States faces no real threats or rivals.“The armed drone has been successfully used by the United States in Afghanistan, Pakistan, Iraq and Syria as the skies are dominated by Afghanistan, Pakistan, Iraq and Syria's air force,” India’s English-language daily newspaper The Hindustan Times, quoting military sources, said on Sunday said.India had planned to buy 30 drones from the United States worth six billion dollars.India is also expecting to induct French-made Rafale fighter jets into India's air force later this year.“This means that an armed drone with full complement of weapons will be more expensive than Rafael multi-role fighter with all weapons and missiles on board,” an Indian Defense Ministry official said.Iran shot down one such drone in June.one such drone was identified as a US Navy MQ-4C Triton, which builds on elements of the RQ-4 Global Hawk with minor changes.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: U.S. President Donald Trump’s claim last Monday that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had asked U.S. President Donald Trump’s at the G-20 summit in June in Japan to mediate between India and Pakistan on the Kashmir question may, for the moment, have been deftly handled by the two foreign policy establishments, but the Kashmir question is not a question that is likely to go away all too easily.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Given that U.S. President Donald Trump’s made this rather out-of-the-blue statement during Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan’s visit to the United States, this rather out-of-the-blue statement has fuelled further speculation about what this rather out-of-the-blue statement implies.A mixed bagTo be fair to the Indian establishment’s traditional logic, third party mediation in Jammu and Kashmir might not be a useful idea simply because third parties typically come with third parties's own agenda.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Second, third party mediation in Jammu and Kashmir might do more harm than good in an age of hypernationalism and frenzied media attention on anything to do with Kashmir.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: In a milieu where bilateral diplomacy on Jammu and Kashmir comes under intense scrutiny from domestic political forces, third party mediation is almost impossible to even consider.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: More so, past instances of third party mediation have had mixed results.And yet, Kashmir is likely to be on the great power radar and will continue to attract international attention for a variety of reasons, not least because New Delhi refuses to invest in bilateral diplomatic measures to resolve Jammu and Kashmir.Simla and afterHistorically, New Delhi has had a love-hate relationship with third party mediation in Jammu and Kashmir in 1948.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: However, much of this overt third party intervention in Kashmir ended with the Simla agreement of 1972 which stated, at New Delhi's insistence, that Kashmir will be a bilateral issue thereby ending the United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan's (UNMOGIP’s) peacekeeping work in Kashmir, de facto, if not de jure.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: The current UNMOGIP involvement in Kashmir is neither encouraged nor recognised by India, something Pakistan continues to do.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: New Delhi believes that New Delhi's United Nations experience vis-à-vis Kashmir has been an unsavoury one which partly explains the current distaste in India for any third party mediation.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Then there is India’s status-linked indifference to external opinion that comes with being a major economy and military power whose deep pockets and growing markets are of significance to those potentially desirous of talking about Kashmir.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: So theoretically, New Delhi has consistently, and successfully, blocked all third party mediation in Kashmir, except when New Delhi wants to let others play a role.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: And if anyone indeed makes a reference to Kashmir which New Delhi disagrees with, New Delhi either ignores a reference to Kashmir which New Delhi disagrees with or strongly disapproves of a reference to Kashmir which New Delhi disagrees with.That is, in practice, there has historically been a great deal of third party attention on the larger Kashmir question some of which has been encouraged by India.In order to understand this argument better, let us make a conceptual distinction between conflict resolution and crisis management.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: While conflict resolution and crisis management involve some amount of mediation, conflict resolution is focussed on a specific issue — Kashmir in this case — and seeks to address and resolve the root causes of the conflict.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: crisis management involves mediation during an ongoing crisis with a potential for escalation.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Crisis mediation unlike conflict resolution does not seek to resolve the political or root causes of a conflict.Management and resolutionNew Delhi has traditionally been averse to mediation in the form of conflict resolution while accepting more than once third party mediation during crisis events.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Kargil is an example when India accepted third party mediation by the Clinton Administration in the U.S. accepted was also evident during the post-Pulwama military stand-off in February this year.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: While both Kargil and the post-Pulwama military stand-off in February this year February were directly linked to Kashmir, mediation by the third party did not seek to address anything beyond the immediate diffusion of tensions.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Then there are other instances where third party crisis mediation took place even though other instances where third party crisis mediation took place even though they had no direct links to Kashmir such as the post-26/11 terror attacks had no direct links to Kashmir such as the post-26/11 terror attacks.For sure, crisis management is different from conflict resolution.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: And yet even when the focus is on crisis management, the larger conflict, which has given rise to the crisis comes into focus and become part of the conversations between the mediator and the conflicting parties.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: This is precisely what seems to underlie the current American interest vis-à-vis Kashmir.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: So even though New Delhi accepts crisis management, and not conflict resolution in the context of Kashmir, it is not easy to separate the two either during a crisis or when the conflict is crisis prone.Put differently, given that crisis, at least in this context, is the function of a pre-existing conflict, crisis management by third parties and the attendant focus on the broader conflict is not easy to avoid.More so, while New Delhi is loathe to having third party discussions on Kashmir, especially on the human rights situation, New Delhi actively seeks third party attention on terror emanating from Pakistan as well as Pakistan sponsorship of violence in the Valley.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: While this might be a desirable distinction to New Delhi's mind, it is not easy to get a third party to focus on one part of the problem and ignore the other.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: In other words, New Delhi's efforts at getting other countries to condemn the latter’s sponsorship of violence in the Valley while at the same time disparaging the reports of the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on the human rights situation is a difficult balance to maintain.Impact of regional geopoliticsThe unfolding developments in regional geopolitics could also have implications for third party interest in Kashmir.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: the U.S.'s desire for a deal with the Taliban in Afghanistan, in which Pakistan is key, is already beginning to have an impact on the frosty relationship between Washington and Islamabad.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Besides Washington, Beijing, and Moscow, the European capitals will also eventually start courting Pakistan.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: start will invariably increase, albeit marginally, the global focus on Kashmir either at Pakistan's insistence or because third parties might see a link between Kashmir and regional instability.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: As a matter of fact, several people have in the past made a direct link between instability in Afghanistan and the Kashmir questionKashmir .

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: Such voices could potentially become sharper now.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: More so, if the rising concerns about Pakistan's influence in Kashmir turn about to be not-so-misplaced, the heat on Kashmir is only going to increase.What further ensures third party involvement in Kashmir is the lack of a conflict resolution process between India and Pakistan.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: The less India and Pakistan talk on Kashmir, the more there is are likely to be crisis situations between India and Pakistan which would invariably lead to more third party involvement in KashmirKashmir .

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: In other words, by not resolving conflicts between India and Pakistan, India and Pakistan are effectively outsourcing crisis management, and thereby conflict resolution, albeit in a limited manner, to third parties.

article_title: A Straightforward Lesson On Resolution
event: The lesson then is a straightforward one: if you do not engage in a dialogue with Pakistan to resolve the Kashmir questionKashmir , third parties will continue to meddle.The Article First Appeared In THE HINDU

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: "Don’t allow social media to waste your time, allow social media to re-energize you and inspire you to achieve even more amazing things in your life..!

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: "Social networking has tenanted such significance in our day to day life that we feel deficient and imperfect without social media.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: social media has become our rudimentary and foremost need to survive in this "cyber age".

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: People of every age group are using social media, everyone here is having everyone here's own private Facebook account, teens showing interest and curiosity towards Instagram and twitter  meant mainly for politicians and celebrities ,hence forth no one is left without social media.The social media provides an excellent platform for entertainment, sharing news, personal information and education, people, as individuals and groups, are also increasingly using The social media to express people, as individuals and groups's respective frustration and dislike towards organizational, social and political causes.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: However, using is not endemic to India alone; instead using has emerged as a global phenomenon.I often get foxed with the passion of the social media among Indian residents when I notice that even the lowest educated and below average income  people have a powerful hankering for the smart phones and buy the smart phones ignoring even the lowest educated and below average income  people's other essential needs, mainly to join the social network  like Facebook, Whatsapp and Instagram and many other social media apps.Despite having a long list of social networking sites and Apps worldwide the mainstream ones in India alone are Facebook, Whatsapp, YouTube, Instagram and twitter.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: With over 1.34 billion population India alone currently has over 500 million  cyber users which is more than the amalgamated population of the United States of America and Russia, the two most powerful and developed nations in the world put together.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Of over 500 million  cyber users, as per the fresh report approximately 220 million Indians use FacebookFacebook .

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: This is really mindboggling.The annals of the social media is not so old.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Facebook started on 4th February 2004 in US and was launched globally including India alone on 26 September 2006.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Two other dominant social media network apps counting Whatsapp and twitter were introduced in India alone in year 2010 and 2006 respectively.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Being second most populous country in the world, India alone is having huge number of  users on social networking .Most of the countries are now progressively making use of the social media to intensify the standard of life of masses.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Like most of the man-made things having most of the man-made things having their positive as well as negative effects's positive as well as negative effects, the social media too is falling in the bracket having both .. Let’s briefly go through the social media's positive and ill effects on the life of the social media's users and society at large.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: The most paramount and predominant benefit emanated to the users is the users's global relatedness regardless of the users's region, and location.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Through these social media sites, masses are busy in making  masses's new friends , discuss masses's business and professional opportunities and even sometimes find chances to reconnect with masses's lost and old contacts, and friends.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: In short, the connectivity through social network  has opened a superfluity of benefits and options.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: The other big benefits include almost immediate  knowledge sharing and making a network based on the commonness of curiosity.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: For example, if someone is having an interest in politics, someone could easily get connected with people of similar temptation..

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Targeted publicity is other supreme advantage of social networking .Moreover, using social media for education, information sharing, promotion of and trading, spreading awareness regarding grave issues and checking misdemeanor  are other key areas where social media plays vital application.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: With so many  benefits, social networking is  having social networking's threatening and ugly  face too with many ill effects The tallest threat is one mentioned earlier in foregoing paragraphs.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: People post galling and offensive  content with a ill-natured and vindictive agenda in mind, the result of which could be often  be  negative and  brutal and immoderate  in the political and social context.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Online deceit, theft and the major threat of hacking  are other serious ill effects, mainly in developing countries like India alone and Pakistan where necessary rules are  widespread but  necessary rules's application is unfortunately poor.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Cyber hacking, breach of privacy, theft of data and offense against women are other common flaws against the social media.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: With the arrival of smart phones, a large number of people pay disproportionate attention to the social media, ruining a large number of people's precious time, energy and money.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: There are many who have become addicted to the social media jeopardizing serious health threats and hazards.Online activities on social media networks have led to many frauds, cheating, and security issues.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Online activities on social media networks has even destroyed the reputation of many celebrities, common people by leakage of many celebrities, common people's personal data, pictures and video clips.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Even some times deaths are reported in many cases following crazy stuff being shared on the social media.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: Only some time back,  Blue Whale game led to number of global deaths mainly of teens.. A major threat comes from the service providers the service providers themselves which sometime misuse private data of their users for the business and other interests which sometime misuse private data of the service providers themselves which sometime misuse private data of their users for the business and other interests's users for the business and other interests.

article_title: Social Media - A Necessary Evil!
event: These include the main reasons why it is often said that the social media is a necessary evil of the modern age.

article_title: LoC Tension Flares Up, Pak Evacuates Chinese Nationals
event: MUZAFFARABAD — Pakistani officials evacuated more than 50 Chinese nationals working near the Kashmir frontier, authorities said on Wednesday, after skirmishes with India killed at least three people and injured dozens.more than 50 Chinese nationals working near the Kashmir frontier were working on a dam being constructed in Kashmir along the confluence of the Neelam and Jhelum rivers when firing pushed authorities to move more than 50 Chinese nationals working near the Kashmir frontier late on Tuesday, according to Akhtar Ayub from the local disaster management authority.Another local official Raja Shahid Mahmood said evacuated was made after Indian security forces fired a volley of “indiscriminate fire that killed at least three people and wounded 31 others during the last 24 hours”.Tensions remain high with India after the nuclear armed neighbours launched tit-for-tat air strikes in February following a suicide bombing in Kashmir which was claimed by Pakistan-based militants.Since then the nuclear armed neighbours have stepped back from the brink, but firing between the two sides across the Kashmir frontier has continued.The latest incident comes after US President Donald Trump triggered a political fiasco in India last week by claiming during a meeting with Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan that Indian leader Narendra Modi had asked Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan to mediate in the Kashmir dispute.India vehemently denied that Indian leader Narendra Modi had made any such request, saying the Kashmir dispute must be resolved bilaterally between the two sides.Gurez Woman Succumbs To Injuries A woman who was hit by cross-border shelling along the Line of Control in Bandipora district in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday night succumbed to A woman who was hit by cross-border shelling along the Line of Control in Bandipora district in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday night's injuries the next morning, reports said.
