article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: During my recent trip to Delhi my preferred to travel in Metro and low floor AC buses.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Metro and low floor AC buses Metro are comfortable with no noise and zero emissions.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: You may or may not get a seat in Metro but you are still free and comfortable.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: The best thing that my mostly observed during metro travels is the discipline with no hustle bustle.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Even during rush hours in Metro and low floor AC buses my saw people busy in people's own work with no side talks or disturbance to co-passengers.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: What my noticed is people keep people busy even during travel.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: my often saw students busy with students's school and college assignments while traveling in metros.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Ear phones are used to avoid bothering anyone with what anyone is listening or reading.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Some people keep Some people busy in games on Some people's mobile phones.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: This type of atmosphere has greatly helped transform public behaviour especially among students and This type of atmosphere has added to the efficiency.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: my noticed a big positive change in Indian public behaviour, thanks to Metro.Apart from students, working class or the business class too do not waste working class or the business class's time during travel either in metros or buses as working class or the business class too have earphones connected to the devices and often one would overhear business talk.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Weather seated or standing this is how the business in metro-cities is picking up so speedily.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: In comparison to our academics in schools and colleges, we have yet to create such a habit in us as you can see students after staying indoors for a day or two in a week for obvious reasons can be seen in the school, college and varsity gardens making it seem just like a picnic.Our teachers which including professors never bother to make the students accountable for bunking the classes which has entirely derailed our academics in the institutions.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Lack of accountability at all levels is one of the biggest factors behind deterioration of the academics in the institutions.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: We have to create an atmosphere as is available to the students outside Kashmir.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Delhi is fast following Southern India.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: We need to take things seriously and keep in mind that we have to face competitive examinations at the national level.

article_title: My Metro Travels in Delhi
event: Gone are the days of REC or JKCET we now face NEET and other competitive examinations.Our teachers have a role to play by making Our teachers's students aware of the competition at the national level otherwise It will be "love story 1942"Mohammad Farooq Wani hjfarooq@rediffmail.com

article_title: E-cigarettes Use in J&K: HC Seeks GoI’s ‘Objections’
event: SRINAGAR — The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has sought objections within six weeks from Union of India through Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, to a Public Interest Litigation, seeking among others The Jammu and Kashmir High Court's directions to allow sale and usage of e-cigarettes in the state.Hearing a Public Interest Litigation, a division bench of The Jammu and Kashmir High Court observed that having regard to the nature of the issues raised before a division bench of the court, “it would appear that Union of India through Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, would be a necessary party for effective adjudication of the issues raised in a Public Interest Litigation”.

article_title: E-cigarettes Use in J&K: HC Seeks GoI’s ‘Objections’
event: Accordingly, The Jammu and Kashmir High Court directed impleadment of Union of India through Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Nirman Bhawan, New Delhi, as party respondent in a Public Interest Litigation.The Jammu and Kashmir High Court issued notice to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and notice was accepted by T. M. Shamsi, Assistant Solicitor general of the state.

article_title: E-cigarettes Use in J&K: HC Seeks GoI’s ‘Objections’
event: “Objections, if any, be filed by the newly added respondent no.3 (Ministry of Health and Family Welfare) within six weeks,” The Jammu and Kashmir High Court added.a Public Interest Litigation has been filed by one Mushtaq Ahmed Shah, seeking directions to that authorities to allow the use and sale of Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (ENDS) or e-cigarettes, if necessary by framing necessary regulations for this purpose.one Mushtaq Ahmed Shah pleaded for a committee to be constituted to conduct a proper research and analysis of ENDS and thereafter formulate rules and regulations for use and sale of one Mushtaq Ahmed Shah states that the conventional cigarette smoking can easily be eradicated by making use of e-cigarettes which has less harmful effects as compared to tobacco products.one Mushtaq Ahmed Shah further states that to enable cigarette smokers like one Mushtaq Ahmed Shah to switch over to safer methods of nicotine consumption, with overall objective of achieving de-addiction, the usage of e-cigarettes is seen a first step.

article_title: E-cigarettes Use in J&K: HC Seeks GoI’s ‘Objections’
event: The Central Drug Regulator has directed all drug controllers in states and Union territories to not allow the manufacture, sale, import and advertisement of Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems, including e-cigarettes and flavoured hookah, in all drug controllers in states and Union territories's jurisdictions.

article_title: E-cigarettes Use in J&K: HC Seeks GoI’s ‘Objections’
event: "Since no Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (ENDS), including e-cigarettes, heat-not-burn devices, vape, e-sheesha, e-nicotine flavoured hookah, and the like products have not yet been approved under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act 1940 and rules made thereunder, you are requested to ensure devices that enable nicotine delivery are not sold (including online sale), manufactured, distributed, traded, imported and advertised in your jurisdictions," The Central Drug Regulator's order states.In August last year, the Health Ministry issued an advisory to all states and UTs to stop the manufacture, sale and import of ENDS after the Delhi HC took a strong exception to the Delhi HC for delay in coming up with appropriate measures to tackle the new emerging threat of e-cigarettes in the state.ENDS are devices that heat a solution to create an aerosol, which also frequently contains flavours, usually dissolved into propylene glycol and glycerin.Electronic cigarettes or e-cigarettes, the most common prototype, are devices that do not burn or use tobacco leaves but instead vaporise a solution, which a user then inhales.The main constituents of a solution, which a user then inhales, in addition to nicotine, are propylene glycol (with or without glycerol and flavouring agents).After an advisory, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, too, proposed an amendment to the Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines) Rules 2018 to ban the advertisement of e-cigarettes.Even the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs issued a circular recently, saying that all import consignments of e-cigarettes must be cleared by the drug controller first.Steadfast in its commitment to protect the health of children, adolescents and women of reproductive age, 36 countries around the world and 12 states in the state have banned the sale of e-cigarettes due to e-cigarettes's health harms.

article_title: Governor Launches Musical Fountain At SKICC
event: Navin Choudhary, Principal Secretary Tourism Department also informed that similar project has been approved at Nigeen Lake at the cost of Rs.5.00 crore  and construction  is likely to commence  in August 2019.

article_title: Governor Launches Musical Fountain At SKICC
event: Governor Satya Pal Malik  directed  for the project's time bound completion  and set the deadline  as December 2019 for completion  and opening the project for the public  and tourists.

article_title: Cafe Coffee Day Founder V G Siddhartha's Body Found
event: MANGALURU — The body of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing, was found on Wednesday in the Netravati river in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka after 36 hours of intense search, officials said.The body of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing had washed ashore near Ullal and was fished out by local fishermen.Mangalore MLA U T Khader said friends and relatives have confirmed that The body of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing is of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing.Earlier, police said The body of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missingCafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing, was yet to be identified by Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing's family.

article_title: Cafe Coffee Day Founder V G Siddhartha's Body Found
event: "A body has been found, which appears to be of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing.

article_title: Cafe Coffee Day Founder V G Siddhartha's Body Found
event: Final confirmation has to be done by his family," deputy commissioner of Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka Sasikanth Senthil told PTI.Mangalore Commissioner of Police Sandeep Patil said The body of Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing has been kept at Wenlock Hospital for further formalities.Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing, went missing mysteriously on Monday night en route to MANGALURU.Teams of National Disaster Response Force, Coast Guard, Home Guard, fire services and coastal police scoured the waters under a bridge across the Netravati river, where Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing was reportedly last seen, to trace Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing.Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missingKarnataka , was last seen near a bridge across the swollen Nethravathi river, where the 60-year old was reportedly last seen in Kotepura area on Monday night, police said.Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing had left Bengaluru for Sakleshpur in Hassan district in a car on Monday afternoon, but on the way had asked Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing's driver to go towards MANGALURU, police said.On reaching a bridge across the swollen Nethravathi river, where the 60-year old was reportedly last seen, Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing got off a car and told his driver Cafe Coffee Day founder V G Siddhartha, who went missing was going for a walk.A fisherman had on Tuesday claimed that A fisherman saw someone jumping off a bridge across the swollen Nethravathi river, where the 60-year old was reportedly last seen.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: The deployment of the additional 10,000 troops and a slew of unusual official orders seeking to strengthen security and surveillance in Kashmir have triggered panic and anxiety among people.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: The Kashmir Valley has been aswirl with rumours that the centre is  getting ready to do away with the Articles 370 and 35A.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: The extraordinary situation has forced the major political parties other than the BJP to close ranks and jointly fight the anticipated onslaught on the J&K’s special status.Kashmir Observer correspondent Auqib Javeed caught up with the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal for the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal's opinion on the current crisis.Here are the excerpts Why is their silence in mainstream camp about the anticipated moves by the centre to revoke Article 35A?

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Why no rally, not even a press conference to give voice to the fears in Kashmir?

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal don’t think there is any silence; everybody is speaking, at least, our party People's United Front, is constantly agitating that this air of uncertainty needs to be cleared.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: The only issue this time is that people aren’t sure what the mobilisation is about, once it’s clear that mobilisation is about Article 35A, you will see the storm brewing up in Kashmir.The dominant opinion among people is that mainstream camp should unite.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Why unite is not happening?I think the BJP and Er.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Rashid Sahab is the first person who gave a call for unity to all political parties of Kashmir.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Yesterday Kashmir Observer correspondent Auqib Javeed also spoke and endorsed his stance that all political parties of the state should come forward and unite and come on the same table.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: In fact, the BJP were the people who proposed an all party meeting to discussing this current issue.Isn't leadership missing in Kashmir at a time when Kashmir needs leadership most?

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Nobody is stepping up to the challenge.the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal agree that the political parties are speaking in multiple voices and every party is trying to grind every party's own axe.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Nobody is really serious about the crisis that is just ahead of us.What do the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal think is going to happen?

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Do the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal think the J&K’s's constitutional status can be preserved?

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: What are the options with people of the J&K’s belief is that it’s completely illegal to tinker with the J&K’s special status.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: the BJP believe once the Constitutional Assembly of Kashmir got dissolved in 1957, the roads to any sort of constitutional adventurism vis-vis the Articles 370 and 35A.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: have already been closed.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: The options for the people is that just in case the BJP resorts to any sort of illegalities and tries to tinker with the J&K’s special status, the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal think then a strong political assertion will have to be made from the side of people of Jammu and Kashmir and at the same time we should go for the judicial remedy.What steps will the BJP take if speculations about Article 35A turn out to be true?Firstly, the BJP believe that Article 35A is not going to be scrapped by anyone because it’s impossible to do so.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: And if scrapped happens, scrapped will destroy the relationship between the centre and the state.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: But if the central government takes such an initiative, there will be a huge people's movement against such an initiative.What, in the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal's view, is the path ahead for the political formations in Kashmir given the fact that the BJP enjoys power in Delhi.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: Is engagement with the BJP inevitable?See, we are saying that the BJP government is at the centre and we have to convince BJP government that opposing the BJP and the BJP's ideology doesn’t mean being anti-national.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: the BJP have the BJP's own politics to do and the BJP should give space to other political parties to do other political parties's politics and follow democratic principles.There is a viewpoint that Delhi is helping to bring new leadership in Kashmir and the veiled reference is towards the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal and Er Rasheed.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: How do the bureaucrat-turned politician Shah Faesal dispel such speculations and fears?There have always been such rumors in history that whenever any new political party and new institutions come up, any new political party and new institutions is suspected.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: You will recall when Indian National Congress became, many people said Indian National Congress’s the creation of the British and the British made Indian National Congress because the British want to have a safety valve.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: And when National Conference came up, it was said that it’s communists that have made it here to destroy the Muslim unity.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal
event: When PDP came up people said PDP’s the creation of Intelligence Bureau and Research and Analysis Wing (RAW) to counter Indian National Congress.

article_title: This Time We Are Fighting an Existential Battle: Shah Faesal

article_title: England Seek A 'Double' As Australia Eye Ashes History
event: LONDON — England return to 'Fortress Edgbaston' for the first Test against Australia on Thursday looking to round off an already memorable season by completing a World Cup and Ashes double.If World Cup remains the pinnacle of the 50-over game, for England and Australia there's nothing quite like a renewal of Test cricket's oldest rivalry.But now there's arguably more at stake for England and Australia than the series result.For England, a home season billed as the most important in a generation started brilliantly with England's impressive run to a first men's World Cup title.International cricket in Britain emerged from behind Britain's satellite television paywall for the first time since the celebrated 2005 Ashes so that millions could watch England's nerve-shredding Super Over win against New Zealand at Lord's earlier this month.Building on that groundswell of support is a key part of the England and Wales Cricket Board's post-tournament strategy.

article_title: England Seek A 'Double' As Australia Eye Ashes History
event: Regaining Ashes represents an ideal chance to keep millions on board, even if none of the five Tests are on free-to-air television.For Australia, an Ashes series win under the dignified leadership of Tim Paine would help draw a line under the ball-tampering scandal in South Africa that led to long bans for former captain Steve Smith, David Warner and Cameron Bancroft.former captain Steve Smith, David Warner and Cameron Bancroft are likely to feature at 'Fortress Edgbaston', with Cameron Bancroft set to hear the same booing that greeted former captain Steve Smith David Warner during World Cup.Australia have not won an Ashes in England for 19 years, with Australia's batsmen struggling against the heavily stitched Dukes ball on pitches that offer seam movement.Yet the first Test against Australia will be Australia's opening first-class match of the tour, although the likes of Cameron Bancroft, have recent experience of local conditions.The way an England side featuring several World Cup stars were dismissed for just 85 by Ireland at Lord's's last week before winning the first Test against Australia tells The way an England side featuring several World Cup stars were dismissed for just 85 by Ireland at Lord's last week before winning the first Test between the countries's own story of ongoing top-order woes.England captain Joe Root plans to move back to number three to help shore up a top order featuring novice Surrey openers Rory Burns and Jason Roy.James Anderson, England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker, is set to return from a calf injury to lead an attack that could feature World Cup hero Jofra Archer.- 'Keep the energy going' Australia, meanwhile, are poised to put Australia's faith in a rapid four-man attack featuring James Pattinson and Pat Cummins.Several of England's World Cup winners appeared jaded against Ireland but Anderson, who no longer plays one-day internationals and so was not involved in that success, hopes Anderson, who no longer plays one-day internationals and so was not involved in that success can revive any flagging spirits.

article_title: England Seek A 'Double' As Australia Eye Ashes History
event: "For some of us this is the start of some of us's international summer and it's some of us's job to keep the energy going as a team," said Anderson, who no longer plays one-day internationals and so was not involved in that success on Thursday.With runs expected to be at premium while the bowlers hold sway, England will hope all-rounders such as Ben Stokes, restored to the vice-captaincy, can again make valuable contributions with the bat.Australia have not won at 'Fortress Edgbaston' in any format since 2001, a run that includes Australia's recent World Cup semi-final loss to England, when Jason Roy made a sparkling England, by contrast, have won England's last 11 internationals at the raucous Birmingham ground.But a congested schedule, the result of officials cramming an Ashes into the same season as a lengthy World Cup, could have a bigger bearing on the series, the first in the ICC's new World Test Championship.

article_title: England Seek A 'Double' As Australia Eye Ashes History
event: "I really believe it's a big ask for the fast bowlers on England and Australia to play five Tests in six weeks," said Australia great Steve Waugh, the victorious captain in the celebrated 2005 Ashes, who is mentoring the current squad.

article_title: England Seek A 'Double' As Australia Eye Ashes History
event: "Depth in the current squad will be important but Australia great Steve Waugh, the victorious captain in the 2001 Ashes, who is mentoring the current squad honestly think if Australia great Steve Waugh, the victorious captain in the 2001 Ashes, who is mentoring the current squad was a betting man Australia great Steve Waugh, the victorious captain in the 2001 Ashes, who is mentoring the current squad wouldn't back either side because Australia great Steve Waugh, the victorious captain in the 2001 Ashes, who is mentoring the current squad don't know who's going to win."

article_title: Killer Highway: 3 Killed In Another Ramban Accident
event: RAMBAN — Three persons died while as eleven others were injured after a vehicle they were travelling in met with an accident at Kunfar Nallah in Ramban district of Jammu and Kashmir.Reports said that a vehicle they were travelling in skidded off the road and fell down into a deep gorge at Kunfar Nallah in Ramban district of Jammu and Kashmir today in the evening.Confirming met, Additional Deputy Commissioner (ADC) RAMBAN Dr Basharat Hussain Inkalibi told GNS that soon after an accident at Kunfar Nallah in Ramban district of Jammu and Kashmir, a rescue operation was launched and they were evacuated to District Hospital Ramban.Three persons were declared brought dead by the doctors, Additional Deputy Commissioner (ADC) Ramban Dr Basharat Hussain Inkalibi said.Three persons include driver of a vehicle they were travelling in namely Khaleel Ahmad, a resident of RAMBAN.Additional Deputy Commissioner (ADC) Ramban Dr Basharat Hussain Inkalibi further said that the conditions of two persons among they are said to be serious and were referred to GMC Jammu for specialized treatment.

article_title: Amarnath Yatra Remains Suspended From Baltal
event: JAMMU / SRINAGAR — After facing frequent disruptions due to inclement weather over the past four days, the Amarnath yatra resumed on Monday from JAMMU and Pahalgam base camps while the Amarnath yatra remained suspended from Baltal route, officials said.A fresh batch of 2,675 pilgrims, including 492 women and 174 seers, left the Bhagwati Nagar base camp Monday, after a day-long suspension following inclement weather, officials said.officials said A fresh batch of 2,675 pilgrims, including 492 women and 174 seers, left the Bhagwati Nagar base camp in a convoy of 113 vehicles under tight security arrangements in the early hours after the 270-km JAMMU-Srinagar national highway was cleared for traffic.the 270-km Jammu-Srinagar national highway, was closed for traffic on Sunday after heavy rains triggered a landslide at Kella Morh and rolling down of stones from hillocks at four more places including Panthiyal, Digdole, Anokhi fall and Maroog in Ramban district.the 270-km Jammu-Srinagar national highway was cleared of the debris and made traffic worthy late Sunday.With improvement in weather, the 26th batch of Amarnath pilgrims was allowed towards Kashmir and the 26th batch of Amarnath pilgrims is expected to reach the cave shrine later in Monday, officials said.Of A fresh batch of 2,675 pilgrims, including 492 women and 174 seers, officials said 1,544 pilgrims, including 207 women and 174 Sadhus, are heading for Pahalgam for the Amarnath yatra, while the rest of 1,131 pilgrims including 285 women and three children have preferred Baltal route.the Amarnath yatra commenced from the twin tracks -- traditional 36-km Pahalgam in Anantnag district and Baltal route -- on July 1 and is scheduled to end on August 15.The officials said 1,136 pilgrims were allowed from Nunwan base camp along traditional 36-km Pahalgam in Anantnag district towards the cave shrine on Monday morning, resuming the Amarnath yatra from there.However, the yatra along Baltal route continued to remain suspended for the third day as intermittent rains rendered Baltal route unsafe for travellers, officials said.On Monday, 683 pilgrims -- who had reached the cave shrine from various halting stations enroute -- offered prayers at the cave shrine till mid day, taking the total number of pilgrims who had 'darshan' of the naturally formed ice-shivlingam at the cave shrine to 3,20,038, officials said.officials said the helicopter service, which too was suspended on Sunday due to bad weather, also resumed from both the routes on Monday.

article_title: 24x7 Free Ambulance Service in J&K Soon: SAC
event: SRINAGAR — The State Administrative Council (SAC) which met under the chairmanship of Governor, Satya Pal Malik approved operationalization of the 102-108 Toll Free Ambulance Service in SRINAGAR, according to an official statement issued here.102-108 free Ambulance Service will provide round the clock transportation to the patients requiring immediate medical care especially critical, Trauma, accidental victims, pregnant women & sick children.

article_title: 24x7 Free Ambulance Service in J&K Soon: SAC
event: the 102-108 Toll Free Ambulance Service will prove to be a boon in saving precious lives by providing timely medical care to people particularly residing in far flung and difficult pockets of SRINAGAR.SRINAGAR will bring a fleet of 416 Ambulances under the ambit of the 102-108 Toll Free Ambulance Service, which will be operationalised through a centralised Call Centre working on 24x7 basis.102 Ambulance Service will provide free of cost service to the targeted population (pregnant women, sick children etc).

article_title: 24x7 Free Ambulance Service in J&K Soon: SAC
event: Under no circumstances, any user fee will be levied from any targeted beneficiary for providing transportation services.108 Ambulance Service is predominantly an emergency response system, primarily designed to attend to patients of critical care, trauma and accident victims etc.Dedicated centralized Call Centres, one each at SRINAGAR and Jammu, would be established to run the 102-108 Toll Free Ambulance Service in SRINAGAR.

article_title: 24x7 Free Ambulance Service in J&K Soon: SAC
event: The services of Call Centres would be outsourced for which the J&K Medical Supplies Corporation Limited had floated the tenders and finalized the Rate Contract.

article_title: 24x7 Free Ambulance Service in J&K Soon: SAC

article_title: Lok Sabha Passes Consumer Protection Bill, 2018
event: NEW DELHI — Lok Sabha on Tuesday passed a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services.a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services provides for protection of interests of consumers and setting up of authorities for timely and effective administration and settlement of consumer disputes.Speaking on a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, Union Food and Consumer Affairs Minister Ram Vilas Paswan stressed that the overall purpose of a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services is to ease the process of addressing grievances of consumers.a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, was passed in the lower house after all the amendments moved by opposition were negated.a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services will now go to Rajya Sabha for passage, where a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services was not passed in December last year and had lapsed.a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, among other things, proposes setting up of Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission and forums at the district, state and national levels for adjudicating consumer complaints.a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services also seeks to set up a Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) to promote, protect and enforce consumer rights as a class.a Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) would make interventions to prevent consumer detriment arising from unfair trade practices.

article_title: Lok Sabha Passes Consumer Protection Bill, 2018
event: a Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) can also initiate class action, including enforcing recall, refund and return of products.

article_title: Lok Sabha Passes Consumer Protection Bill, 2018
event: "Currently, the task of prevention of or acting against unfair trade practices is not vested in any authority.

article_title: Lok Sabha Passes Consumer Protection Bill, 2018
event: "This has been provided for in a manner that the role envisaged for a Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) complements that of sector regulators and duplication, overlap or potential conflict is avoided," as per Statement of Objects and Reasons of a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services Union Food and Consumer Affairs Minister Ram Vilas Paswan Union Food and Consumer Affairs Minister Ram Vilas Paswan said a Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) would take immediate action on any complaint filed by the consumer and if required could also file class action suite.Union Food and Consumer Affairs Minister Ram Vilas Paswan said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services proposes stringent action in case of misleading advertisements against the advertiser but not against the media through which advertisement is being publicised.a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services also has provisions for product liability action on account of harm caused to consumers due to defective products or by deficiency in services.During the debate on a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy suggested that cases of call drops and power cuts should also be considered under the ambit of a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services.Opposing a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, Congress member M.K.

article_title: Lok Sabha Passes Consumer Protection Bill, 2018
event: Vishnu Prasad said a consumer can lodge a complaint even from home without taking help of lawyers.Supporting a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, BJD member Ramesh Chandra Majhi said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services will ensure protection of consumers rights.BJD member Ramesh Chandra Majhi, however, sought clarifications on a few issues including composition of district consumer forums and how the long list of pending consumer cases across the country will be disposed of.BSP member Girish Chandra demanded that provisions should be made in a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services to make district consumer forum heads accountable.BSP member Girish Chandra also spoke about prevalence of adulterated goods in the market and protection of rights of electricity consumers.Congress member Saptagiri Ulaka demanded that a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services be sent to the standing committee for proper scrutiny.Congress member Saptagiri Ulaka said the powers given to the central government in a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services should be distributed to states for protection of consumer rights.Congress member Saptagiri Ulaka also claimed that the provision of mediation in a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services will lead to corruption.BJP member Rajendra Agarwal said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services is a comprehensive one and would be a milestone in protecting rights of consumers.In case of misleading advertisements, along with manufacturers and service providers, celebrities who endorse such advertisements should be brought under a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services, TRS member Ranjith Reddy said.There should also be provisions regarding damaged goods as well as those pertaining to Maximum Retail Price (MRP), TRS member Ranjith Reddy added.Jayadev Galla of the TDP said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services is silent on surrogate advertising, noting that surrogate advertising is done for products like 'pan masala' and 'liquor'.Jayadev Galla of the TDP said there should be some accountability for celebrities for endorsing products against which consumers make complaints but, Jayadev Galla of the TDP added, celebrities cannot be treated at the same level as brands and companies.BJP's Girish Bapat said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services will do justice to consumers who, BJP's Girish Bapat added, should be made more vigilant to pursue consumers who, he added, should be made more vigilant to pursue their rights's rights.BJP's Supriya Sule supported a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services but asked the government to clarify as to whom the people will turn to in cases of food adulterations or poor education and health services due to multiplicity of authorities.Referring to a popular instant food product, NCP's Supriya Sule said different states had different test reports on a popular instant food product after a popular instant food product was banned across the country for being allegedly unsafe.a popular instant food product was allowed later, NCP's Supriya Sule said, wondering if allowed was a case of harassment.Hasnain Masoodi of the National Conference accused the Centre of working to usurp powers of states through a host of recent bills and said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services is also a step in that direction.BJP's Aparajita Sarangi praised a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services as a case of "smart governance" of a "smart government" and said a bill which seeks to strengthen rights of consumers and provides a mechanism for redressal of complaints regarding defects in goods and deficiency in services will be a game-changer if implemented well.E.T.

article_title: Lok Sabha Passes Consumer Protection Bill, 2018

article_title: I&FC Constitutes Teams To Monitor Streams And Rivers
event: SRINAGAR —  On directions of Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan, Irrigation & Flood Control (I&FC) department has constituted 131 beats of rivers and streams across the valley for 131 beats of rivers and streams across the valley's round the clock monitoring by Irrigation & Flood Control (I&FC) department's officers.In this regard, Irrigation & Flood Control (I&FC) department constituted 14 flood Zonal Committees in 39 sectors in ten districts of the Kashmir Division.In Anantnag district one Flood Zonal Committee in five sectors with 15 beats, in Kulgam one Flood Zonal Committee in three sectors with 8 beats, in Shopian one Flood Zonal Committee in two sectors with 7 beats, in Pulwama  two Flood Zonal Committees in four sectors with 15 beats, in SRINAGAR one Flood Zonal Committee in four sectors with 20 beats, in Ganderbal  one Flood Zonal Committee in one sector with 2 beats, in Budgam two Flood Zonal Committees in four sectors with 12 beats, in Bandipora one Flood Zonal Committee in six sectors with 23 beats, in Baramulla  two Flood Zonal Committees in four sectors with 13 beats and in Kupwara district two Flood Zonal Committees in six sectors with 16 beats were constituted by Irrigation & Flood Control (I&FC) department on the embankments of rivers and streams.

article_title: Unnao Rape Victim Accident: CBI Books Suspended BJP MLA For Murder
event: NEW DELHI — The CBI has booked BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and 10 others on murder charges in the accident case of Unnao rape survivor, officials said on Wednesday.Immediately after filing booked, a team of officers from The CBI's Lucknow unit reached the crime scene in Gurubakshganj area of Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli district, where the accident took place.According to the normal procedure, The CBI has taken over the investigation in the accident case of Unnao rape survivor from the Uttar Pradesh's Police by re-registering The CBI's was first registered on a complaint by Mahesh Singh, Unnao rape survivor's uncle who is lodged in a Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli district prison.Mahesh Singh, the victim's uncle who is lodged in a Rae Bareli prison had alleged that the family was under constant pressure from the kin of BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, after BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's suspension from the party.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: Those people become addicted to drugs who lack principles or have lost willpower to overcome frustrations.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: At times reasons may differ from one to another but what is common among all drug addicts is all drug addicts are involved in severe or complex disease, complex in terms that drugs promote the compulsive drug abuse and the quitting after is difficult even after getting ready to quit.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: Drug abuse not only has Drug abuse's impact on the one who takes Drug abuse but on the ones who are around the one who takes it or we can say on the whole society, even though at the beginning the decision to take Drug abuse is his or her own.This menace has gripped Kashmir and there is a need to create awareness about This menace most importantly among student community.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: Drug abuse in Kashmir from some years has caused the disintegration of the moral fabric of the society leading to chaos and confusion whereby the social values are being ignored giving rise to a splintered society full of evils and deviations.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: From the past couple of months the scene is so worsening that the scene has put a lot of stress on the people of Kashmir in general and for government agencies, NGO’s in particular.The biggest challenge is the illegal trafficking and sale of drugs within Kashmir to which police in particular public in general have an important role to play.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: With full public support and cooperation, police can work more efficiently to end This menace.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: The other challenge is the limited facilities available for rehabilitation of drug addicts.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: Lack of awareness about both Drug Addiction and the process of detoxification and recovery is also a challenge.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: Government agencies, educational institute’s, colleges in particular, NGO’s's and other social institutions need to educate people especially young generation about This menace.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: The awareness on the part of parents and caretakers is also vital so that parents and caretakers can detect This menace as early as possible.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility
event: Besides following suggestions can help in timely control of This menace:First of all Government and private health centers should join hands to conduct awareness and intervention programs.

article_title: Fighting Drug Menace Our Collective Responsibility

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: In a welcome assurance, J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik on Wednesday  said that there is no plan at any level to abrogate Article 35-A which forbids outsiders from settling in J&K J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik said that the people should not pay heed to rumors making rounds about Centre contemplating to do away with special domicile rights of the J&K residents.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik blamed the local politicians for stoking rumors making rounds about Centre contemplating to do away with special domicile rights of the J&K residents.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: Similarly responding to a question on Article 35A, senior BJP leader and BJP's J&K in-charge Ram Madhav cryptically said that Centre will do what was in the interest of J&K and J&K's people.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: senior BJP leader and the party's J&K in-charge Ram Madhav, however added that BJP's position on J&K's special status was well-known.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: This mixed reaction from J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik and senior BJP leader and the party's J&K in-charge Ram Madhav hasn't left people any more wiser about the fate of J&K's special constitutional status than people were before.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: More so when a deep sense of apprehension and foreboding  has been pervading the Valley over the past two weeks.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: On the other hand, past two days have witnessed the J&K political parties other than BJP  making moves to forge  a united front against the anticipated assault on the J&K's special constitutional status.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: On the urging of the PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti, the National Conference president Dr Farooq Abdullah has agreed to hold an all party meeting to discuss strategy to resist any bid to revoke  Article 35A But while the J&K political parties other than the BJP were at an all party meeting, the National Conference president Dr Farooq Abdullah was called for questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in Chandigarh.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: But the J&K political parties other than the BJP have lent the J&K political parties other than the BJP's support to collective efforts to pre-empt any tinkering with the J&K's special constitutional status.Meanwhile also a National Conference delegation, led by former Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Farooq Abdullah, called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday to discuss the situation in J&K.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: The developments like these have generated some hope among people but The developments like these have not sufficiently addressed the anxiety about Centre's intention.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik has certainly tried to  clear the vitiated air, but Centre has been largely silent, and, in fact, spoken in many voices.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: Therefore, it is still what Centre does in practice about Article 35A that remains the touchstone about the professed sincerity of Centre's words, including that of J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik.

article_title: Hope and Paranoia
event: People now expect its words to be matched by the deed.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: I have just taken an entire website and gigabytes of data offline.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: an entire website covered a highly successful series of conferences on the data economy.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: an entire website brought together thought leaders and key decision-makers from around the world for annual retreats – over a decade ago.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: And now an entire website is gone.Every year, some thousands of sites – including ones with unique information – go offline.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Countless further webpages become inaccessible; instead of information, users encounter error messages.Where some commentators may lament yet another black hole in the slowly rotting Internet, I actually feel okay.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Of course, I, too, dread broken links and dead servers.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: But I also know: Forgetting is important.In fact, as I argued in I's book, “Delete: The Virtue of Forgetting in the Digital Age,” all through human history, humans reserved remembering for the things that really mattered to humans and forgot the rest.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Now the slowly rotting Internet is making forgetting a lot harder.Built to forgetHumans are accustomed to a world in which forgetting is the norm, and remembering is the exception.This isn’t necessarily a bug in human evolution.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: The mind forgets what is no longer relevant to our present.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Human memory is constantly reconstructed – Human memory isn’t preserved in pristine condition, but becomes altered over time, helping people overcome cognitive dissonances.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: For example, people may see an awful past as rosier than an awful past was, or devalue memories of past conflict with a person with whom people are close in the present.Forgetting also helps humans to focus on current issues and to plan for the future.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Research shows that those who are too tethered to those who are too tethered to their past's past find it difficult to live and act in the present.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Forgetting creates space for something new, enabling people to go beyond what people already know.Organizations that remember too much ossify in Organizations that remember too much's processes and behavior.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Learning something new requires forgetting something old – and requires is hard for organizations that remember too much.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: There’s a growing literature on the importance of “unlearning,” or deliberately purging deeply rooted processes or practices from an organization – a fancy way to say that forgetting fulfills a valuable purpose.Choosing to rememberOur human minds developed a rather effective mechanism to balance remembering and forgetting.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Humans don’t have to do it consciously.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: (In fact people very rarely can – or can you forget something I tell you to forget?)

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: The brain does it for us, mainly, during sleep.The brain is far from perfect – yes, I do forget things I wanted to remember, and recall things like phone numbers I no longer need – but The brain is working sufficiently well to let us think, decide and act in the present.Because humans have always forgotten so much, humans learned about the importance of preserving the things that really matter.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: We have not preserved every commercial invoice from the 1800s, but kept photos of important or illuminating moments.Of course, people make mistakes, and recorded memory reflects the choices of those with the power and the means to preserve.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: But even these biased memories are being constructed and reconstructed all the time, amended, augmented, sometimes even disregarded.This means that humans are constantly defining and redefining what for us as individuals and as a society really matters.the slowly rotting Internet the slowly rotting Internet is threatening this mental balancing.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: For the first time in human history, remembering is the default –- simple, easy and seemingly free –- and forgetting is hard.Think about your photos, your tweets, your documents.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Our digital systems keep your photos, your tweets, your documents, and you have to take action to get rid of your photos, your tweets, your documents.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: I rarely do.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: It’s too tempting, too easy to just save everything.What’s more, powerful, ubiquitous search has made this enormous amount of digital memories easily and swiftly accessible.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Far more often than before, people now stumble over our collective past as people travel the slowly rotting Internet or look at people's favorite social media.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: For example, Facebook’s “On This Day” feature caused distress to some users when Facebook’s “On This Day” feature unexpectedly surfaced posts about deceased loved ones.That would be okay if humans had developed mental mechanisms to discount the past when the past no longer tells us something relevant to the present.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: But humans never had to develop ways to forget deliberately.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: Because forgetting was automatic, when people remembered things, or were reminded of things, people gave things significance and importance -– why would people otherwise remember?In the internet age, many things are remembered that have long lost many things's relevance.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: This strains people’s mental processes, as recall of something people’s thought people’s had forgotten suddenly creates questions about what past information is still relevant and what isn’t.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: People can’t help asking questions about what past information is still relevant and what isn’t, much like People can’t consciously forget (or at least not in most cases).

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: This increases the chances for errors.If someone is reminded of a person’s misdoing decades ago, someone often can’t help but be shocked.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: someone judge the misconduct in the context of the present.For example, a Canadian psychotherapist was banned from entering the U.S., because an immigration officer checking a Canadian psychotherapist's ID was searching a Canadian psychotherapist's name on the slowly rotting Internet and discovered that a Canadian psychotherapist confessed in a scholarly article to taking drugs many years earlier.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: A young woman was refused a teacher’s certificate because A young woman had posted a photo of A young woman's online that showed A young woman with a drink in hand and a photo of her online that showed her with a drink in hand was discovered by A young woman's university.I fear that comprehensive digital memory may push people toward an unforgiving world, in which we deny each other (and we) the capacity to evolve, to grow and to change.Losing the ability to forget is not simply an unreserved blessing, but a potential curse.

article_title: Humans Were Built To Remember Only Important-Things.The Internet Is Disturbing That Balance
event: As much as many dread the slowly rotting Internet, and may rightly want to preserve the parts that people care about, I think that everyone should consider embracing digital rotting as an opportunity, and the empty spaces digital rotting creates as lacunae of hope.The Article First Appeared In The Conversation

event: SRINAGAR — Army Chief Gen Bipin Rawat arrived in SRINAGAR on a two-day visit to the Kashmir Valley on Thursday to review the prevailing security situation.Army Chief Gen Bipin Rawat accompanied by the Northern Army Commander Lt Gen Ranbir Singh and Chinar Corps Commander Lt Gen KJS Dhillon visited the formations and units deployed in the Kashmir Valley, a defence ministry spokesman said.a defence ministry spokesman said Army Chief Gen Bipin Rawat was briefed by the local Commanders on the prevailing security situation and the measures instituted to ensure close coordination with all government agencies towards maintaining vigil and peace in the Kashmir Valley.

article_title: TTP Warns Against Playing Music,Women Going Out Alone In Miramshah
event: MIRAMSHAH — The banned Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) has warned people against playing loud music, polio vaccination and women going out without being accompanied by a man, saying people defying warned will face consequences, reported Dawn.The one-page message in Urdu seen by people in MIRAMSHAH, on Wednesday cautioned the people: “We remind you [residents] that similar statements issued by We several times in the past had fallen on deaf ears, but this time We are going to take to task those who violate the We order.”The message further said: “There will be no use of DJs, neither inside the house nor in open fields and those ignoring warned will be responsible for consequences.”Polio workers have been asked to do finger-marking of children during the vaccination campaign, but told not to administer polio drops to children or be ready to face dire consequences for defying the instruction.The one-page message in Urdu seen by people in Miramshah, the headquarters of North Waziristan tribal district, on Wednesday prohibited playing loud music on computer and other shops with a warning that any place from where songs were heard could be blown up any time.“Women shouldn’t go out of “Women's homes alone as go is harmful for our society.

article_title: 'Pak To Grant Consular Access To Kulbhushan Jadhav By Friday'
event: ISLAMABAD — Indian national Kulbhushan Jadhav, who is on death row in Pakistan, will be granted consular access by Friday, Foreign Office spokesman Mohammad Faisal said on Thursday.Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer, was sentenced to death by a Pakistani military court on charges of "espionage and terrorism" in April 2017 following which India had moved the International Court of Justice (ICJ), seeking a stay on Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer,'s death sentence and further remedies.Pakistan is awaiting Indian response after Pakistan formally informed the Indian High Commission here," Foreign Office spokesman Mohammad Faisal said at the weekly media briefing.granted comes two weeks after the International Court of Justice (ICJ) ordered Pakistan on July 17 to undertake an "effective review and reconsideration" of the conviction and sentence of Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer, and also to grant consular access to India without further delay.In the International Court of Justice (ICJ)'s 42-page ruling, the International Court of Justice (ICJ) ruled that Pakistan had "breached" the Vienna Convention on diplomatic relations, which gives countries the right to consular access when countries's nationals are arrested abroad.Pakistan claims that Pakistan's security forces arrested Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer, from restive Balochistan province on March 3, 2016 after Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer, reportedly entered from Iran.However, India maintains that Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer, was kidnapped from IranIndian Navy.India evaluating Pakistan's proposal of facilitating consular access to Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer,: India is evaluating Pak's proposal of facilitating consular access to Kulbhushan Jadhav in the light of the recent verdict by the International Court of Justice (ICJ), the External Affairs Ministry Thursday said.

article_title: 'Pak To Grant Consular Access To Kulbhushan Jadhav By Friday'
event: Pakistan has sent a proposal to India for facilitating consular access to Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer,.

article_title: 'Pak To Grant Consular Access To Kulbhushan Jadhav By Friday'
event: "We will reply to Pakistan through diplomatic channels," the External Affairs Ministry's spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said.Last month, the International Court of Justice (ICJ), in the recent verdict by the International Court of Justice, directed Pakistan to provide full consular access to Jadhav, 49, a retired Indian Navy officer,.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: In the turbulent Kashmir, summers have long been synonymous with discontent.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: But this year has been an exception, marked by a relative normality.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: Post-February 14 Pulwama blast, there has been downward trend in militant strikes.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: A thaw is discernible in the paroxysm of violent protests and stone-pelting in the turbulent Kashmir.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: Army officials acknowledge a significant drop in infiltration from Pakistan after the melting of snow on the Line of Control.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: The month-long Amarnath yatra, a stupendous security challenge, has seen a record high number of pilgrims.Yet, the turbulent Kashmir finds the turbulent Kashmir in the throes of trepidation.The trigger came in form of the Centre’s plan to deploy an additional 10,000 paramilitary men, apparently to bolster the turbulent Kashmir's anti-insurgency grid.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: deploy, coupled with the railways’ advisory on an impending “emergency situation” and the police order seeking details of mosques in Srinagar, has stoked the fear and conjectures that the security ramp-up may be a prelude to the Narendra Modi government’s move to scrap the Article 35A which allows J&K to define J&K's permanent residents and its permanent residents's special rights on land and employment.Clouds of uncertainty in the turbulent Kashmir's mainstream political parties lost no time in articulating the street sentiment, and cautioned the Centre’s against tinkering with the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: But the conspiracy theories swirling in the turbulent Kashmir speculated that the Narendra Modi government’s may bring an ordinance to do away with the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment.What has also raised the hackles in the turbulent Kashmir is the Narendra Modi government’s emphatic assertion on the Narendra Modi government’s's long-held ideological opposition against the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment and the Article 370 (that guarantees special status to J&KJ&K ).

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: While the saffron party views the Article 35A and the Article 370 (that guarantees special status to J & K) as a root cause of separatist sentiment in the turbulent Kashmir and a barrier to the turbulent Kashmir's equitable development, the Valley-based parties call the Article 35A and the Article 370 (that guarantees special status to J & K) “a vital bridge between India and the turbulent Kashmir.“Scrapping the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment will be akin to igniting the powder keg” roared former chief minister Mehbooba Mufti at a rally in Srinagar on Sunday.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: former chief minister Mehbooba Mufti even reached out to former chief minister Mehbooba Mufti's arch-rival National Conference, urging her arch-rival National Conference's patron and former chief minister Farooq Abdullah to call an all-party meeting and forge a united response to defend the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment as the Centre’s half-heartedly tried to clear the air on fresh security reinforcement, suspicion runs deep across the turbulent Kashmir.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: “If the government claims on the decline in militancy, stone pelting and violence are true, then for what purpose are additional troops being deployed here,” questions Yousaf Tarigami, a respected communist leader of the turbulent Kashmir, arguing that “instead of such shock therapy, the turbulent Kashmir needs confidence building measures to come out of the cycle of depression and disillusionment”.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: Yousaf Tarigami, a respected communist leader of Kashmir may be echoing what most Kashmiris feel.the Narendra Modi government’s govt, the turbulent Kashmir parties on different pageCrucially, the strong political reactions underscore a growing chasm between the Narendra Modi government’s the Narendra Modi government’s and mainstream Kashmiri outfits represented chiefly by NC and PDP which had stayed out of local bodies and panchayat elections early this year over the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment NC and PDP have also been sharply critical of governor Satya Pal Malik for pushing policy decisions which NC and PDP feel tinker with the Article 35A which allows J&K to define its permanent residents and their special rights on land and employment and should have been left to an elected government.In fact, the turbulent Kashmir's traditional political players are peeved at tough-talking home minister Amit Shah charting a radical shift in the the turbulent Kashmir policy.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: While Kashmir’s traditional political players frame the the turbulent Kashmir issue as a political issue, making pitch for a dialogue with stake-holders, including the separatists, home minister Amit Shah sees the turmoil as a problem confined to “three-and-a-half districts of south Kashmir”.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: Not surprisingly, home minister Amit Shah firmly spurned the separatists's overtures for engagement.the Narendra Modi government’s reckons the development is the best antidote to militancy – a view that the Narendra Modi government’s again articulated in the Narendra Modi government’s's latest edition of ‘Mann ki Baat’ by saying, “People of the turbulent Kashmir want development, not bombs”.While the Centre’s's roadmap on the Centre’s's next big challenge — holding the assembly elections in the turbulent Kashmir — is still hazy, what comes out clearly is a perceptible mistrust between pro-India Kashmiri leaders and the Narendra Modi government’s.

article_title: Autumn of Anxiety
event: a perceptible mistrust between pro-India Kashmiri leaders and the Modi government has constricted the political space in the turbulent Kashmir – a development that runs the risk of stoking another cycle of street anger.the turbulent Kashmir can’t afford to descend into an autumn of anxiety and despair again.The Article First Appeared In The Hindustan Times

article_title: Pak PM Imran Khan Orders Slashing Prices Of Naan, Roti

article_title: Hour Long Rainfall Inundates City Areas, Disrupts Life
event: SRINAGAR — A morning downpour in parts of Kashmir on Thursday brought down the temperature in the Valley, even as rain caused waterlogging in many areas.Light rainfall started in Kashmir around 7:30 am.

article_title: Hour Long Rainfall Inundates City Areas, Disrupts Life
event: Light rainfall got heavier as Thursday progressed, leading to  waterlogging of roads in many areas of Kashmir, including the commercial hub of Lal Chowk, officials said.Severe traffic jam was reported in Kashmir as pedestrians were seen wading through the waters.The district administration pressed dewatering pumps into service to clear roads.According to the MeT office, the weather will remain cloudy in Kashmir.Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan conducted extensive assessment of Kashmir following rains as well as consequent water logging in different areas of Kashmir.During Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan's visit, Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan visited Sonawar, TRC Crossing, M.A.

article_title: Hour Long Rainfall Inundates City Areas, Disrupts Life
event: Road, Polo View, Regal Chowk, Residency Road, the commercial hub of Lal Chowk, Budshah Chowk, Amira Kadal, Hari Singh High Street, Jehangir Chowk, New Secretariat Road, Naaz Cinema & LD Crossings, Wazir Bagh, Gogji Bagh, Solina, Ram Bagh, Baghat, Barzulla, Chanapora, Bagh-i-Mehtab and other areas of Kashmir to take first hand appraisal of the situation which rose due to torrential rains.The Div Com was briefed about the measures being taken to tackle water-logging and preparedness to deal with any kind of exigency.The Div Com was informed that 80 Dewatering Stations, 115 mobile de-watering pumps and adequate number of fire tenders with personnel have been put on duty in various waterlogged areas across Kashmir.

article_title: Hour Long Rainfall Inundates City Areas, Disrupts Life
event: The I&FC is also using The I&FC's mobile pumps to pump out rain water that had accumulated at various locations.Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan directed the concerned to ensure additional de-watering pumps along with deployment of men and machinery at all the vital locations in Kashmir.For quick and effective action, Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan stressed engineers and officers of line departments including SMC, UEED, R&B, The I&FC and Traffic to carry out field inspections every hour across Kashmir and ensure that water is pumped out from the roads, streets and especially from schools, hospitals and electricity stations as soon as possible.

article_title: Hour Long Rainfall Inundates City Areas, Disrupts Life
event: The officers were directed to send hourly report to the Divisional Commissioner’s office about the status of de-watering measures.In future, concerned departments were asked to ensure that all the identified areas are constantly manned and supervised by officials so that the moment water-logging occurs, the authorities can swing into action immediately.Deputy Commissioner Srinagar Dr Shahid Iqbal, Commissioner SMC, Chief Engineers of Irrigation, Flood Control (I&FC) & Roads, Building (R&B), SP Traffic and other concerned officers of various Departments accompanied with The Div Com.Meanwhile on the instructions of Divisional Commissioner Kashmir Baseer Ahmad Khan, Irrigation & Flood Control (I&FC) Department today constituted 49 beats for Jhelum from Anantnag to Bandipora via Pulwama and Srinagar districts for 24x7 monitoring of water level in the river.In this regard, Irrigation & Flood Control (I&FC) Department constituted five Flood Zonal Committees (FZCs) in 14 sectors in District Police Lines Anantnag, Police Station Awantipora, Kakapora lift station, Police Control Room Srinagar and Irrigation & Flood Control Division Sumbal.All Jhelum beat officers are sending round the clock report to five Flood Zonal Committees (FZCs).

article_title: Hour Long Rainfall Inundates City Areas, Disrupts Life
event: five Flood Zonal Committees (FZCs) will further send round the clock report to the District Co-ordination Committees, which are headed by concerned Deputy Commissioners, so that effective mechanism is available at the time of exigency.

event: SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency on Thursday filed chargesheet against four local persons including brother of JeM’s slain commander Noor Mohammad Tantray in connection with a fidayeen attack on CRPF in which five paramilitary personnel were killed and three others were injured at Lethopra in south Kashmir’s Pulwam district on December 2017.According to SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency statement, a group of three  heavily armed militants of JeM’s JeM’scarried the attack on CRPF Centre at Lethpura in the intervening night of 30/31st December, 2017 to avenge the killing of JeM’s slain commander Noor Mohammad Tantray.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: In the attack on CRPF Group Centre at Lethpura, five paramilitary personnel were killed and three others got injured.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: During the ensuing operation, a group of three  heavily armed militants of Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) were also killed.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: Initially, a case under FIR number 150/2017 was registered at Awantipora Police station.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: “Considering the gravity of the case, SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency took over the investigation of the case on 27.02.2018,” an official of SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency said.an official of the NIA said chargesheet has been filed in NIA Special Court, Jammu against four accused namely –Fayaz Ahmad Magray resident of Lethpora, Awantipora, Nisar Ahmad Tantray of Dar Ganaie Gund, Tral, Syed Hilal Andrabi and Irshad Ahmad Reshi, both residents of Ratnipora, Pulwama.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: “The sections invoked against four local persons including brother of JeM’s slain commander Noor Mohammad Tantray are: section 120B read with Sections 121, 121A, 122, 123, 302, 307, 325, 330, 436, 440, 457, 459 and 460 of the Ranbir Penal Code, Sections 07 and 25 of the Arms Act, Sections 3 and 4 of the Explosives Substances Act, Sections 18, 19, 20, 23 & 39 of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, and Section 04 of the Jammu and Kashmir Public Property (Prevention of Damage) Act, 1985,” SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency said.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: During investigation, SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency said, identity of a group of three  heavily armed militants of Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) was established.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
event: The two local militants among a group of three  heavily armed militants of Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) were identified as Fardeen Ahmad Khandey son of Gulam Mohi-ud--din Khandey of Nazneenpora, Tral, Pulwama and Manzoor Ahmad Baba son of Ali Mohammad of Drubgam, Pulwama , while, the identity of the third Fidayeen was identified as Abdul Shakoor, a resident of Rawalakot, PaK.“Recce of CRPF Group Centre at Lethpura was done by JeM’s slain commander Noor Mohammad Tantray along with other accused during the second week of December 2017.

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents

event: “JeM commander Mufti Waqas (Pakistani) and Mudasir Ahmad Khan were later killed in different encounters with security forces.”Accused Fayaz Ahmad Magray was an active associate of JeM’s slain commander Noor Mohammad Tantray.

event: “JeM’s slain commander Noor Mohammad Tantray and Fayaz Ahmad Magray resident of Lethpora, Awantipora played an active role in planning and execution of the attack on CRPF Group Centre at Lethpura.

event: After the attack on CRPF Group Centre at Lethpura, in the month of January 2018, the role of Mudasir Ahmad Khan came into knowledge of Police and a raid was conducted at Mudasir Ahmad Khan's house.” Fayaz Ahmad Magray resident of Lethpora, Awantipora, SRINAGAR — National Investigation Agency said, immediately facilitated Mudasir Ahmad Khan to join the JeM’s militant ranks as an active militant by arranging weapon through JeM commander Mufti Waqas (Pakistani).

article_title: 2017 Lethpora Fidayeen Attack: NIA Books 4 Pulwama Residents
