article_title: Breather to congested city
event: To decongest Srinagar city, two initiatives that were repeatedly endorsed by the government have failed to pay up.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: two initiatives that were repeatedly endorsed by the government are the municipal corporation’s drives to remove encroachment from roads and footpaths, and the widening of roads in Srinagar city.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: While as the widening of roads in the city may sound utopian given the numerous bottlenecks, narrow and winding roads in Srinagar city, removing encroachment is not an undoable goal.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: The drives initiated by the municipal corporation’s have presented some unruly scenes with the enforcement officials getting into slugfests on many occasions.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: In some areas the shopkeepers and vendors have become so emboldened that the shopkeepers and vendors dictate the terms to the officials of the municipal corporation’s.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: While the step taken by the municipal corporation’s to give the roads a breather need to be appreciated, it must be made abundantly clear to one and all that law has the final word in Srinagar city.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: the municipal corporation’s's concern for pedestrians should be hailed; the law enforcement should be preceded by proper ground work, public awareness and involvement of civil society.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: It is unfortunate that even the ground staff of the municipal corporation’s does not know about the prescribed codes about footpaths, shops parapets, wayside heaping of consumer goods and roadside shacks serving as tea stalls.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: The resentment from the shopkeepers is expected as the municipal corporation’s has failed to issue prior information, which could have informed the vendors and hawkers about the encroachment.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: To impose any law or to correct any wrong in the society needs wisdom, rather than force or power.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: The drive should be people-friendly and intended to clear the hindrances for pedestrians to walk freely and to overcome the problem of traffic jams, which has, otherwise, turned into a big nuisance for commuters.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: However, the way anti-encroachment drive is conducted it looks that the aim is to deprive the people or shopkeepers of the people or shopkeepers's livelihood, which isn’t the case.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: To make any program a success there is a way to follow, and an approach to adopt.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: Let there be a multi pronged policy involving awareness, involvement and enforcement to clear the hindrances from roads and pavements.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: It is important to generate awareness about any program that the state government or Municipal Corporation has planned to implement.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: There is also a need to state clearly the aims and objectives of any move or drive initiated by the government or by the government's agencies.

article_title: Breather to congested city
event: The state for that matter can use local media organizations to disseminate essential information.

article_title: President Kovind Gives Assent To Triple Talaq Bill
event: NEW DELHI — President Ram Nath Kovind has given assent to the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament, turning the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament into a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence, a government notification said.a government notification, says the president has given assent to the triple talaq bill passed by ParliamentParliament.a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence will replace an ordinance promulgated on February 21 this year to the same effect.a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence makes talaq-e-biddat or any other similar form of talaq having the effect of instantaneous and irrevocable divorce pronounced by a Muslim husband void and illegal.a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence makes it illegal to pronounce talaq three times in spoken, written or through SMS or WhatsApp or any other electronic chat in one sitting.

article_title: President Kovind Gives Assent To Triple Talaq Bill
event: "Any pronouncement of talaq by a Muslim husband upon a Muslim husband's wife, by words, either spoken or written or in electronic form or in any other manner whatsoever, shall be void and illegal," a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence says.Any Muslim husband who pronounces the illegal form of talaq upon his wife shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine, a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence says.the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament was passed by Rajya Sabha with 99 votes in favour and 84 against, as the ruling NDA, which lacks majority in the upper house, was helped by the absence of some members of the opposition Congress, SP and BSP as well as six members of Telangana Rashtra Samithi and two MPs of YSR-Congress.the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament could not make it through the upper house earlier this year during the first term of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government, although the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament was passed by Lok Sabha.the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament was again passed by Lok Sabha last week amid a walkout by several opposition parties including the opposition Congress and the Trinamool Congress.several opposition parties including the Congress and the Trinamool Congress had said in the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament's current form, a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence could be misused to harass Muslims and wanted a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence to be reviewed by a parliamentary committee.Criminalising the offence, the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament gives a police officer powers to arrest the offender without requiring a warrant, several opposition parties including the Congress and the Trinamool Congress had said.To check misuse of cognisable nature of the offence, the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament makes declaration of talaq-e-biddat only if the complaint is filed by the aggrieved woman or any of the aggrieved woman's relation by blood or marriage, a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence says.A magistrate can grant bail only after hearing the aggrieved woman, a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence says.the aggrieved woman is entitled to demand a maintenance for the aggrieved woman and the aggrieved woman's dependent children under a law which makes the practice of instant divorce among Muslims a punishable offence.Opposing the triple talaq bill passed by Parliament, Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad had said a law should not be made to "finish one particular religion" and claimed that the "cat has come out of the bag".Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad said the government should not target one section by framing an "unconstitutional" law but instead provide 33 per cent reservation to women in legislatures for women's empowerm

article_title: Markets Sink To 5-Month Lows On Gloomy Macro Data, Fed Comments
event: MUMBAI — Equity benchmarks crashed to five-month lows on Thursday as lacklustre macroeconomic data and hawkish comments from the US Fed further dented risk appetite.After a weak opening, the 30-share BSE Sensex plunged more than 750 points in late-afternoon trade, before finally ending at 37,018.32, down by 462.80 points or 1.23 per cent.Similarly, the broader NSE Nifty dropped 138 points or 1.24 per cent to close below the key 11,000-mark at 10,980.00.This is the lowest closing level for both the key indices since early March.Weak economic data, unabated foreign fund outflows and disappointing quarterly earnings also weighed on market sentiment, traders said.On the global front, the US Federal Reserve reduced the benchmark lending rate by 25 basis points to 2.0-2.25 per cent on Wednesday for the first time in more than a decade.However, the US Fed Chair Jerome Powell said reduced was not the beginning of a rate cut cycle, sending global markets lower.In the Sensex pack, Vedanta took the biggest hit (5.55 per cent), followed by Tata Motors, SBI, Yes Bank, Bharti Airtel and Infosys, which lost up to 4.50 per cent.On the other hand, Maruti, Power Grid, Reliance, Bajaj Auto, Hero MotoCorp, HUL and NTPC ended in the green, spurting up to 1.86 per cent.Official data released after market hours on Wednesday showed that growth of eight core industries dropped to 0.2 per cent in June, mainly due to contraction in oil-related sectors as well as cement production.Additionally, the government's fiscal deficit touched Rs 4.32 lakh crore for the June quarter, which is 61.4 per cent of the budget estimate for 2019-20 fiscal.Major automobile manufacturers on Thursday reported disappointing July sales data, indicating that revival in consumer sentiment is still someway off.

article_title: Unnao Rape Case: SC Transfers 5 Cases To Delhi
event: NEW DELHI — The Supreme Court Thursday directed the transfer of all five cases registered in connection with the Unnao rape incident from a court in Uttar Pradesh to a court in NEW DELHI.The Supreme Court also directed the Uttar Pradesh government to provide Rs 25 lakh to the rape survivor as an interim compensation.Besides, The Supreme Court directed the CBI to complete within seven days the investigation of the fifth case relating to the last Sunday's accident in which the rape survivor and the rape survivor's lawyer were critically injured and two of the rape survivor's aunts killed.A bench headed by Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi made it clear that the CBI can only seek extension of additional seven days time for probe in the fifth case relating to the last Sunday's accident in which the woman and her lawyer were critically injured and two of her aunts killed and that too in exceptional circumstances.A bench headed by Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi, directed that the trial in the main case relating to the rape of the rape survivor will have to be completed within 45 days from the trial in the main case relating to the rape of the survivor's commencement.The Supreme Court said that the name of the presiding judge for the trial in the main case relating to the rape of the survivor all five cases registered in connection with the Unnao rape incident will be decided after an in-chamber consultation.The Supreme Court said The Supreme Court was passing an exparte order without the representation of the accused persons to ensure expeditious investigation and trial in all five cases registered in connection with the Unnao rape incident keeping in view the peculiar facts and circumstances of the main case relating to the rape of the survivor.A bench headed by Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi said A bench headed by Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi will not entertain any plea seeking to vacate or alter an exparte order without the representation of the accused personsThursday.The Supreme Court directed that the rape survivor, the rape survivor's mother and other members of the family will be provided security by the CRPF and an officer of the level of commandant will file a compliance report forthwith.The Supreme Court also took note of the oral instructions received by the CBI from the doctors of the King George Medical College Hospital that the woman and her lawyer her lawyer are in a condition to be airlifted to AIIMS, NEW DELHI.The Supreme Court will however pass the order in this regard after receiving instruction from the woman and her lawyer's family members.

article_title: India Slips Two Spots to 7th Position in Global GDP-Ranking for 2018
event: NEW DELHI — The World Bank data for 2018 showed that India fell two spots in global GDP ranking to seventh place compared with the fifth position India took in the year 2017.

event: The UK and France pipped India 2018, cementing The UK and France's place at the fifth and sixth spots, respectively.The US remained the largest economy in the world with a GDP of $20.5 trillion, followed by China and Japan, with economy sizes of $13.6 trillion and nearly $5 trillion, respectively.Germany ($4 trillion), The UK ($2.8 trillion) and France ($2.77 trillion) took the fourth, fifth and sixth positions, respectively.

article_title: India Slips Two Spots to 7th Position in Global GDP-Ranking for 2018
event: India's GDP in 2018 was just slightly behind at $2.73 trillion.Notably, in the year 2017, India's GDP was $2.65 trillion, higher than The UK $2.64 trillion and France's $2.5 trillion.Meanwhile, Italy ($2.1 trillion), Brazil ($1.9 trillion) and Canada ($1.7 trillion) took the eighth, ninth and tenth spots in global GDP ranking for 2018.The news of fell comes just a day after rating agency Crisil cut India's GDP growth estimate to 6.9% for FY20 from 7.1% earlier.

article_title: India Slips Two Spots to 7th Position in Global GDP-Ranking for 2018

article_title: Post-Imran Visit,US Avoids Using ‘Reset’ Term For Ties With Pak
event: WASHINGTON — A week after the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, senior administration officials here are avoiding the use of term “reset” to describe the new bonhomie in the bilateral ties, noting that the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan demonstrated that the two countries can do more in areas of overlapping interests.“Reset is a loaded term,” a senior State Department official said in response to a question that before the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, a section of the media reported that a section of the media were seeking a reset of the relationship.“What a senior State Department official think the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan demonstrated that the more the two countries work together in areas of overlapping interests such as peace in Afghanistan, the door opens to broader and deeper cooperation,” a senior State Department official said.In a readout, more than a week after the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, a senior State Department official said the two countries looked for ways to enhance investment in trade, adding that the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan resulted in the broadening of the relationship.

event: “We will look for a trade delegation to Pakistan… further engagement through the two countries's trade and investment framework agreement will help attract more American companies to Pakistan,” a senior State Department official said.Pakistan, a senior State Department official observed, was taking steps, whether it was the seizure of assets, closure or taking over the administration of certain madrassas or detention of individuals like Hafiz Saeed.a senior State Department official added, “a senior State Department official think the US visit of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan demonstrated that the quality, warmth, breadth and the depth of the relationship is going to be a function of the two countries's ability to work together on the most important national security issues.” Obviously, the issue was regional stability and peace, a senior State Department official insisted.

article_title: Kashmir Struck by Fear of the Unknown
event: SRINAGAR — Kashmir remained on the edge on Friday as an unprecedented order by the state administration terminating Amarnath Yatra midway and asking tourists and yatris to leave Kashmir Valley immediately triggered panic among the residents who moved in haste to stock up rations and other essentials, fearing for the worst.An order issued by Principal Secretary Home, Shaleen Kabra advised the tourists and Amarnath yatris in Kashmir to “curtail the tourists and Amarnath yatris in the state's stay in Kashmir Valley immediately and take necessary measures to return as soon as possible”.An order issued by Principal Secretary Home, Shaleen Kabra Amarnath Yatra came even as official figures suggest record 3.40 lakh yatris having already visited Amarnath in one month.SRTC buses were put in service and aviation regulator DGCA directed airlines to remain ready to operate additional flights from the SRINAGAR airport to evacuate the tourists and Amarnath yatris in the state if need be.An order issued by Principal Secretary Home, Shaleen Kabra and subsequent measures led to unprecedented panic in Kashmir after New Delhi rushed 100 more companies of additional troops to Kashmir Valley.The deployment of 100 more companies of additional troops and various orders gave rise to the speculations about some major decision in the offing regarding the Jammu and Kashmir.In SRINAGAR there was chaos on the roads as people left people's routine works to stock up essentials.Amid this chaos and confusion people were seen lining up at ATM’s, medical shops, departmental stores to stockpile essentials.

article_title: UK Updates Advisory For British Nationals To Be ‘Vigilant’ In J&K
event: LONDON — The U.K. government on Saturday updated the travel advisory for The U.K. government's citizens travelling to Jammu and Kashmir, warning its citizens travelling to Jammu and Kashmir to “remain vigilant” and up to date with developments, citing reports in the media over a heightened security threat in Jammu and Kashmir.The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) updated the travel advisory for its citizens travelling to Jammu and Kashmir a day after the authorities in Jammu Kashmir suspended the annual Amarnath yatra due to security reasons, and issued an advisory asking pilgrims and tourists to return as soon as possible.The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) warned against travel to Jammu and Kashmir, and to tourist destinations of Pahalgam, Gulmarg and Sonamarg.“On August 2, the Indian media reported that Jammu and Kashmir Jammu Kashmir had advised tourists and the annual Amarnath yatra pilgrims to curtail tourists and Amarnath Yatra pilgrims's stay in the Kashmir Valley immediately and take necessary measures to return home as soon as possible because of security threats,” updated noted.“The British High Commission in New Delhi is monitoring the situation.

article_title: UK Updates Advisory For British Nationals To Be ‘Vigilant’ In J&K
event: If you’re in Jammu Kashmir, you should remain vigilant, follow the advice of local authorities and keep up to date with developments, including via this travel advice,” updated said.In the travel advisory for its citizens travelling to Jammu and Kashmir, The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) advises against all travel to the immediate vicinity of the border with Pakistan, other than at Wagah and Jammu Kashmir, except for travel within Jammu, travel by air to Jammu, and travel within the region of Ladakh.The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) advice extends to “all but essential travel” to the city of Srinagar and between the cities of Jammu and the city of Srinagar on the Jammu-the city of Srinagar national highway.The broad advice to British citizens travelling to India also includes a warning that the risk of a militant attack remains “very likely”.“Recent attacks have targeted public places including those visited by foreigners.

article_title: UK Updates Advisory For British Nationals To Be ‘Vigilant’ In J&K
event: There have been recent media reports suggesting Daesh (formerly referred to as ISIL) may have an interest in attacking targets in India,” the travel advisory for its citizens travelling to Jammu and Kashmir reads.“There may be an increased threat to places visited by British nationals such as religious sites, markets, festival venues and beaches.

article_title: UK Updates Advisory For British Nationals To Be ‘Vigilant’ In J&K
event: You should be vigilant at this time, monitor local media and take all precautions for your safety,” the travel advisory for its citizens travelling to Jammu and Kashmir adds.The purpose of The government’s advice is to provide information and advice to help British nationals make informed decisions about foreign travel to different destinations around the world.The government’s advice, is kept under constant review to be updated in light to developing incidents or threats in a particular region around the world.

article_title: Cong Apprehends ‘Misadventure’, Demands PM's Statement
event: NEW DELHI —  Condemning the government's decision to curtail the Amarnath Yatra, the Congress on Saturday demanded that Prime Minister Narendra Modi make a statement in Parliament on the current situation in Jammu and Kashmir and expressed apprehensions about a "misadventure" by the Union Home Ministry.the Congress sought a reply from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, a day after the government's Jammu Kashmir asked Amarnath yatris and tourists to cut short Amarnath yatris and tourists's stay in the Valley and return as soon as possible in the wake of intelligence inputs of "specific terror threats" to the Amarnath Yatra.Addressing a press conference at the party office here, senior party leader and former home minister P Chidambaram cautioned the Union Home Ministry against any misadventure in Kashmir related to constitutional provisions such as Articles 35A and 370.Referring to the advisory, senior Congress leader and former chief minister of Kashmir Ghulam Nabi Azad said the Amarnath Yatra has never been curtailed in the history of the country, not even in 2000 when the biggest attack on pilgrims left over 30 people dead.

article_title: Police To Get Pepper Ball Launching Guns, Remotely Operated Vehicles
event: JAMMU — The JAMMU and Kashmir police will procure pepper ball launching guns (PBLGs) and remotely operated vehicles (RoVs) to deal with the law and order situation in Kashmir Valley, an official said.

article_title: Police To Get Pepper Ball Launching Guns, Remotely Operated Vehicles
event: Kashmir police recently floated tenders for purchasing 50 PBLGs and two RoVs with water jet disruptors and weapon mounts for 50 PBLGs and two RoVs with water jet disruptors and weapon mounts's use in security situation.

article_title: Police To Get Pepper Ball Launching Guns, Remotely Operated Vehicles
event: "Tenders have been invited from manufacturers or manufacturers's authorised dealers for the supply of pepper ball launchers and remotely operated vehicles," an official said.According to the specification, 50 PBLGs must be capable of launching pepper-filled projectile at a particular distance to do room intervention, mob dispersal and must be less lethal in nature.pepper ball launching guns (PBLGs) should also have PAVA rounds along with hopper magazines, High Pressure Air (HPA)cylinders and under barrel source of power, the specification said.pepper ball launching guns (PBLGs) must be .68 caliber launchers and powered by high pressure of air at the rate of 3,000 psi with the ability to fire six pepper balls per second.PAVA stands for Pelargonic Acid Vanillyl Amide, also called Nonivamide.

article_title: Police To Get Pepper Ball Launching Guns, Remotely Operated Vehicles
event: Pelargonic Acid Vanillyl Amide, also called Nonivamide is an organic compound found in natural chilli pepper.On the Scoville scale (measures pungency of peppers and chillies), Pelargonic Acid Vanillyl Amide, also called Nonivamide is categorised as "above peak", meaning Pelargonic Acid Vanillyl Amide, also called Nonivamide will "severely irritate and paralyse" humans, but the irritation and paralysis will remain "temporary" in nature.

article_title: Police To Get Pepper Ball Launching Guns, Remotely Operated Vehicles
event: According to the specification of RoVs, RoVs must be cable of carrying out Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EoD) surveillance inside aircraft, trains, buildings, installations and bus stands, an official added.

event: An unemployed person in some aspect has become an object to be helped and sometimes ridiculed.

event: The education of many have been called to question due to this syndrome.When a man has no job in spite of a man's best efforts, even some of a man's close friends begin to doubt a man's education and capability.

event: You would have attended many interview sessions but to no avail.

event: You can't contribute anything among your friends and those who contribute something remind you of your inability to do so.

event: No matter how beautiful your idea seems, your idea won't be taken.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: What did you contribute is always the annoying question.

event: Some without the fear of God will tell you if you want to remain an unemployed person all your life as if you enjoy being one.When one goes for an interview, those you are better  than in all sphere will mock you simply because those you are better  than in all sphere have a job and you have none.When your landlord appears for rent you are helpless.

event: You may have been accommodated by a friend who is also facing the harsh reality of life but you want to help out but can't.

event: During An unemployed person's time of job search and being accommodated by others, An unemployed person can be exposed to all manner of things.Being unemployed is not crime and should not be punishable by mockery and ridicule.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: It is a phase that all genuine persons seeking jobs will pass.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: God would not have allowed you to go through all the pains of academic pursuit to end up a laughing stock.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: The delay in getting married due to lack of a job can be disappointing but when a man losses hope a man is finished.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: Those who have jobs will not keep Those who have jobs forever and neither will you remain unemployed all your life.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: To everything in life there is a season says the holy bookDo not let the harsh treatment you received during a season stand on your way to helping people when the chains of unemployment would have been broken.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: Those same people who taught being unemployed was a curse would come and seek your help.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: Help Those same people who taught being unemployed was a curse but let Those same people who taught being unemployed was a curse know that everyman's morning starts the time everyman's wakes up.

event: Assure your parents that your parents's investment on you will pay the highest dividend.

article_title: Pain of Being Unemployed
event: Repair the broken family bond and thank God for letting you know true friends..Unemployment is a time bomb our nation is battling with.

event: Parents spend millions of cedis to educate Parents's wards yet their wards come out unemployed even after gaining all the necessary training.

article_title: Bill To Designate Individual As Terrorist Approved
event: NEW DELHI — The Parliament on Friday approved an amendment to the anti-terror law to give powers to the central government to designate an individual as terrorist and seize an individual's properties.While Lok Sabha had passed the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, 2019 that seeks to amend the anti-terror law on July 24, Rajya Sabha approved the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, 2019 that seeks to amend the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 after rejecting an opposition-sponsored motion to send the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, 2019 that seeks to amend the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 to select committee.The House passed an amendment to the anti-terror law to give powers to the central government to designate an individual as terrorist and seize his properties with 147 votes in favour and 42 against an amendment to the anti-terror law to give powers to the central government to designate an individual as terrorist and seize his properties.Rajya Sabha also rejected an opposition-sponsored motion to send it to select committee select committee with 104 votes against an opposition-sponsored motion to send it to select committee as compared to 85 in favour.Replying to a debate on an amendment to the anti-terror law to give powers to the central government to designate an individual as terrorist and seize his properties, Home Minister Amit Shah said a four-level scrutiny has been provided in an amendment to the anti-terror law to give powers to the central government to designate an individual as terrorist and seize his properties and no human rights will be violated.Home Minister Amit Shah said declaring individuals as terrorists is required as individuals float different organisations once an institution is banned.Individuals can be declared terrorists if Individuals commit or participate in acts of terrorism, prepare or promote terror, Home Minister Amit Shah said.an amendment to the anti-terror law to give powers to the central government to designate an individual as terrorist and seize his properties will expedite prosecution in terror cases, Home Minister Amit Shah said.Terrorism has no religion, terrorists are against humanity, Home Minister Amit Shah said seeking support of all parties to support stringent laws against terrorism.Responding to opposition concerns of the anti-terror law being misused, Home Minister Amit Shah said no one's human rights will be violated as a four-stage scrutiny with provision for appeal has been prescribed when individuals are declared terrorists.Elaborating on the track record of the National Investigation Agency (NIA), Home Minister Amit Shah said out of 278 terror cases registered by the National Investigation Agency (NIA), charge sheet has been filed in 204 cases.

article_title: Bill To Designate Individual As Terrorist Approved
event: Of the 54 cases where judgements have come, conviction has been there in 48.Track record of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) in conviction in terror cases is outstanding, Home Minister Amit Shah said.

Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra has preserved 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra's travel permit like a holy relic.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Laminated crisply inside a sheet of transparent polyethylene, his travel permit carries photos of 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra, 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra's parents, and two siblings.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: It was his travel permit that ensured the safe entry of 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra and 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra's family into India following a failed uprising against Chinese rule by Tibetans in 1959.In March 1959, an uprising led by the region’s overwhelmingly Buddhist population invited a brutal crackdown from the Chinese government.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: a brutal crackdown from the Chinese government also led to the exile of the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama, to India.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Fearing persecution by the Chinese government, thousands of Buddhists followed the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama's footsteps and settled in India.“But Kharmohra and his family chose [to settle in] Kashmir, because Kashmir’s where from Kharmohra and his family's forefathers are,” 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra told The Diplomat from 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra's government-allotted two-room quarter in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Kashmir.his family was among the 129 Tibetan Muslim families allowed by the Chinese government in Tibet to return to India.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: allowed came following tense deliberations between the Indian consulate in Tibet and the Chinese government.A note given by the Ministry of External Affairs in New Delhi, to the Embassy of the Chinese government in India on September 24, 1959 reads:…persons whose permanent domicile remained in the region’s and who visited India from time to time and whose parents or one of whose grandparents were born in India, are potential citizens of India.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: It is this group of persons, who have stated repeatedly to the Chinese government that this group of persons were Indian citizens.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: this group of persons have apparently submitted applications in writing for registration as Indian citizens and are entitled to claim the benefits of Indian nationality in accordance with the provisions laid down under the Constitution and the Citizenship Act.Once Kharmohra and his family were allowed entry to India, his family spent some time in Kalimpong district of West Bengal, following which his family made his family's way to Kashmir Valley.“We were initially settled under makeshifts tents inside Eidgah ground in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: However, once the winter set in, his family were shifted to a government accommodation by the authorities,” 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra recalled.Kashmiris in TibetExperts argue that Tibetan Muslims, who formed a minority in Tibet, trace Tibetan Muslims, who formed a minority in Tibet's origins to four main regions surrounding Tibet: Kashmir, Ladakh, China, and Nepal.“Before 1959, there were approximately 3,000 Tibetan Muslims living in Central Tibet.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: approximately 3,000 Tibetan Muslims living in Central Tibet were the descendants of Muslim merchants who came to Tibet from Kashmir, Ladakh, Nepal and China, mostly between the fourteenth and seventeenth centuries, married Tibetan women, and settled there.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: approximately 3,000 Tibetan Muslims living in Central Tibet spoke Tibetan and followed most Tibetan customs,” writes Dr. Alexander Berzin, a Buddhist teacher and translator, in an article on the history of Tibetan Muslims.According to 63-year-old Tibetan Muslim Amanullah Kharmohra, Kashmiri-origin Muslims in Tibet were known as Kachee Yul by local Tibetans.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: In native Tibetan language, Kachee means Kashmiri and Yul means country.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Another distinctive character of Tibetan Muslims was Tibetan Muslims's Kashmiri caste names like Lone, Mir, Ganaie, and Butt.A Slice of Tibet in KashmirToday, Kashmir Valley is home to more than 1,500 Tibetan Muslims.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Living in government-allotted quarters and houses constructed on leased land, more than 1,500 Tibetan Muslims are particularly concentrated in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir's old city.Even though the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir has been asserting the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir's Kashmiri roots, asserting has not translated into permanent citizenship of the state of Jammu and Kashmir for the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: This effectively disqualifies the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir from applying for government jobs and owning immovable property.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Under the Constitution, only the Jammu and Kashmir state legislature has the power to define “permanent residents” of the state of Jammu and confer on “permanent residents” of the state special rights like government jobs, acquisition of property, and scholarships.That’s the primary reason, community leaders assert, that the state of Jammu has prevented the economic uplift of the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: “None of us have a government job nor can us buy property.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Most of us work in low-paying private jobs or start us's own businesses,” said Hafeez Ahmad, a community member in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir.In such a situation, the traditional cuisine of Tibetans and cloth work has come handy.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Even though Tibetans's population is not so significant, the impact of Tibetan culture and cuisine is visible across Kashmir Valley.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: For example, restaurants selling Tibetan food are a common sight.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Similarly, Tibetan embroidery, locally known as Bota Tilla, is an essential part of Kashmiri fashion and a must have for newlywed brides.“During the first three years, I struggled a lot.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: There’s no concept of Tibetan food in Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: But slowly, Tibetan food picked up,” said I.It was in 2005 when I decided to give up on embroidery work and try something new.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: “I's parents knew the cooking of Tibetan traditional food, so My parents gave Tibetan traditional food a try.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Today, three Tibetan families derive three Tibetan families's livelihood from this venture,” I explained.Born in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir, I has picked up almost every aspect of local Kashmiri culture.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: I speaks fluent Kashmiri and sits with I's customers and asks about his customers's well-being in local style.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Like most of the Tibetan families, I even prefers local Kashmiri cuisine at home.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: “I am Tibetan only by I's appearance.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Otherwise, I am pure Kashmiri… Kharmohra and his family eat rice like Kashmiris do and also have nun-chai (salt tea),” I said.Still, this doesn’t mean I has no love for Tibet.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: one of the oldest and most popular Tibetan restaurants in Srinagar is adorned with the landscape portraits of Lhasa and iconic Potala palace.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: “Kharmohra and his family also hold the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama in huge respect as the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama’s the King of Tibet.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: It was the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama who had given Kashmiri Muslims land in Tibet to settle there centuries ago,” I said.Cultural AssimilationDecades of sharing their home in Kashmir has seen their drifting closer to the culture of local Kashmiri society.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: During Kashmiri weddings, a multi-course meal, locally known as Waazwan, is served to guests.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Tibetan Muslims have also taken up the meal to celebrate weddings – although with a caveat.“While around 8-10 dishes are prepared in local Kashmiri weddings, the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir have strictly established a code of not preparing more than four dishes,” said 73-year-old Abdul Rehman Lone, a community elder.When it comes to dress, there’s hardly any difference between the locals and Tibetan Muslims.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir's traditional dress, the chuba, an ankle-length robe, is worn only during the weddings.The Tibetan government in exile in Dharmsala, India, has also shown some interest in the issues concerning the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: For example, the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama lent financial help to build the infrastructure of the Tibetan public school in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: A community health center in Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir is also aided by the department of health of the Central Tibetan Administration (CTA).“Around 680 children are enrolled in the Tibetan public school in Srinagar but more than 85 percent of the Tibetan public school in Srinagar are local Kashmiris.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Even though the most prominent Tibetan Buddhist spiritual leader, the 14th Dalai Lama helped us a lot, the Tibetan public school in Srinagar is being run by the Tibetan Muslim Youth Federation, a nongovernment organization run by local Tibetan Muslim youth,” explained Masood Butt, the administrator in charge of the Tibetan public school in Srinagar.According to sociologist Dr. Adfer Rashid Shah at New Delhi's Jamia Millia Islamia University, the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir has culturally assimilated in the Kashmiri society but not “psychologically.”“Kashmiris have accepted the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir and in the last six decades the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir have lived here, there has been no friction between local Kashmiris and the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir have mixed with the local community but there’s still a gap.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir think the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir are distinct; think’s why the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir are distinct.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Otherwise, total cultural assimilation is possible in such a time,” sociologist Dr. Adfer Rashid Shah at New Delhi’s Jamia Millia Islamia University, told The Diplomat.One indication of a gap finally being bridged is the increasing trend of cross marriages between local Kashmiris and Tibetan Muslims.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: According to the community members, more than half a dozen such marriages have taken place in recent years.No Scope for GrowthWith no prospects of getting a government job and the lack of private sector in the state of Jammu and Kashmir, the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir is witnessing increased migration by educated youth to mainland Indian cities like Delhi as well as Gulf countries.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: More often than not, educated youth end up taking grueling call-center jobs to support educated youth and take up further studies.Every year, I spends five months in Delhi to sell jackets.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: During the rest of the year, I works at I's father’s embroidery shop in the Eidgah area of Srinagar, the summer capital city of Indian-administered Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: After passing I's Class 10 examinations, I quit I's studies to support I's .I am the only son of My parents and his father’s was not able to handle his father’s embroidery shop in the Eidgah area of Srinagar like before.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Initially, I took up a job as a salesman but eventually I learned embroidery work.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Life wouldn’t have been different even if I studied further because I am not eligible to get a job here,” I explained.This realization is not lost on the parents of the Tibetan Muslim youngsters.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: 40-year-old Salma is anxious about 40-year-old Salma's son’s future.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Working as a cook at a local Tibetan restaurant, 40-year-old Salma and 40-year-old Salma's husband eked out enough to sustain Salma and her husband and Salma and her husband's only child, Ehtisham.“Now, her son’s’s in her son’s's 12th class.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Salma and her husband are planning to send her son’s to Delhi to take up some private job and continue her son’s's studies,” 40-year-old Salma rued, adding 40-year-old Salma has “no other option.sociologist Dr. Adfer Rashid Shah at New Delhi’s Jamia Millia Islamia University believes the conflict in Kashmir has overshadowed the problems faced by Tibetan Muslims in Kashmir and prevented solutions.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: “Kashmir is a war-zone where uncertainty about everything looms large.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: In a scenario where the majority population of the region’s is treated as second- or third-class citizens, the expectation that someone will speak about the plight of Tibetan Muslims is laughable,” according to sociologist Dr. Adfer Rashid Shah at New Delhi’s Jamia Millia Islamia University.“The main issue in Kashmir is conflict and all the other issues are automatically sidelined,” sociologist Dr. Adfer Rashid Shah at New Delhi’s Jamia Millia Islamia University said, adding “all the other issues's issues will remain unaddressed.”But while the political uncertainty in the region’s forms the larger discourse in Kashmir Valley, sociologist Dr. Adfer Rashid Shah at New Delhi’s Jamia Millia Islamia University argues that there’s also an “academic apathy and scholarly disinterest” about the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir.Broken Families73-year-old Aisha was just 13 when Families73-year-old Aisha's left Tibet for India.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Families73-year-old Aisha's father, Haji Abdul Qadir Jami, was one of the several Tibetan Muslim leaders who had risen up against the Chinese government to demand the several Tibetan Muslim leaders who had risen up against the Chinese government to demand their rights's rights.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: At the time of his family's migration, the Chinese government kept Her father, Haji Abdul Qadir Jami in detention along with four other Muslim leaders.“Chinese authorities told Kharmohra and his family to leave and assured Kharmohra and his family that Her father, Haji Abdul Qadir Jami will join Kharmohra and his family near the Tibet border.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Families73-year-old Aisha along with Families73-year-old Aisha's mother and four sisters waited for a week but Her father, Haji Abdul Qadir Jami didn’t turn up.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Once Kharmohra and his family reached Kalimpong in West Bengal, Kharmohra and his family waited there as well.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: waited stretched to seven years.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Finally, Kharmohra and his family moved to Kashmir.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Her father, Haji Abdul Qadir Jami never came and Kharmohra and his family didn’t know what happened to Her father, Haji Abdul Qadir Jami,” Families73-year-old Aisha recalled.Families73-year-old Aisha’s not an isolated story.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Almost every other family of the Tibetan Muslim community in Kashmir has some relatives still living in Tibet.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: The members have little avenues to hear about The members's family members’ condition or even to know if their family members’ are still alive.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Over the years, strict censorship and tedious travel permit processes have meant little or no connection between the divided families.“My deceased elder brother’s two sons came to see his family in the mid-80s but since then, there has been no contact with “My deceased elder brother’s two sons.

article_title: Tibetan Muslims: Kashmir’s Eternal Refugees
event: Even though “My know “My have “My's family and relatives there, [it’s as though] my brother’s family and relatives simply don’t exist,” said “My.The feature which first appeared in The Diplomat, is reproduced here with the permission of the author.

event: BANGKOK —External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday made it clear to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's American counterpart Mike Pompeo that any discussion on Kashmir, if at all warranted, will only be with Pakistan and only bilaterally, days after US President Donald Trump offered to mediate on Kashmir.External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is in BANGKOK to attend a number of conferences, including the ASEAN-India Ministerial Meeting, the 9th East Asia Summit Foreign Ministers' Meeting, the 26th ASEAN Regional Forum and the 10th Mekong Ganga Cooperation Ministerial Meeting.

event: "Have conveyed to his American counterpart Mike Pompeo this morning in clear terms that any discussion on Kashmir, if at all warranted, will only be with Pakistan and only bilaterally," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted.External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met his American counterpart Mike Pompeo on the sidelines of the second day of 9th East Asia Summit Foreign Ministers meet in BANGKOK.

article_title: Any Discussion On Kashmir Will Only Be With Pak, Bilaterally: Jaishankar

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: SRINAGAR — Hurriyat Conference (M) chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq has said that the situation developing on ground over the past week with deployment thousands of additional troops has created panic amongst the people and the people have become apprehensive of something happening in the territory.Mirwaiz addressing the Friday congregation at historic Jama Masjid in SRINAGAR said that various speculations were rife including removal of 35-A to change the demography of the territory.

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: Mirwaiz said that for the past three years there had been a great push towards removal of 35-A since various Public Interest Litigation (PILs) were filed in the Indian Supreme Court to challenge removal of 35-A.

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: Mirwaiz said that like past, the people and leadership had to be ready to resist every attempt to undo removal of 35-A.Mirwaiz said, such measures will not change the reality that Kashmir is a dispute and has to be resolved.

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: Mirwaiz said that the whole word was asking India and Pakistan to resolve Kashmir and there were also offers of mediation.

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: “If the leadership of India and Pakistan Pakistan are really concerned for the leadership of India and Pakistan's people the leadership of India and Pakistan will show statesmanship and agree to talk.

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: Ultimately it is only India, Pakistan and the Kashmiris that can reach a lasting resolution,” Mirwaiz maintained.Mirwaiz said, “Hurriyat Conference (M have always strongly advocated dialogue among stakeholders, a fact borne out by Hurriyat Conference (M's sincere push for dialogue among stakeholders and participation in dialogue 2004 onwards.

article_title: Situation Alarming, Says Mirwaiz
event: Hurriyat Conference (M only believe in and have always advocated peaceful means of struggle for the resolution of KashmirKashmir .Mirwaiz said that current hostilities at the Line of Control (LoC) were also resulting in loss of previous lives on both sides and there was always a fear of escalation between the nuclear armed neighbours.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: There should be a systematic platform, a framework and parameters to judge the performance of representatives - the pro-people framework is the need of hour Citizens have needs and interests that Citizens expect governments to address.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: In democratic societies, political parties aggregate these demands from diverse groups and articulate public policy options to respond to needs and interests that they expect governments to address.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: Elections provide voters the opportunity to choose among political parties offering distinct proposals for addressing societal needs.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: Through their efforts to control and influence public policy, their play an intermediary role; linking citizens to citizens's representatives, and serving as the primary channel for holding the government accountable for the government's performance.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: Thus, party policy development – the process whereby political parties formulate and seek to implement political parties's proposals for governmental actions – is central to the healthy functioning of a representative democracy.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: Political parties face a number of challenges in fulfilling Political parties's policy formulation role.

article_title: Pestiferous Politics and unjustifiable political benefits
event: Particularly in fledgling democracies, parties may: lack clear ideologies; fail to articulate distinctive and coherent policy proposals; have weak structures that remain dormant outside election campaign periods; have narrow and/ or shifting support bases that are defined by personal, regional or ethnic ties; and struggle to conduct cohesive action in Parliament/Assemblies.

article_title: Ready To Respond To Any 'Misadventure' By India: Pak
event: ISLAMABAD  — Pakistan on Sunday warned India that Pakistan is ready to respond to any "misadventure or aggression" by the Indian forces, as Pakistan's top civil and military leadership discussed the sudden spike in tensions with New Delhi during a meeting of the National Security Committee.Prime Minister Imran Khan called a meeting of the National Security Committee after the Army alleged that India used cluster bombs to target the civilian population in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.the Army on Saturday termed as "lies and deceit" Pakistan's allegations that Indian troops used cluster bombs targeting civilians along the Line of Control.a meeting of the National Security Committee the National Security Committee was attended by Defence Minister Pervez Khattak, Foreign Minister Shah Mehmood Qureshi, Interior Minister Brig (Retd) Ijaz Shah, three services chiefs, chief of ISI and other senior officials.A statement issued by the PM Office after a meeting of the National Security Committee said that Pakistan is "ready to defend Pakistan against any Indian misadventure or aggression" and will continue to provide all out "diplomatic, moral and political support" to the people of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.a meeting of the National Security Committee a meeting of the National Security Committee criticised "Indian actions which would have adverse implications for regional and international peace."

article_title: Ready To Respond To Any 'Misadventure' By India: Pak
event: Pakistan reiterates that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir is a long standing unresolved international dispute which needs peaceful resolution.

article_title: Ready To Respond To Any 'Misadventure' By India: Pak
event: Pakistan therefore urges India to come forth to resolve Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in accordance with the aspirations of the people of Kashmir, Pakistan said.Pakistan said that the recent "buildup of forces" is adding "fuel to fire".

article_title: Ready To Respond To Any 'Misadventure' By India: Pak
event: "The forum strongly condemned such Indian strategy at this time when Pakistan and the international community are focused on resolving the Afghan conflict," A statement issued by the PM Office after the meeting said.the recent "buildup of forces" will increase the levels of violence and turn this area into a flashpoint and a destabilising factor in the midst of two strategically capable neighbouring countries, A statement issued by the PM Office after the meeting said.Prime Minister Imran Khan said that India is totally disregarding international obligations and India's "arrogance will only result in heightening the conflict dynamics in the region."

article_title: Ready To Respond To Any 'Misadventure' By India: Pak
event: Prime Minister Imran Khan invited attention of world leaders and international bodies towards "irresponsible, unilateral and irrational behaviour" of Indian leadership.Prime Minister Imran Khan concluded a meeting of the National Security Committee by reaffirming Pakistan's resolve to respond to any Indian misadventure or aggression with full support of Pakistan.Earlier, in a series of tweets, Prime Minister Imran Khan said that it's time for US President Donald Trump to mediate on Pakistan-occupied KashmirPakistan-occupied Kashmir .US President Donald Trump offered to mediate on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

article_title: Ready To Respond To Any 'Misadventure' By India: Pak
event: This is the time to do so as situation deteriorates there and along the LOC with new aggressive actions being taken" by Indian forces, Prime Minister Imran Khan said, adding that this has the "potential to blow up into a regional crisis".Last month, US President Donald Trump had made a stunning claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked US President Donald Trump to mediate on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir during their meeting in Japan, evoking a sharp reaction from India which denied Prime Minister Narendra Modi making any such request.In another tweet, Prime Minister Imran Khan said the people of Kashmir "must be allowed to exercise the people of Kashmir's right to self determination according to UN SC resolutions."

event: "The only road to peace & security in South Asia runs through a peaceful & just settlement of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir," Prime Minister Imran Khan tweeted.Prime Minister Imran Khan's also sought support of the Opposition on tension with India.

article_title: Education facilities
event: In the last few years, with deteriorating “security” situation in Kashmir, the government has painfully tried to provide some immunity to the education.

article_title: Education facilities
event: The focus of the government and educational bodies in Kashmir has largely been on completing syllabus in minimum number of work days.

article_title: Education facilities
event: The uncertainty, which has recurred in the last few years, has forced the school authorities to make full use of the work days that have considerably shrunk due to eruptive situation.

article_title: Education facilities
event: As priorities have been set, education has been suffering on several fronts, including lack of even basic facilities in schools.

article_title: Education facilities
event: Contaminated water and poor sanitation facilities in the government run institutions of our valley have been adversely affecting not only the children but the entire area that the government run institutions of our valley are located in.

article_title: Education facilities
event: According to the official data, majority of the educational institutions, particularly in rural areas lack basic facilities.

article_title: Education facilities
event: With almost all schools - primary, secondary, higher secondary –facing the same kind of adverse conditions one is compelled to raise the question about the way administration and education departments are working on such issues.

article_title: Education facilities
event: Absence of these basic facilities not only affects the health of the students but makes the overall atmosphere grim that in turn hits the educational standard of almost all schools - primary, secondary, higher secondary.

article_title: Education facilities
event: Absence of these basic facilities also affects the quality of mind that is very important in an educational set up.

article_title: Education facilities
event: The all important concern in this is whether the government wants to better the performance of the schools run by the government, for which the government must provide the students with adequate level of infrastructure.

article_title: Education facilities
event: The mismatch between existing infrastructure and the required needs of any school is blatant.

article_title: Education facilities
event: We must not forget how pathetically government schools perform in board examinations.

article_title: Education facilities
event: Often when the results are declared we place the blame on the teaching staff and try to roll the matter up.

article_title: Education facilities
event: If we take the trouble of looking deeper into it, the pathetic condition of government-run schools will be conspicuously visible.

article_title: Education facilities
event: It doesn't need any expert advice to tell us that we can have good dividends in terms of the performance of our students if only we make available the right kind of environment and pump in the required inputs.

article_title: Education facilities
event: If we don't provide even the basic facilities why should we expect the students to perform equally well as those in private institutions?

article_title: Education facilities
event: Secondly, the finances of the private institute are not even a patch on the government run education department.
